loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents. This young woman works in an accessories shop as a saleswoman. Her employment is very important because with her income, she is able to satisfy her life needs and help her parents pay her university fees. As with the majority of Lebanese students, her story illustrates the day-to-day challenges involved in running a business while at the same time pursuing an education. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for her courses at the university. She is studying accounting and this is her first year. In the future, she is planning to start her career by providing accounting reports to member of her community and local companies to earn income.

loans.use: to pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Chhuy

texts.en: Chhuy M., age 27, is a local farmer who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia.  She earns a living by raising pigs. Since 2006, she has had this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She is married with three children who are learning in public school. Her husband helps her in raising pigs. In order to earn extra income, Chhuy M. will be using the loan to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.en: Wilbert I.'s main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. He is 23 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Brgy. Curifang, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Wilbert has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) when he sells one of his pigs. In 2010, Wilbert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Wilbert is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Here is Alpha S., a small scale businessman in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Alpha bakes and sells breads. He has been in this profession for many years now. He is requesting for a loan of SLL 2,000,000.00 from SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy bags of flour, yeast, oil, etc. in large quantity in order to produce a larger amount of breads. 

Alpha who was born in Kabala is married to businesswoman and the couple has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school.

loans.use: Buys bags of flour, yeast, oil, etc. in large quantity in order to produce a larger amount of breads

loans.name: Dorca

texts.en:
Dorca is a resident of Nyamira town in Western Kenya.  She is a mother of four children, aged between thirteen and five. She practices mixed farming, selling her produce of tea, eggs, milk and vegetables to the local market. She employs one farmhand.

Dorca has requested a loan for 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use the income from this loan to pay school fees for her four children and to improve their living standards. She is also focusing on expanding her poultry business and venture into the wholesale business for eggs.

She notes that diseases are her greatest challenges, especially for her poultry business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is part of 47-year-old Nget N.’s daily routine. She and her husband always plant their rice crops following the dry and rainy seasons. Nget N. also makes bamboo baskets for the market. She is the mother of five unmarried children, three of whom are employed in different jobs.

Nget N.'s house is in the repair process but it is not yet finished because she doesn't have enough savings to continue. To deal with this problem, Nget N. is asking for a loan to buy wood to finish repairing her house. She hopes to use the rest of the loan to buy rice for the family to eat.

loans.use: to buy wood to finish repairing her house

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en:
Abdukarim is married and has two children. He has a small store where he sells fabrics used for sewing national dresses. The business is located in a famous central market of Gafurov. Abdukarim has been in this business for 10 years already. He runs it with his mother, who encouraged him to start this business and is very supportive even now. 

Abdukarim is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase more goods. This business has its high season very soon. Abdukarim believes that opening second retail outlet will give him an advantage over his competitors and provide his family with more profit in the coming spring season.         


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for resale

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim is a farmer, devoted not only to his work but also to being the father of a family. Working hard in the horse-breeding business, he takes his animals out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but love of family provides him with motivation and gives his work meaning. His wife helps him with the business. Naim now wants to improve his situation by expanding his barn and increasing his stock of horses, measures which in the long run will provide a better income.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase horses

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 34 years old, married to Elisha S. who is a farmer, and they are blessed with three children aged 10, 6 and 4 years old.  Dorcas sells secondhand clothes in Itigo market and has been in the business for a period of four years, getting a monthly income of about $63.

Dorcas has borrowed a loan from KADET LTD of 10,000 KES, this being her 1st loan. She wishes to use the money to purchase one bale of used clothes to add to her current stock. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase more stock for the business and to educate her children.

Her hope is to see her business grow and to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Elvira Francisca

texts.es: Elvira es una madre de familia de 39 años, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ambos están a su cargo. Desde hace 16 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de destace de res, la ubicación de su negocio es en la terminal de buses, en donde transitan varios clientes de Elvira buscando una gran variedad de carnes. Ella tiene varios financiamientos y todos han sido destinados para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de hueso, ubre, carne molida, lomo, entre otros tipos de carnes. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica ya que en estos tiempos es muy difícil porque hay mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Elvira, 39, is a single mother; she has two children in her care.  For 16 years she has been a beef butcher.  Her business is located in the bus terminal where several of her customers pass through looking for a large variety of meats.  She’s had several loans that were all used to improve her business.  

She is asking for this working capital loan to buy bones, utter, ground meat and loin, among other cuts of meat.  Her wish is to stay in business since these days it’s very difficult because there is a lot of competition.

loans.use: to buy bones, utter, ground meat and loin, among other cuts of meat.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 52 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 34 years old and the youngest is 20. 

Perla is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She grows rice and cassava. Perla rents a stall in the market to sell her harvest. Perla works hard to provide for the needs of her family. She also wants to have savings for future emergencies.

Perla's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre de familia de  43 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Esta familia tienes muy buenas referencias personales y muchos deseos de superación. Nancy y su esposo luchan siempre por el buen desarrollo de sus pequeños niños.

 Nancy se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino los cuales cría para comercializarlos en su zona, especialmente en el mercado de la comunidad. Ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su esposo es agricultor y en esta casa es evidente la buena relación familiar que existe dentro de ella.

Nancy solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus vacunos, que le permitirá  venderlos  a un mejor precio  para seguir creciendo en su actividad.

Nancy agradecería mucho este crédito pues estaría contribuyendo al desarrollo económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 43 year-old mother who lives with her husband and two dependent children in Tambogrande district, Piura.  This family has very good personal references and a great desire to get ahead.  Nancy and her husband always work hard for the benefit of their young children.

Nancy raises cattle and sheep to sell in her area, especially in the community market.  She helps her husband with their household expenses.  Nancy's husband is a farmer and the good family relationship that exists between them in this household is very clear.

Nancy is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for fattening her cattle.  This will allow her to sell them at a better price so that she can continue growing in her business.

Nancy would be very grateful for this loan as it will help contribute towards the financial development of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her cattle

loans.name: Niru

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Niru. She is married and has three children ages 23,  21 and 17.  

In 2001, she established  her cow raising business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Niru plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD .50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires. It can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Kacerere Women's Group B

texts.en:
40-year-old Catherine has been in the agricultural business for close to 15 years now. 

Agriculture has been Uganda's economic backbone since the early sixties and for many Ugandans it is their premier source of livelihood. Catherine, who is happily married with 6 kids, says she has no regrets as to why she decided to bear a hand in this business venture. By and large, she says the business where she mostly grows and sells bananas and cassava has been profitable.Through the 15 years, she has learnt a lot about how to cultivate and harvest high-grade bananas and cassava.

She has also learnt the best methods of manure application to ensure better yields. Her business, which began with the persuasion of a close friend, has grown beyond her expectations. But, she says, it has not come easy as she has had to work extremely hard in her farming gardens to ensure this comes to pass. Monthly, she says, this business generates shillings 1,600,000 in profit. 

Catherine says she is going to use this Kiva loan money to buy more land to expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase land to expand her agricultural business.

loans.name: Emil

texts.en: Emil is married and has one child. He sells wholesale foodstuffs at his grocery store. His location is very good and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. In this business for eight years, he knows a good deal about it. Emil is also a very punctual and detail-oriented person, character traits that help him in his business. Emil can always figure out how many supplies he needs to ensure they are always fresh and of sufficient quantity to meet customer needs. Emil has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional wholesale products to sell

loans.name: Maribe

texts.en:
Maribe is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Maribe has a retail shop that sells breads, candies and biscuits. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Maribe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maribe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Raul De Jesus

texts.es:
Desde el año 2001 Raúl tiene su propia empresa donde elabora productos de aseo que son distribuidos y comercializados en vaR. barR. de la ciudad. 

Su empresa con el tiempo ha crecido gracias a la calidad del producto que fábrica, con su empresa el ha logrado sostener sus 3 hijos y les ha brindado una buena calidad de vida y estudio.

Raul quiere que su empresa crezca y así poder no solo incrementar sus ingresos sino poder comprar un carrito para realizar la distribución, sin embargo para lograrlo necesita incrementar sus insumos para así poder aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Raúl has had his own company since 2001, where he makes cleaning products and sells them in various neighborhoods around the city.

His company has grown over time, thanks to the quality of the products he makes.  It has allowed him to support his three children and has provided a good quality of life and study.

Raúl wants to grow his company and increase his income and would like to buy a cart to make his deliveries, however to do so he needs to increase his supplies to be able to increase production.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 37 years old. He is single, ambitious, and an entrepreneur willing to succeed. For the last seven years, he has been running a salon to make ends meet. He wants in the next five years to have opened up another beauty point to increase his income. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a blow dryer, hair chemicals and hair braids. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making funds to use in his business more accessible.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, hair chemicals and hair braids

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia  tiene como actividad la venta D. comida en una D. las  ex trancas que tiene la ciudad D. La paz,  tiene una pequeña  pensión donD.  quedan dos paradas D. minibús a una cuadra queda un  centro D. salud  y  dos cuadras mas arriba queda el reten policial y al frente D. su negocio quedan varios talleres D. reparación  D. automóviles por tal motivo la Sra. Toribia tiene mucha clientela, su esposo trabaja como conductor D. automóvil en una mina aurífera en  los Yungas, actualmente los dos hijos D. los señores ya son mayores D. edad y son independientes, el crédito que  solicito es  para refaccionar el ambiente D. su pensión y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Toribia runs a small diner on the outskirts of the city of La Paz.  It is near two minibus stops and not far from a health center, police station and several auto repair shops across the street.  She has many customers.  Her husband works as a driver for a gold mine in Los Yungas.  The couple's two children are adults and live independently.  Toribia is requesting a loan to repair her restaurant and offer her customers better service.

loans.use: To repair her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Ángeles tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene un hijo ya casado el cual vive con ella, doña Ángeles se dedica a la venta de frituras, abarrotes, dulces etc. en su casa, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 16 años y lo puso para sacar a su hijo adelante que en aquel tiempo estudiaba y de ahí sacaba ella para pagar los gastos de el. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para invertirlo en su tienda la cual la tiene en su casa y comprara azúcar, leche, huevo, dulces, jabón, pañales etc. dice que surtirá en diferentes tiendas donde le den precios bajos para a la hora de venderlos tener algo de ganancias. Nos platica que es la primera vez que esta en una financiera y que la tiene muy contenta por que através del préstamo podrá tener su negocio surtido ya que le hace falta para no seguir perdiendo clientes ya que casi ahorita no tiene su negocio surtido. La meta que tiene Ángeles es poner una cenaduría ya que cerca de su casa no lo hay y así tener algo de ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Angeles  is 43 years old. She is a single mother and her son, who is already married, lives with her. Angeles sells fried snacks, groceries, sweets and so on from her home. She has had the business for 16 years. She set it up to support his son, who was studying at the time, as the business profits covered his expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in her store, located in her home. She will buy sugar, milk, eggs, sweets, soap, nappies and other goods. She will buy the supplies in different shops, wherever they give her the best prices, so as to ensure a profit when selling them on. She says it's the first time that she has requested a loan and that she's very happy because it will enable her to stock up her business so as not to lose customers, because at the moment she doesn't have enough stock. 

Angeles' goal is to set up a cafe because there are none near her house and it would provide her with some extra income.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Karbeh

texts.en: Karbeh is 28 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and has three children between three and seven years old, all of whom live at home and are currently in school. For the past eight years, she has been selling milk, oil, tissue, soap and chloride. She is the only one who has a shop in her community. She makes a lot of profit. One of the problems she faces is a shortage of goods. She like her business because of the way people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, oil, soap, tissues, and chloride for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase milk, oil, soap, tissues, and chloride for her business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun, who is 43 years old, resides in Kampongcham province with her family.  She and her husband work in a factory and earn $9 a day. She has three children, one of whom is in school. Their second child earns $2.50 a day by repairing motorbikes and their third child earns $2.50 a day as an artist. Every month, Oun spends $70 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy equipment for her son so that he can open his own shop for repairing motorbikes. If all goes well, their son plans to expand his income by enlarging his shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment for their son to start a new career.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a 61-year-old Lebanese, married woman living with her husband and three children. She has been working as a tailor for the past 30 years. In 1990 she established a tailoring business from her home. Despite her older age, Nawal is still working and she specializes in sewing clothes and repairing ruined ones. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy textiles and tailoring supplies needed to increase her business productivity. She hopes to further expand her business in the coming years, which she is sure will return higher profits.

loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Cristo Campesino Group

texts.es: La socia Felicitas es viuda tiene 69 años D. edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos ya independientes y vive en el poblado D. Huacaytaqui, la socia pertenece a este banco comunal y ella trabajaba sola criando animales menores como cuyes, pollos D. forma casera y tradicional en su patio y los cuyes en su cocina, la socia empezó a crecer D. forma progresiva y aumento su galpon D. pollos y compro cuyes al por mayor, ahora la socia tiene bastante acogida y el negocio para ella sola le ha sido muy rentable pero ya necesitaba mas manos entonces su hijo el mayor D. todos le esta dando la mano el compro un camión con la venta D. unos terrrenos y pueD. trasladar los pollos y cuyes a las diferentes ferias, la socia tambien es muy solicitada y la viene a buscar hasta su casa en el cual implemento su galpon en jaulas D. 100 y cajas medianas para los cuyes, la socia se encunetra muy satisfecha porque ahora requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. 200 pollos y 100 cuyes, implementar su espacio y este negocio permite apoyar en los estudios y otros a sus hijos, la socia agradece la oportunidad brndada mediante este medio el cual le a dado muchas alegrías y crecimiento economico y union familiar.
texts.en: Felicitas is a 69-year old widow. She has 2 children who are independent and she lives in the community of Huacaytaqui. She is a member of this communal bank and she works alone raising small livestock such as guinea pigs and poultry in a home-based and traditional way from her patio, and the guinea pigs from her kitchen. She started to grow in a progressive way and she increased her flock of poultry and she purchase guinea pigs in wholesale. She now has a significant business and as she is by herself it has been a very profitable venture. But she needs more hands to help so her eldest son is helping her. He bought a truck from the proceeds of the sale of some land to transport her poultry and guinea pigs to the different fairs. She is always highly sought out and clients some looking for her to her house. She set up her poultry in a coop with cages holding 100 poultry and medium-sized cages for the guinea pigs. She is very satisfied because she now requires to invest in the purchase of 200 poultry and 100 guinea pigs. She also needs to condition the space. This business helps her to support her children in their schooling and other matters. She is thankful for the opportunity provided to her through this medium. It has caused her a great deal of happiness, financial growth, and family unity.

loans.use: to purchase 200 chickens and 100 guinea pigs

loans.name: Vivomingbe Group

texts.fr: VIVOMINGBE est un groupe D. trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Rita (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée D. 50 ans et est une veuve et mère D. quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à sa charge. Rita vit seule avec l’enfant à sa charge et assure seule ses différents besoins. Rita n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a près D. neuf ans que Rita vend des produits divers (charbon D. bois, condiments, pain) dans son quartier. Rita exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet D. subvenir à ses besoins. Rita s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête D. la satisfaction D. sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds D. roulement, Rita sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe VIVOMINGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes D. leur clientèle et à se faire plus D. profits.
texts.en:
VIVOMINGBE is a group of three people, whose members resiD. in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Rita (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 50 years old and is a widow with four children, all educated, and of whom one is still under her care. Rita lives alone with her dependent child and is the family's sole provider.

Rita has never been to school. For the past nine years Rita has been selling various products (charcoal, condiments, bread) in her neighborhood. Rita is passionate about her business activity, which enables her to support herself. Rita gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking customer satisfaction and to increase her working capital, Rita is requesting a third loan along with the other VIVOMINGBE group members. This credit loan will serve to better meet the demands of their customers and increase their profits.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal and condiments.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
This is Irine, 38, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband Luisito is a miner. Irine is mother to two children, both of whom are already studying in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Irine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine Peso's (PHP)-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Irine hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is a 48-year-old married woman with four children – two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living by working as a driver. 
Hang has been running a general store for ten years. She would like to request a loan to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, sugar, and beans to stock in her store. She hopes this loan will enable her to generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, sugar, and beans to stock in her store.

loans.name: Xenia

texts.ru:
Ксения замужем, у нее есть сын и дочка. Ксения занимается сельским хозяйством и выращивает разные ранние овощи в своем родном селе Приветное, Цюрупинского района. Каждый год на 25 сотках огорода она высаживает 4 000 кустов помидор, 3 000 огурцов, 4 тонны редиса. Фермерством она занимается уже 17 лет. В хозяйство на данный момент вложено 100 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 6 000 гривен. 

Ксения планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить удобрения, песок, навоз, а также семена для посева. Более того, она планирует использовать часть кредитных средств для того, чтобы построить новую теплицу, что поможет ей увеличить объемы выращиваемой продукции. 
Пометка: История на русском языке
texts.en:
Xenia is married and has a son and a daughter. Xenia is engaged in agriculture and grows different early vegetables in her native village of Privetnoye in the Tsyurupynsk area. Every year she plants 4,000 bushes of tomato, 3,000 cucumbers and four tons of radish in the 25 acres garden. She has been in the farming business for seventeen years. At this time she has 100,000 hryvna invested in her business. The net profit is 6,000 hryvna.

Xenia is planning to use the 20,000 hryvna Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, sand, manure, and seeds for planting. Moreover she plans to use a part of the loan funds to build a new greenhouse which will help her increase the volume of cultivated products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, sand, manure and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme /âgé(e) de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un entrepreneur. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier 08ans.  
Ablavi travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2008. Elle vend à la maison et n’a aucune difficulté principale. Elle achète à Lomé.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de la tomate  du mais de l’huile. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait développer plus son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 44 years old and married to an entrepreneur. She has three children, two of whom go to school. They range in age from 8 to 15 years old. 

Ablavi has been in the restaurant business since 2008. She works from her home, and is not currently facing any major obstacle. She buys her supplies in Lomé. 

Ablavi is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy rice, tomatoes, and corn oil. She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Ablavi would like to expand her business. She will use her profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, tomatoes and corn oil for her restaurant.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 35-years-old with 2 children who are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice. Besides that work, she is managing her wood-work shop to make desks, tables, beds and some others equipment. Joining in our credit program in 2008, she finds that  micro credit is very suitable with her business. For  a new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,184,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as raw material for the manufacturing process.

loans.use: to buy wood as raw material for manufacturing process.

loans.name: Raul Efren

texts.es:
Raúl es un padre soltero de 29 años. Su hijo de 4 años cursa el pre kínder. Juntos viven el "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es uno de las 9 cantones de la Provincia de Pichincha ubicado en la zona noroccidental de la misma. Uno de los principales recursos de "San Miguel de Los Bancos" es el hídrico, en su territorio originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. San Miguel de Los Bancos, muestra las características comunes a varios de los pueblos ubicados entre la Sierra y la Costa: el movimiento comercial se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Desde hace unos años se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de pollos que es un oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres. Su vida ha sido relativamente tranquila y no ha tenido mayor inconveniente en su negocio, pero Raúl cree que es hora de crecer, por ello desea solicitar su primer crédito y Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que se lo facilitará ha analizado que es un excelente cliente, por tener todas las condiciones para un crecimiento sólido. Además Raúl recibirá capacitación como servicio no financiero de esta institución.

A este nuevo emprendedor le preocupa mucho la educación de su hijo. Nos cuenta que su meta en la vida es ver al pequeño crecer y poder pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 29-year-old single father. His four-year-old son is in preschool. Together they live in "San Miguel de Los Bancos," which is one of the nine cantons of the province of Pichincha, located in the northwest zone of this province. One of the principal resources of "San Miguel de Los Bancos" is water, as countless streams and small springs originate in this territory and lead to rivers of considerable size.

San Miguel de Los Bancos shows the characteristics common to many of the towns located between the mountains and the coast: commercial activity--especially farming and livestock--unfolds along the main street where hotels, department stores, and restaurants are found. There are also veterinary services and shops for the daily needs of the population.

For a few years he has been raising and selling chickens, a trade that he learned from his parents. His life has been relatively peaceful and he hasn't had any major inconveniences with his business. But Raúl believes it's time to grow, and for this reason he wants to apply for his first loan. Fundación Alternativa, the institution that will provide it, has determined that he is an excellent client for having the conditions for solid growth. Furthermore, Raúl will receive training as a non-financial service from this institution.

This new entrepreneur is very concerned about the education of his son. He tells us that his goal in life is to see his little one grow, and to be able to pay for his studies.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a 52-year-old widow from northern Israel. She began selling baked goods, pickles and other food products from her home to a few customers from the area. Saida decided she wanted to develop her skills and create a business activity. She began focusing on her baked goods. 

Saida has expanded her customer base and has gained a strong, loyal clientele. After much urging by her customers, who wanted to purchase more of her products, Saida decided to professionalize her business.

She needed this loan to purchase a professional stove, a refrigerator, supplies and packaging for her baked goods.

Saida wants to continue to develop and improve her products. She wants to take baking and pastry classes from the Carmel Chef  School.

loans.use: To purchase a professional stove, a refrigerator, supplies and packaging for her baked goods.

loans.name: Sandi

texts.en:
Sandi is a good boy and student in Pasundan 2 Vocational high school he takes entrepreneur class in Pasundan.
But he has trouble by costs school but all can change when  he get education loan from komida and he really helpful by loan from komida and of course now KIVA too. so he hopes this loan will be continue in next time when he needs loan again.

loans.use: To Pay for Monthly school Costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with 2 children. She is also supporting the schooling for 6 of her relatives. Josephine started her business in 1976 with $100. She began by selling 10 crates of drinks. During the 90s, her business declined due to the bad political and economic situation in the country. Her business began to attract clients again in 2003. Since she has signed a loan contract with Hope, a Microfinance Organization in DRCongo, Germaine has been a very dynamic person and has repaid every loan she has received. With this new request for $600, Josephine is planning to purchase 50 more chairs and 2 electric serving dishes. Her plans to provide catering services within the community which will have a positive impact on her community by employing three people from her neighborhood. Josephine's business strategies include being friendly with clients, never running out of stock, and informing clients about any change in her business. Her current business capital is $1200, and she commits to saving small amounts each day.

loans.use: to purchase 50 more chairs and 2 electric serving dishes

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: A 60-year-old man with a beautiful smile, Sok S. lives with his wife and 7 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is the head of the family and makes his living by operating a tailoring business. Sok S. typically makes around $5/day in revenue, which helps in financing the entire family. His wife meanwhile, looks after the children and cooks meals for her family. Sok S. hopes the loan will assist him in purchasing some clothes and a sewing machine to improve his business due to a great deal of client demands. In the future, he would like to save enough money to open a grocery store for his wife, as well as to keep supporting his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and a sewing machine for his business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima Y. has been selling office/school supplies for 7 years now. She has a secondary school education. She is a widow and has 3 children, who help her in her business. The children study in school, and since she substitutes as a father to them, she also works as a dishwasher in one of the cafeterias in the city. She has been a client of MLF – MicroInvest for almost 4 years. She started by borrowing 300 somoni (currency of Tajikistan). Thanks to her responsibility and discipline with MLF – MicroInvest she has increased her activity to 3000 somoni. Right now she gets her products from local suppliers and in the future she plans on traveling to get supplies herself, increase her product offering and of course improve the location of her business.

P.S. In the photo is her daughter - Firuza

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Юлчиева Фотима продает канцелярские товары вот уже 7 лет. Образование среднее. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей, которые помогают ей, в её деятельности. Дети учатся в школе, и так, как она заменяет им и отца, она также совмещает работу посуда мойщицы в одних из столовых города. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» является почти 4 года. Начала кредитоваться с 300 сомони. Благодаря её ответственностью и дисциплинированностью перед программой МЗФ «Микроинвест» она увеличила свои активы до 3000сомони. Сейчас она товар берет у местных поставщиков, и в дальнейшем собирается ездить за товаром сама, расширить ассортимент и конечно же улучшить место своей деятельности. P.S. На фото её дочь- Фируза.

loans.use: increasing goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more medical supplies

loans.name: Gladis Basilia

texts.es:
Gladis is from a a large and humble family. At the age of 16 she had to become independent and work hard because she was obligated to by poverty. Now that she is married and has a 10 month-old baby, she has decided to open a grocery store, as she must give the baby much care and attention. Gladis found an excellent way to increase her economic income by locating her small, growing business in the home of her mother in law. At this time, with the rising amount of requests from her clients, Gladis wants to augment the variety of her products in order to continue satisfying the needs of the people. Her purpose is to increase her economic benefits and the quality of life for her family. For these reasons she is requesting a loan of 200 dollars, money that she will use to increase her capital and her stock of products. Gladis thanks you all for the support you are giving her - soon enough she will realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Gladis proviene de una amplia y humilde familia, a la edad de 16 años tuvo que independizarse y trabajar arduamente porque la necesidad la obligaba.Ahora ya casada y con una bebé de 10 meses, decidió abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes debido a que tiene que brindarle muchos cuidados y atenciones a su pequeño y encontró una excelente alternativa de incrementar sus ingresos económicos ubicando en el domicilio de su suegra este pequeño negocio que poco a poco está implementando.En este momento y con el incremento de solicitudes y pedidos Gladis desea aumentar la variedad de sus productos para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus exigentes clientes con el propósito de acrecentar sus beneficios económicos y nivel de vida familiar, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que utilizará para ampliar su capital y el stock de sus productos.“Gracias al apoyo que puedes darle, en poco tiempo podrá concretar sus planes”

loans.use: To raise her capital in order to aquire more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To redecorate her beauty salon and to further expand her line of beauty products and supplies

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra S. is a widow with one grown son named Valeryi. They live in Vasilyevka.

Alexandra sells clothing in the local market. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Alexandra believes her consistent efforts and perseverant labor have helped her reach success in business. Presently, Alexandra has about $2000 in inventory.

Alexandra is willing to work hard to see her business grow and expand. She wants to continue to support her family and grandchildren which is why she hopes to keep her business sustainable and receive a stable income. Alexandra says she will put in many hours to get the job done and make sure that her venture achieves its full potential. She is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her inventory stock.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Kireka A2(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jane N.. She has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her shop. Jane is 38 years old and is divorced. She has one daughter, age 12, who goes to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 30000 (~ $17 USD) in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up another retail shop.

Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 1000000 (~ $582 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Hadijah N., Melisha J., Malusi N., and Happy Z.. Hadijah N. has a cosmetics shop and wants to add to her stock and buy more mirrors. Melisha J. is currently operating a canteen and wants a loan to increase her stock. Malusi N. sells clothing and wants to add to her clothing business. Happy Z. has a tailoring business and is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine and to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase stock in a retail shop

loans.name: Thi Lieu

texts.vi:
Mrs. Liễu, 39 year old, sells scrap metal and does hired laboring. She has two school age children. Her income is 4-4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan with anyone, now she would like to apply for a loan of 150USD with Binh Minh because it required no credit and has a weekly repayment plan. She’d use the funds of the loan to start a livestock business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Liễu, 39 tuổi làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn và làm thuê. Chị có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị chỉ có 50000-70000đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu cả. Nay chị vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi theo chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị muốn vay lâu dài và không phải thế chấp.

loans.use: Start a poultry business.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos S. E. is 35 years old and makes her living selling a variety of small freshwater clams in a Kampong Cham market. She earns $2 USD per day. Her husband, Tuy Sophat, runs a goods transport service making $5 USD per day. Both of their two children are currently enrolled in school.

She wants to invest in a large stock of cashew nuts so she can sell thE. for profit once market prices go up.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Kyosimba Onanya Women's Group

texts.en: The saying, “a man’s downfall is not the end of his life,” befits Hadijah N., the chairperson of Kyosimba Onanya women’s group, which formed in Lugazi in 1997. Before starting her raw food selling business, Hadijah used to move on market trucks to sell new clothes for men, women and children at daily markets around Lugazi. Then robbers attacked her on her way back from work and left her with nothing. This scenario prompted her to enter her current business, which does not require so many movements. She buys sweet potatoes from farmers, packs them in sacks and takes them on a hired truck to Nakawa market for sale once a week on a Monday or Wednesday. She buys a bag of sweet potatoes at $15 and sells it at $35. She is widowed with four children and also cares for four grandchildren singlehandedly. Her dream is to see her children have a bright future after completing their education, and this keeps her going.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to increase profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 40 grams of gold, 40 grams of silver, 10 stones for ladies’ rings, and 20 stones for graduation rings

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yulya N. a cheerful business-woman who is married with a 3-year-old daughter. She lives in Stryi where she sells flowers and plants at affordable prices. Her nicely decorated store is located next to a city market. Yulya's mother helped her launch her business about 3 months ago, and her current gross income is about $1600 a month. She has about $3000 in inventory. 
Yulya is seeking a loan so that she can purchase decorations for her flower bouquets and accessories for her flower store. Yulya hopes that this loan, combined with her creativity and good taste, will allow her to expand her business. She hopes to use some of the profit to purchase furniture for her home. Yulya has excellent references from other entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and decorations for flower bouquets

loans.name: Abduraim

texts.ru:
Abduraim K. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education and is a truck driver by training. Abduraim owns a small gas statioin, where he sells gasoline. He has been in this business for 28 years. His business is profitable, but to further develop it and increase the amount of sales, he would like to obtain a loan. He plans to use the loan to import more gasoline and pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодиров Абдураим Азимович житель района Шахринав . Возраст 48 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее, по специальности шофер. Абдураим имеет небольшую автозапрвку , где торгует бензином. Имеет опыт в этом бизнесе 28 лет. Бизнес приносить доход , но для того , чтобы развивать бизнес и увеличить объем продаж хочет получить кредит.Клиент планирует на кредит завезти больше горючего, а погасит кредит в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernadina has had a general store in her home for 7 years. She used to have internet booths, however, she was a victim of a robbery and had to start from zero, so she decided to set up a general store. She offers all sorts of basic need products. She also offers phone call services.

The loans received so far have been invested in stocking the products required by her store.

Bernadina would like to buy new display cabinets because the ones she has are very old.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Bernardina tiene una bodega en su casa desde hace 7 años. Antes ella tenía cabinas de Internet, sin embargo, fue víctima de un robo, por lo que tuvo que empezar de cero y decidió tener una bodega. Ella ofrece toda clase de productos de primera necesidad. También presta servicios de llamadas telefónicas.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en el stock de productos que su tienda requiere.

A Bernardina le gustaría poder adquirir vitrinas nuevas, ya que las que tiene son muy antiguas.

loans.use: stocking the products required by her store  (Para el stock de productos que su tienda requiere.)

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Samean's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. is the president of this village bank [solidarity group] of twelve people in Choeung Khnar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Seik Phally, owns a plot of land where he can cultivate rice to earn a living. Mrs. Mom S. is 33 years old and the mother of a 3-year-old child, who is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK [Kiva’s Field Partner] has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more vegetable in order to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 20 años, vive sola en un local que alquilo para vivir y poner su negocio. Desde hace 4 años, se viene dedicando al negocio de la venta de bebidas, en los que ha tratado de trabajar muy duro para hacer que prospere, abriendo desde las 8 de la tarde hasta las 10 u 11 de la noche.  Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la gratificación que le da tener independencia económica y poder solventar ella sola todos sus gastos. El motivo del esfuerzo diario de Yudiht es labrarse un mejor porvenir. Con el dinero que solicita implementará con más bebidas su local.  A ella le gustaría que su negocio tenga más rentabilidad y que sea mucho más grande, para poder atender mejor a la clientela.
texts.en:
Yudith is 20 years old and lives alone in an apartment that she rents to live and run her business. For 4 years, she has made a living by selling drinks and has tried to work very hard in order to prosper, starting at 8:00 to 10:00 or 11:00 at night. She receives the most satisfaction from her job from being economically independent and being able to pay all of her bills. Her motivation for this daily effort is to build a better future for herself. With this loan, she will supply more drinks for her market. She would like her business to be more profitable and increase in size, so that she can better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of drinks for sale

loans.name: Demitila

texts.es: Demitila tiene 53 años y vive con uno D. sus hijos. Demitila ha trabajado como agricultora toda su vida, tarea que ejercita con mucha dedicación, tal es así que sus extensiones D. terreno hace descansar la tierra durante 3 años, D. esa manera utiliza más abono natural y muy poco del artificial, principalmente cultiva papa y también se dedica a la crianza D. animales. La mayor parte D. su tiempo es invertido en esta actividad, D. ganadería, tiene caballos, burros y toros. Su deseo es también impulsar más la venta D. animales, por lo que está preparando su  establo para ello. Es la quinta vez que Demitila solicita un préstamo en MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Solicita este préstamo con el que invertirá en la compra D. alimento balanceado para sus animales.
texts.en:
Demitila is 53 years old and lives with one of her children. She has worked in agriculture her whole life. She has done this with a lot of dedication, so much so that the extensions of land have allowed her to let the land lay fallow for 3 years. In this way, she uses more natural fertilizer and less artificial fertilizer. She mostly grows potatoes and also raises animals. Most of her time is invested in livestock farming. She has horses, donkeys, and bulls. Her dream is also to stimulate the sale of animals, because she is preparing her stable for it. This is the fifth time that Demitila has asked for a loan from MFP. She has demonstrated that she is responsible and punctual in her payments. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a balanced diet for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced foods for her animals

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
Munisa J. processes and sells various types of dried apricots. She has been in this business for many years. She is 40 years old and she has two children with her husband. Her husband is a farmer who grows vegetables.

Munisa purchases dried apricots from local farmers at wholesale prices and after remaking them, she sells them at the local food market. Munisa’s revenues contribute significantly to the household and help support the education expenses of her children. She is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for working capital and to pay to transport her food items. She believes the extra income will help to improve the living conditions of her family. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hoàn, 28 tuổi,chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Hiện tại chị đang kinh doanh săm lốp ô tô còn chồng chị làm nghề lái xe. Với thu nhập 4.000.000 đ/ tháng việc hàon trả vốn của gia đình chị Hoàn cũng rất thuận lợi. 
Chị Hoàn đang mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Hoàn - 28 years old - she lives with her husband and small child at Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Currently, she has a business selling inner tubes for automotive tires while her husband works as a driver. With an income of 4,000,000 VND per month, their businesses completely repair their loans and is quite profitable. Hoàn is hoping to borrow 5,000,000 VND to reinvest into her family businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Automotive Tires and Driver

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou est une femme celibataire sans enfants agée de 32ans.Pour gagner sa vie et affirmer son autonomie par rapport aux autres elle fait du commerce des ustensilles de cuisine en plastiques.La boutique qu 'elle gere est montéesur fonds propres.Elle est une des principales fournisseur d'objets en plastique de la localité.Pour repondre à la demande des clients ,elle sollicite in pret pour renforcer ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Seynabou, 32, is a single woman without children. To earn a living and be independent of others, she sells plastic kitchenware. The shop she runs was set up with her own money. She is one of the main suppliers of plastic-ware in her locality. To respond to the needs of her clientele, she is asking for this loan to bolster her inventory of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her little plastic-ware shop

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Gullermina, vive en la calle Emeterio Cano de la zona 23 de Marzo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su hijo menor, su esposo trabaja en el interior del departamento.
 
Se dedica a la confección de mantas de Lana las cuales vende en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de insumos (lana e hilo) al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Guillermina lives on Emeterio Cano Street in the March 23 neighborhood in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. She lives with her small son while her husband works in the interior part of the province. She works manufacturing wool blankets which she sells in the different markets of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase materials (wool and thread) wholesale to decrease her expenses. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and thread to manufacture wool blankets

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El señor Martín H. Ríos ha sido un buen cliente el ya había tenido un crédito lo cual pago muy bien ese crédito, se utilizó para una diferencia para adquirir  vivienda de interés social. Ahora su crédito es para la casa que le otorgaron desea ponerle una barda al frente de su casa para tener mas seguridad. Para realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material y mano de obra.
El es la única persona que sostiene la casa pero trabaja horas extras para mantener la familia.
texts.en:
Martin H. R. has been a good client: he received a loan and repaid it. He used that loan to pay the difference on a house from social services.

Today, he is asking or a loan to build a wall in the front of the house he was given, in order to make it safer. To realize his project, he needs to buy building material and pay for manual labour. He is the sole financial support of the household and works extra hours to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building material for a wall

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is a 46-year-old mother of four. Her husband, Cyrus, is a barangay (local district) councilor. Helen was a dealer for Avon cosmetics company for 15 years until she became a unit manager for the company. With her income from Avon, she has been able to send her four children to college.

Helen has applied for this loan in order to support some of her Avon dealers. In the past she has made payments for some of her dealers in order to take advantage of a bigger discount. She also buys stock in bulk in order to make more profit. In the future, Helen wants to be able to make her house more secure and comfortable.

loans.use: To finance her cosmetics sales

loans.name: Siroch

texts.ru: Сироч имеет 2 группу инвалидности по состоянию здоровья – у него больное сердце. Уже несколько лет нигде не работает и получает пенсию по инвалидности 40 сомони ($10). Жена тоже нигде не работает и сидит дома. Чтобы прокормить семью супруги занимаются откормом скота. Сирочу 42 года, имеет 4 детей. Сироч выходит на рынки и если попадается дешевый скот, то покупает и приводит домой. В течении нескольких недель откармливают, а затем продают. Сироч собирается увеличить поголовье скота, и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Siroch has a second degree disability due to his health - he has heart problems. He does not work anywhere for several years and receives a pension for disability of 40 somoni ($10). His wife also does not work anywhere and stays at home. To support the family they feed cattle. Siroch is 42 years old, he has four children. He goes out to the markets and if he finds cheap cattle he buys it and bring it home. Then they feed it for several weeks and resell it. Siroch wants to increase the head count of cattle and this is why he applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: "I have work but my earnings are not enough to meet all the family (needs). I have been working my whole life. That is why my husband and I engaged in farming to supplement our income," says Helen D., a 39-year-old mother of two children. CEVI is reaching out to more poor Filipino families to help them have their own livelihoods. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and four sacks of ammonium

loans.name: Darou Salam Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Darou salam regroupe quatre (4) vendeurs de légumes et condiment d’un marché de quartier de la ville de Mbour. Le groupe crée depuis deux (2) ans permette à ses membres de réunir chaque jour des cotisations de cent fracs CFA qui sont versées chaque jour à un membre du groupe à tour de rôle. Cette somme est injectée dans le commerce pour renforcer le fonds de roulement du groupe. Face à l’insuffisance ses cotisations à régler leurs besoins en fonds de roulement, le groupe  sollicite un prêt. La plus part des membres du groupe ont quitté leur village pour s’installer à la ville à fin d’avoir de quoi nourrir leur famille.
texts.en:
The group Darou Salam is composed of four vendors of vegetables and condiments from an area marketplace in the city of Mbour. Created two years ago, the group enables its members to gather each day 100 francs CFA in dues, which are submitted daily to a group member by turns. This sum is injected into commerce to bolster the group’s working capital. Facing a deficiency in dues for meeting the need for working capital, the group is requesting a loan. Most of the group members have left their village to become settled in the city in order to have something for feeding their family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Phork

texts.en: Phork K. is shown in the picture with her daughter. She is age 29 and lives with family members in the Province of Pursat, since 1979.  She currently generates income by selling pork in the local market from pigs that her husband slaughters.  She also buys and raises pigs to sell.  Phork K. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase the neighbor's mature pig to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: Purchase a pig.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 54 años, está casado con María de 45, ellos viven con sus hijos Daniel de 18 y Brayan de 16 en su casa propia. Esta es una pareja sumamente trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años, tiempo en el cual María ha optado por viajar al país de Chile donde la ropa está mucho más barata y traerla para que la venda su esposo en la ciudad de Lima. El negocio que les ha traído buenas ganancias, pero a base de mucho sacrificio, ya que no es nada fácil tener que viajar a un lugar tan lejano para traer tanta mercadería, bueno es que les resulta rentable y gracias a esos ingresos han logrado sacar adelante a su familia, puesto que su clientela conoce la calidad de las prendas que ofrecen. Para el futuro, Roberto quiere comprar un minibus donde puedan ofrecer el servicio de transporte interurbano en la ciudad de Lima, ya que piensa que será un negocio muy lucrativo. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP, pero anteriormente trabajó en bancos comunales, de los cuales obtuvo mucha experiencia para organizar sus ganancias y ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita su esposa viajara a Chile para traer mayor cantidad de ropa.
texts.en:
Roberto is 54, and he is married to María, 45. They live with their 18 year old son, Daniel, and their 16 year old son, Brayan, in their own house. This is a hard working couple that has been selling clothes for six years. During that time María decided to travel to the country of Chile where clothing is much cheaper. She brings the clothing back for her husband to sell in the city of Lima. The business has brought them good income. But, there has been much sacrifice because it is not at all easy to have to travel to a place so far away to bring back merchandise. It does turn out to be profitable, and thanks to this income they have been able to get ahead with their family. The customers know the quality of the clothing that they sell. In the future, Roberto wants to buy a mini bus so that he can offer urban transportation in the city of Lima. He thinks that would be a very lucrative business. This is his first individual loan with MFP, but he has previously worked with community banks. In community banks he gained much experience about organizing his earnings and being punctual in his payments. With the money he is now asking for, his wife will travel to Chile to bring back a greater quantity of clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Gaza City, Palestine. Maher owns a barber shop, for which he requested a loan of 1,000 USD from Ryada in order to change the décor of his salon. This is the first time that Maher has requested a loan.

Maher is special in his work because he does nice haircuts and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family members, friends, and neighbors. In the future, Maher plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To change the décor of his salon

loans.name: Jimena Aneyda

texts.es: La Sra. Jimena C. tiene el negocio de juguetes, ella tiene dos hijos, los cría sola ya que esta separada de su esposo, su negocio está ubicado en una de las zonas mas comerciales de juguetes al por mayor y por menor, solicita crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo con novedades en juguetes, vende juguetes desde los mas pequeños y simples hasta los mas grandes y novedosos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jimena C. operates a toy store. She has two children and raises them by herself since she is separated from her husband. Her business is located in a commercial area where toys are sold wholesale and at retail.

She is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to increase her inventory of novelty toys, ranging from the smallest and simplest toys to ones that are larger and more original.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of toys

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: adama K. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis aout 2005.elle evolue dans le petit commerce de produits saisonniers et denrees pour enfants.elle tient une table devant chez elle ou elle etale ses produits.elle capitalise une experience de plus de cinq ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour accroitre son fond et diversifier ses produits.l'augmentation de ses benefices lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama K. has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2005. She is progressing in her small business selling seasonal products and goods for children. She has a table in front of her house, where she displays her products for sale. She capitalizes on over five years of experience in this business. Adama is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to grow her capital and to diversify her products. The increase in her profits will enable her to assister her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis P. vive en casa propia con su hijo en la calle Rigoberto Paredes de la zona de San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz; su ingreso es una renta de jubilación que le dejó la esposa al morir;  percibe también  alquileres de dos habitaciones.
 
Tiene instalado en su casa un taller de costura, donde confecciona trajes de vestir para caballeros y damas. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material, como ser telas, hilos botones y otros, para continuar con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 con un  muy bueno historial de pagos, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Luis P. lives in his own house with his son on Rigoberto Paredes Street in the San Pedro Zone in the city of La Paz. He has income from a retirement annuity that his wife left him when she passed away. He also rents out two rooms. He has a sewing workshop in his house where he makes men's and women's suits. He is seeking a loan to buy materials such as fabrics, thread, buttons, etc., so he can stay in business and increase his income. Luis has been an Impro client since 2004. He has a very good payment history so he can apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other supplies for his business making men's and women's suits.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn Y. is 35 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang province, located about 90 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has four children: one is working and the other three are students and dependent on her. Her husband appears in the photo.

Sorn Y. currently makes bamboo baskets. She saves up over a hundred sets of bamboo baskets and then sells them to her customers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to her customers' houses.

In addition, Sorn Y. requested a loan in order to buy baskets from other weavers to sell for more income.

loans.use: To buy baskets from other weavers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S. is from the village of Purok 11, Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Marites is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business providing landscaping services to local community members. Marites has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide landscaping service

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. OeU. U. is 65 years old. He appears in the accompanying photograph with his son. OeU. is widower with 4 children, 1 son and 3 daughters. All of them are married and live outside the family home. OeU. lives along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
OeU. has been a construction contractor for 50 years. He doesn’t have enough materials to operate his business, so he is asking for his first loan of $350 to purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Rachelle Jeanne

texts.fr: B. Rachelle Jeanne est née en 1970 à Sakété au Bénin. Mariée à DOSSOUMOU Eric, un dépaneur, Rachelle Jeanne est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus des deux enfants, Rachelle Jeanne a un autre enfant en charge. Rachelle Jeanne vit avec son conjoint et ses enfants au quartier Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis huit ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Rachelle Jeanne n’a jamais été à l’école. Depuis cinq ans, Rachelle Jeanne mène comme activité, la vente de sacs de maïs, de soja et de haricot au marché de Cococodji. Rachelle Jeanne fait ses approvisionnements à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin. Rachelle Jeanne a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Rachelle Jeanne désire agrandir son activité, et ouvrir un magasin de stockage et un second stand de vente de ses produits. C’est pourquoi, Rachelle Jeanne sollicite un second crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Rachelle Jeanne was born in 1970 in Sakété in Bénin.  Married to DOSSOUMOU Eric, a repairman, she is the mother of two children who are all in school. In addition to the two, she has another child in her care.  For eight years, Rachelle Jeanne has been living with her husband and children in the Cococodji district, not far from  Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  The couple is covering family expenses jointly.  Rachelle Jeanne has never been to school.  For five years, she has been running a business selling sacks of corn, soybeans, and beans at the Cococodji market.  She stocks up in Parakou, in northern Benin. She has had an ALIDé loan before, which she repaid.  She would like to expand her business and to open a storehouse and a second stand to sell her goods.  This is why she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of corn and 4 sacks of soybeans

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
This is Roberta R., a 42-year-old entrepreneur from Camarin, Caloocan City.  One of her three children is in high school.  Her husband, Roberto, age 47, works as a plumber.
