Roberta buys and sells frozen processed meats, such as longanisa (a local sausage), embutido (meat loaf), and hotdogs. Her products appeal a lot to her customers, especially working mothers who pack her products in their children's school lunch boxes. She is thankful to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for providing her loans, which she has used to buy her products in bulk and stores them in the freezer. She now earns more than P5,000.00 a month in net income, but her earnings sometimes vary depending on the supply and demand for frozen products.

Roberta applied for a new loan of P12,000.00 from CCT so she can re-stock her frozen supplies. She wishes to see all her children finish their studies.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more processed frozen goods to sell

loans.name: Álvaro  José

texts.es:
El Sr. Álvaro Antonio S.  casado y padre de familia de dos hijos los que se encuentran en edad escolar. Don Álvaro S.  acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita comprar materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que necesita comprar perlines, zinc, pintura y clavos para el techo de su casa el cual esta deteriorado y en invierno el agua penetra en su hogar.
Cabe mencionar que desde que ceprodel me ha estado financiando créditos e podido mejorar mis condiciones de vida para mi familia.
texts.en:
Álvaro Antonio S. is married and the father of two school-aged children. Álvaro S. turns to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow him to buy construction materials to make improvements to his home. He needs to buy beams, sheets of zinc, paint and nails for the roof of his house, which is deteriorated and leaks in wintertime. It’s worth mentioning that, since obtaining financing through Ceprodel, I have been able to improve the standard of living for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Noen

texts.en:
Miss Noen C., 47, is a farmer. She is a single woman who lives in Soumbour village in the Kandal province. She owns 1-hectare of land on which to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from this, she is a sesame seller. When she has free time from farming and selling sesame, she works as a laborer for an income to support herself. 

In her rice field, she now has an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy fuel to support a water machine to water her crops while the irrigation system is far from her rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for her water machine and pesticides to kill the insects in order to make her crops more productive.

loans.use: To buy fuel for her water machine and pesticides to kill the insects in order to make her crops more productive

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar R., 52, is a very diligent woman. She is married to a farmer and they have four children. Thanks to her dear husband's seeding skills she is very familiar with agricultural work. Her loving husband gave her farming fields 10 years ago and she's been working them ever since. At the same time she raises and sells cattle. These activities have helped to pay the economic expenses of her family. Dilbar's wishes to improve the quality of her products are what drives her to request a 5000 Somoni loan. She would like to acquire mineral fertilizers in order to obtain excellent products for this harvesting season. Make her request possible so that this hardworking mother can continue to develop her work, which gives her a lot of satisfaction.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina, Firdousi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others.The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Tp purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad has owned a car repair shop since 2004 and has ten years of experience in this field. He's a 26-year-old single man living alone. He repairs all type of cars and that’s why he attracts more clients to his shop.

Today, Ahmad is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy new tools needed for his shop and also to buy more spare parts to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his shop and more spare parts

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en:
Bukola is 33 years old and married with two children. She sells planks at retail prices to her customers and her husband also sells planks to support their home. Plank sales are very lucrative in Nigeria and Bukola is very happy in this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her greatest challenge in her business is a lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge and expand the business.

She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization and LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Rammyuel

texts.en:
Rammyuel O. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. He is 29 years old. Rammyuel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rammyuel owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Rammyuel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rammyuel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rammyuel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rammyuel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata S. est une sociétaire  de la caisse de  l’U-IMCEC de baye Laye. Elle habite dans la même  localité. Madame S. a commence à s’activer dans la vente d’huile de palme. Ensuite elle s’est orientée  vers le commerce de thioub  venant du Mali et parfois de tissus wax. Elle a une expérience  de 5 ans dans cette activité. Aussi c’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par amour et par nécessité  car son mari est en  retraite et elle est dans l’obligation de trouver des ressources pour soutenir  ses enfants financièrement. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but de faire une commande de thioubs  au mali par l’intermédiaire de sa fille commerçante  qui voyage très  souvent pour acheter des marchandises. Les périodes  de fête  comme la tabaski et la Korite lui procurent  beaucoup de bénéfices  ce qui lui permet  de satisfaire ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de sa famille. Cela lui permet aussi de prendre en charge ses frais médicaux  car elle est tres maladive.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata S. is a member of U-IMCEC of Laye bay. She lives in the same area. Mrs. S. started in the business of selling palm oil. Next she started selling thioub (dyed cotton cloth) from Mali and sometimes wax cloth (a high quality pagne cloth). She has 5 years of experience in this business. It is also a business that she chose for love and for necessity, as her husband is retired, and it is up to her to make money to financially support her children. Thus, she is seeking a 200,000-franc loan to be able to order thioubs in Mali through her daughter, who is a trader and often travels to buy goods. Holidays like the Tabaski (or Festival of Sacrifice) or the Korite bring her a lot of business, which allows her to meet her personal needs, as well as those of her family. It also allows her to take care of her medical expenses, since she is very sickly.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married to a businessman and they have five children together. All her children go to school and she takes care of additional family members (her sister's children). The family has access to electricity and piped water. Mariam owns her house. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Mariam has multiple jobs like a ladies salon, selling cosmetics and selling maize flour at home. She is proud of these businesses.  She has been in business for many years. Her main customers are women and she works six days a week. Mariam’s business challenges include transportation and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cosmetics, creams, and weaves and to boost her business of maize flour. She joined MCDT because they weren't asking for collateral before getting loans. Mariam aspires to see her business grow bigger and build her own rental shops.

loans.use: To buy creams, weaves, braids and maize flour

loans.name: Antonia Isabel

texts.es: Antonia Isabel U. D. L. D. 36 años D. edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora quien vive junto a su esposo, el señor José L. quien trabaja como mecánico, y junto a tres hijos todos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y con quienes resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango. Antonia posee una tienda D. productos comestibles y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa y la cual atienD. D. lunes a domingo durante todo el día y gran parte D. la noche, sus hijos le ayudan a atenderla y así mismo su esposo los fines D. semana que se encuentra en casa. Así mismo Antonia se dedica a la elaboración D. pupusas, D. queso, chicharrón y frijoles, lo cual le permite a ella poder contar con mayores ventas y una entrada extra D. dinero, lo cual cae muy bien en su familia. Antonia es una mujer muy dedica a lo que hace ya que lo realiza con todo el deseo D. poder obtener ganancias para su familia, por lo que le dedica mucho tiempo a esto, lo que se le es recompensado, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes quienes desfrutan D. sus pupusas. Antonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos para la tienda y así mismo mayor cantidad D. ingredientes para hacer las pupusas.
texts.en:
Antonia Isabel U. D. L. is 36 years old. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the town of Ilopango with her husband Sr. José L., who works as a mechanic, and their three young children who are in school. Antonia manages a store in her home where she sells food products and basic necessities. The store is open Monday through Sunday during daylight hours and for most of the evening. Her children help look after the store and so does her husband on the weekends whenever he is at home. Antonia also makes “pupusas” filled with cheese, pork, and beans. This enables her to increase her sales and create an extra source of income that will benefit her family.

Antonia is a woman who is extremely dedicated to what she does. She does everything she can to generate income for her family and will spend the time needed to do so. In the end, she is rewarded as she has many customers who enjoy her pupusas.

Antonia is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise for her store as well as ingredients for making pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & ingredients for making "pupusas"

loans.name: Nicolasa Sebastiana

texts.es: Es de 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos varones y una mujer, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de delantales, solicita su primer crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo en materiales para elaborar su producto, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y colaborador, con muchos deseos de superar, con la ayudad de su esposo y sus hijos pagaran el crédito.
texts.en:
She's 52, married and has two sons and one daughter. She makes aprons for sale. She is asking for her first loan to increase working capital, to buy raw materials for the manufacture of her products. Her personal references indicate that she's a responsible, cooperative person who very much wants to succeed. With help from her husband and children they will repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un padre de familia que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, un distrito que ha venido experimentando un creciente desarrollo comercial en estos ultimos años, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, las mototaxis son vehículos conformados por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte, el uso de estos vehículos como medio de transporte es muy utilizado en la zona por su precio y comodidad.

Vicente brinda su servicio dentro de la ciudad donde vive y también en los caseríos aledaños, el contínuo uso otorgado a su vehículo y el estado accidentado de las carreteras y caminos de la zona han hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, para realizar esta acción, el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Vicente es una persona entregada a su familia, el desea apoyar a los suyos trabajando arduamente todos los dias. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Vicente is a family man who lives with his wife and children in the agricultural district of Cayaltí. This district has been experiencing growth in commercial development over the past few years. The area is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Vicente provides transport services of cargo and passengers using his motorcycle taxi. Motorcycle taxis are vehicles that consist of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for transporting items. The use of these vehicles is the primary mode of transportation in the area because of the price and the ease in which they get around.

Vicente provides his services throughout the city where he lives as well as in the neighboring villages. Continued use of his vehicle and the worn state of the highways and roads have caused defects in his vehicle that require urgent repairs. To ensure that his vehicle runs properly, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Vicente is devoted to his family and works hard every day to support them. He previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that he is a client who is prompt and responsible when submitting his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Carlos P. C. de  26 años de edad, es soltero y trabaja para mantener a su persona ya que él no tiene familia ni esposa, sus padres fallecieron  cuando el tenia 18 años y desde entonces él se dedica al trabajo.

Juan Carlos P. C. es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja en el sindicato de transportistas de  moto taxis 2 de Agosto donde trabajo con una motocicleta que no es suya para subsistir en este mundo. 

El señor Juan Carlos P. C. se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de una motocicleta para así poder tener su propia herramienta de trabajo y así poder ahorrar dinero para que en un futuro pueda formar su hogar y una familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos P. C. is 26, single and works to support himself since he has no wife nor children. His parents died when he was 18 and since that time he has been working. He is a young man who is dedicated to his work. He is in the August 2nd moto taxis union but he uses a machine that isn't his since he needs to survive in this life. Mr. Juan Carlos P. C. went to the offices himself to request a loan to be able to purchase a mototaxi. He wanted to own one himself so that he could save money and in the future have a home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to be able to buy a mototaxi

loans.name: Tamansane Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businesspeople in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 900,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 900,000 each, they will be able to add more stocks into their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feed and clothe them. 

Samuel I. K. (pictured left) is the leader of this group. He was born in a village call Yoni, in Northern Sierra Leone. Samuel is age 35, married with two children who attend primary school. 

Samuel is a photographer. He has been in this profession for five years. He also sells locally produced items such as rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). Samuel will use his share of the loan to buy film, rice, and palm oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy film, rice, and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Uong

texts.en:
Uong E. is a 44-year-old widow and mother. She lives with her son in her own small family home in Kompong Tom Province.

Uong E. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land such as cabbages, morning glories, and especially rice for both eating and selling. Her son helps be responsible for the family by working in the construction sector.

The rain has beE. coming down and the conditions are good for planting. However, Uong E. doesn’t have money to use on her farm field. Therefore, she is applying for a loan in order to buy seed, fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for pumping water.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for pumping water

loans.name: Wenilyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Wenilyn N. is from the Barangay of Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years of age, married to Roberto and is blessed with four children, all of whom are young or infants. To make a living, she is presently engaged in barbecue vending and a barbecue stick making business. Her husband is giving her regular support from his income as a chainsaw operator. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years already and earns approximately $45 a month from this activity.

Just this year 2010, Wenilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a micro-finance program that reaches out the rural communities, and has successfully repaid a loan of 3,000 PHP. She is requesting a 2nd loan 5,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her existing barbecue vending and barbecue stick making businesses. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education, insurances and possible business expansions. 
	
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: Additional capital for her barbecue vending and barbecue stick making businesses

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental,

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, de 19 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Miguel de 24 años y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Trabajando arduamente, Irene ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos de papa, maíz y arveja, gracias a todo su esfuerzo, sus cultivos son de los mejores de su poblado, motivo por el cual cuando los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que el trabajo que realizó meses atrás dio sus frutos. En adelante, espera incrementar la cantidad que produce actualmente, para eso comprará nuevas tierras. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Irene, 19, is an unassuming, hard working young woman. She lives in her parents’ house with her husband, Miguel, 24. What she most desires is to succeed in life. Working hard, Irene has managed to raise her potato, corn and pea crops. Thanks to all her efforts her crops are the best in her settlement. Because of this, when she takes them to Tarma to sell they are quickly bought. What she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting her crops because that’s when she sees the fruits of the past months’ labors. She’d like to increase her crop yields so will buy more land to do so in the future. This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that the loan will be very helpful for her business’ progress and development so she is willing to repay on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank which makes her very well-liked. She will use the 700 new soles to buy fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim S., 51, is married and lives with one of her children in Kampong Chhnang province. She makes a living selling vegetables in a local market, and typically makes $5 a day. Her husband works as a taxi driver and also earns about $5 each day. Sim S. has applied for a loan of $100 to fix a leaky roof and finish construction of her house.

loans.use: To fix a leaking roof and finish construction of her house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of two school-age children. A resident of Lebanon, she has owned a small grocery store since 1998. With her business income, she helps her husband to satisfy the heavy expenses of the family. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory and add new decor. She expects that her business will continue to grow in the coming year.

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships is an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory and add new decor

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old. He lives with his wife in the town of Campiña Mesones Muro in the disctrict of Ferreñafe. This is a community that has grown significantly over the years and has developed at a reasonable pace, allowing it to become a reasonably comfortable area.

The client is involved in public transport. He has more than 10 years of experience in the business. He drives a moto-taxi in and around the region, carrying individuals to work, stores or to meet friends. He also works in agriculture.

Carlos has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past. He has taken out a number of loans and always paid punctually and responsibly. He has requested the current loan in order to make repairs to his moto-taxi.  He hopes this will reduce his maintenance expenses and provide a higher ongoing income for him and his family.

loans.use: Repair his moto-taxi

loans.name: Sarah Abaa Group

texts.en:
Sarah A. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Sarah is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Sarah is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as soap, shampoo, sugar, salt, noodles and others in the local community. Sarah has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Sarah from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Washington; el tiene 53 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio se dedica a trabajar en transporte, el trabaja en una combi haciendo servicio publico, el socio quiere mejorar el carro. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para la combi.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Washington, 53, is a member of the "LOS LIDERES" (The Leaders) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a life partner and three children.  He works in public transportation driving a minivan.  He wants to improve the vehicle and is asking for funds to buy tires.

He thanks all who will share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy tires for his minivan.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Depuis 10ans, elle vend le poisson salé, à 37ans, elle s’occupe de ses 3 enfants qui vont à l’école normalement.

Ayant compris les principes  de fonctionnement des crédits  Hope, elle s’est mise à l’école d’apprentissage car elle peut maintenant organisée son activité en utilisant son journal de caisse et sa gestion de stock.

Avant le premier prêt, elle avait les revenus allant de 10.000f à 35.000f jour et aujourd'hui elle vend 40.000f a 100.000 f lorsque les ventes sont bonnes.
L’actuel prêt sera la bienvenue, elle va faire des provisions  pour cette période des fêtes de fin d’année. Elle va achetée 3cartons du poisson salé soles, 3cartons du poisson salé capitaine, 2cartons de poisson salé morue, 1carton du poisson salé thon, avec ce stock elle compte réaliser plus de ventes afin de rembourser ce nouveau prêt  sans difficultés.
 -  Ses ambitions sont :Construire une boutique pour assurer l'avenir de ses enfants
-   Devenir grossiste
texts.en:
She has been selling salt-cured fish for 10 years, and at 37, she cares for her three children who normally go to school.  Having learned how the Hope loans work, she enrolled in the apprenticeship program because she can now organize her business activities by using her cash book and by managing her inventory. 

Before the first loan, her revenues were between 10,000F and 35,000F per day.  Now she sells between 40,000 F and 100,000 F on good days. 

The current loan will be welcome; she will secure supplies for the period of festivals at the end of the year.  She will buy three cases of salted sole, three cases of salted sea bass, two cases of salted cod, and one case of salted tuna.  With this stock she plans to make more sales and be able to repay this new loan without difficulty. 

Her ambitions are to build a boutique to assure the future of her children, and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cases of salted fish such as tuna, sole, seabass and crovine

loans.name: Tely

texts.en:
Tely S. is from the village of San Ramon. He is 45 years old. Tely is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Tely owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tely has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Tely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Tely is requesting a new loan of 36,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Tely from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alginbert

texts.en:
Alginbert L. is from the village of Dist.4, Sa Manuel, Isabela. He is 24 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Alginbert owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alginbert has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Alginbert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alginbert is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alginbert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Esan

texts.en:
Esan is a hard-working, persistent entrepreneur from Tursunzade, in Southern Tajikistan. Ten years ago he decided to try opening his own small grocery sales business. Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand it further. Esan has requested a loan of $1200 so that he can purchase additional foodstuff for his grocery. He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers to use in making this ever-popular delicacy. Esan is married and has four children. One of his goals for his business is to be able to help his children as he can. We are happy for this opportunity to assist this responsible, dedicated business owner as he works to improve his livelihood. 

 




More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuff for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Madina has a small retail shop business that sells sugar and soap, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Madina hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Madina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her to be hardworking. She will now work hard to see that she completes paying back her loan.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Mutojo Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. James is the leader of Mutojo Tukwatanise group in Kihihi. He is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Two of his children are in school. He also takes care of other dependents. 

James has a business of selling second hand clothes from Katete Trading centre and he describes his customers as good clients. He is able to make 100,000 UGX as weekly profits and he needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale. He has been in this kind of business for 5 years after investing money from his tailoring workshop. He is a very hard working man and one of his dreams is to be able to improve his tailoring workshop and educate his children.

loans.use: Buying more second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and married.

In 2008, Wissam opened his own shop selling home appliances. He is becoming well-known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to extend his shop, install shutters, and increase his inventory. He is planning to expand and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Extend the shop, install shutters, and increase inventory

loans.name: Mwanapole

texts.en:
Mwanapole is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a cashew nut business for the past 10 years, selling at the market.  Mwanapole faces a major challenge of scarcity of raw materials due to unfavorable conditions. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N., aged 24 years, is married to Joseph Kirusuah Swakei, aged 35 years, who is a driver. Together, they have two children: Geoffrey, aged 8 years and Regina, aged 3 years. Jane runs a salon and barber shop business located at Olekaitoriori trading centre. Her business of 3 years gives her a monthly profit of KES 6,000.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office. This loan of KES 11,000 is her first loan with KADET and she plans to use it to purchase the seats for her salon and barber shop. She anticipates profits after the loan boost and she plans to pay the school fees of her children with it. 

Jane dreams of opening a hairdressing school. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase the seats for her salon and barber shop.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a las Sras. Eudelia B. y Anacleta V., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más acerca del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 19 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
La sra. Eudelia se dedica a la cría y venta de aves de corral, en especial de gallinas, posee su gallinero en su propia casa y por eso se facilita el tiempo que le dá al cuidado de él.
Ella es una mujer con muchas necesidades económicas, pero desea superar la pobreza en la que se encuentra, por ello confía en Kiva y solicita el crédito para la compra de más aves y medicamentos para sus cuidados.
texts.en:
This committee came into being thanks to Mrs. Eudelia B. and Mrs. Anacleta V.. They had visited the office of Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) Program. The women invited their friends and neighbors. They decided to work together to get ahead and thus improve their quality of life. The committee is made up of 19 hard-working, humble women who have to earn their living every day.
Mrs. Eudelia works raising and selling poultry, hens in particular. Her henhouse is in her own home. This makes it easier to spend time taking care of the henhouse.
She is a woman with many economic needs, but she wants to overcome the poverty in which she lives. For this, she turns to Kiva. She requests this loan to go towards the purchase of more birds and medicine to look after them.

loans.use: To buy hens and medicines for poultry.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina  is 32 years old.

Cristina  has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Cristina  requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like sardines, sugar, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Cristina  has been in this business for two years. Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una señora D. 59 años D. edad que vive junto a sus hijos, quienes ya trabajan. Ellos viven en el distrito D. Catacaos – Piura. La zona D. Catacaos es conocida en todo el Perú, por ser una zona D. orfebres, la joyería D. plata es la más común en esa zona. Además,  Catacaos es conocida por su deliciosa comida. 

DesD. hace 10 años Margarita se dedica a vender chicha (bebida tradicional hecha a base D. jora y maíz) y pequeños platos D. comida. Esta actividad la realiza 3 veces a la semana. Parte D. su negocio lo distribuye en la ciudad D. Paita, ubicada a 20 minutos D. Catacaos. Margarita conoce a la perfección su labor y cuenta con clientela fija en ambas zonas. 

La demanda D. Margarita ha aumentado  y ella no tiene el presupuesto necesario para satisfacerla, es por eso que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra D. maíz, jora y otros insumos que le permitan elaborar los potajes para satisfacer a su nueva clientela. Además con parte del préstamo Margarita podrá darle un mejor acondicionamiento a su negocio.

Margarita desea incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos, espera hacerse más conocida a través D. la promoción que le hagan sus clientes actuales.
texts.en:
Margarita is 59 years old.  She lives with her children, and they work.  They live in the Catacaos-Piura district.  The Catacaos zone is known throughout Peru as being a silver smith zone.  Silver jewelry is the most common in this zone.  Catacaos is also known for its delicious food. 

For ten years Margarita has been selling “chicha” (a traditional corn based-drink) and small food dishes.  She does this three times a week.  She distributes part of her products to the city of Paita, which is 20 minutes from Catacaos.  Margarita knows her work to perfection, and she has fixed customers in both zones.

Margarita’s demand has increased, and she does not have the means that are needed to meet the demand.  That is why she is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy corn, dried corn, and other supplies that will allow her to make the drinks to satisfy her new customers.  Margarita will also use part of the loan to be able to refurbish her business.

Margarita wishes to increase her sales and get greater income.  She plans to become more well-known through the endorsements that her current customers make.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the drinks she makes and to refurbish her stand

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith, 45, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in the country. Ith is a housewife, while two of her children are employed at a factory, earning an income of $2 US each per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $25 on food and $25 on other necessary expenses. 

Ith is requesting a loan of $1000 to finish the construction of her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to finish her construction of her house

loans.name: Noupagagnon Iv Group

texts.fr:
NOUPAGAGNON IV  est un regroupe de femmes mariées du village de KAFONO  dans la préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39   ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du gombo, du haricot.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
KORO, en tenue bleu au milieu,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter,  des semences d’arachide, les frais de labour et sarclage  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 26000 à 29000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
NOUPAGAGNON IV is a group of married women from the village of KAFONO, in the prefecture of SAN, Region of SÉGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. And they average 39 years of age and have at least six children. The group members grow peanuts, okra, beans, etc.

Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After properly repaying the previous loans, they are now on their second farm loan.

KORO, who is standing in the middle in the photo and dressed in blue, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanut seeds, to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy sundry supplies and equipment and some inputs for farming. These items are purchased at the main market of Kimparana City. Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain value. And then they are sold retail (and often in bulk) and for cash at the main market of Kimparana and at the surrounding markets. The customers generally come from large cities.

After selling the produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 26,000 to 29,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan interest and for covering typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 32-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has two children. He has been working in construction as a house painter for the past 10 years, which has given him wide experience in this industry. His customers include friends and other community members. Mouhamad says that he is very proud of his quality of work and believes that his extensive experience is what distinguishes him.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This will be his third loan from Al Majmoua; his previous loan had a big positive effect on his social and financial situation, and he is a borrower of good standing. He plans to use the loan to buy necessary tools for his business and to fix his house tiles.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business and to fix his house tiles

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Mary Jane has a retail shop that sells RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more RTW clothing to sell.

Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 27 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children who are two weeks old and five years old. Together with her partner, she has a business fixing computers. Miriam is asking for a loan to buy repair parts for computers. She also would like to begin purchasing computers to sell. Her goal is to begin expanding her business and this loan will greatly help her to do so. Miriam is a hardworking woman and is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for fixing computers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with three school-going children. Since the year 1985, she has been raising poultry to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to be well established so that she is able to become a major distributor of eggs and a chicken breeder. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy layers and boilers. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making her become self reliant.

loans.use: to buy layer and boiler chicks

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a 39 year-old married woman who has 2 children who are in school.  Bernadeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Bernadeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Bernadeth has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Bernadeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: G.s. Getsemani Group

texts.es: La señora Francisca  se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, las cuales distribuye en su tramo ubicado en el mercado. El financiamiento es para la compra de melones, naranjas, bananos, sandias, mangos entre otros.  Su mayor obstáculo es cuando las cosechas terminan el producto se pone caro y por eso se trabaja con préstamo. En su negocio aduce no tener mucha competencia ya que compra la mercadería a futuro es decir cosechas. Teresa tiene 63 años. En su negocio tiene competencia sin embargo como ella llega directamente al cliente puede vender satisfactoriamente. La señora Blanca tiene 54 años su esposo labora como vigilante y tiene dos hijos. Ahora están mejor ya que su esposo trabaja. Ella desea en un futuro ir mejorando poco a poco mi casa con las ganancias y prestamos. Continuara invirtiendo en mercaderías para sacarles ganancias. Julissa es integrante nueva del grupo, ella tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 9 años de edad. El mayor desafío que presenta es que ambos trabajan, por lo que tienen que dejar a una persona cuidando a sus hijos, principalmente radica en la educación que puedan estar recibiendo sus hijos. Considera la señora, el negocio funciona siempre y cuando sea administrado por los dueños, en este caso ella o su esposo. Su sueño es salir adelante con el negocio a través de los préstamos y permitir de esta manera construir su casa propia.
texts.en: Mrs. Francisca sells fruits and vegetables at her stand in the market.  The loan she is requesting is to buy melons, oranges, bananas, watermelons and mangos, etc.  Her greatest challenge is when the harvest season has concluded and products become expensive, making it necessary to work with loans.  She says she does not have much competition because she buys her merchandise before the harvest.  Teresa is 63 and although she does have competition she sells directly to the customer so her sales volume is satisfactory.  Mrs. Blanca is 54 and her husband works as a security guard.  They have two children.  They are now better off because her husband is working.  Her goal for the future is to gradually make home improvements with her earnings and loans.  She will continue investing in merchandise to sell for a profit.  Julissa is a new member of the group.  She is 27, married and has two children, ages 4 and 9.  Her greatest challenge is that both spouses work so she has to leave the children with a babysitter, and she worries about their education.  She feels a business can be successful as long as it is managed by the owners, in this case by her or her husband.  Her goal is to grow her business through the loans so she can build her own house one day.

loans.use: To buy melons, oranges, bananas, watermelon and mangos, etc.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Ana Elizabeth está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la clínica donde se alivio y atendieron a su hija quien acaba de nace
Ya que se le complico el parto y se le generaron pagas que no tenía contemplados y  no tiene el dinero necesario para liquidar la cuenta. 
Desea contar con su cooperación para este préstamo ya que es muy importante pagar esta deuda y así puedan seguir atendiendo a su hija.
Doña Ana Elizabeth por el momento se va ha dedicar al cuidado de su bebe, ya que su esposo el señor Juan Manuel se encargara de los gastos familiares y pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de una camión de carga.
Quiere que su pequeña hija tenga una vida mucho mejor es por eso que después desea iniciar un negocio de venta de artículos escolares.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Elizabeth is requesting a loan to pay a clinic where her newborn daughter was seen and treated.
The birth was complicated and there were unexpected costs. She does not have the money to pay off the bill.
She hopes for your support in this loan, since it is very important to pay this debt so that she can continue to care for her daughter.
Ana Elizabeth is currently taking care of her daughter full time, since her husband, Señor Juan Manuel, covers the household costs. They will pay off this loan with his salary from his job as the driver of a cargo truck.
Ana Elizabeth wants her little daughter to have a much better life, so she hopes to start a business selling school supplies.

loans.use: to cover medical costs

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas in 48 and the father of 3 children aged 18, 12 and 7. He has been in farming for 5 years in his home area of Nkubu in Central Kenya. His farm produces beans, bananas, and milk, all sold at the local market. Silas says that currently, the rains are not sufficient for farming. 

Silas has made a loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his dairy farming by purchasing a dairy cow. This is his third loan with Juhudi Kilimo after the first and second one of 25,000 KES and 20,000 KES respectively. He says the loan will help him acquire a better and more productive breed. He adds that he will use the income to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lesvia

texts.es:
La señora Lesvia vive en una localidad en la que celebran la fiesta del santo san Felipe en el mes de febrero, ella es casada con el señor  Eliseo y con quien procreo siete hijos quienes dos ya están casado y cinco a un están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella silicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra  y venta  de pollos de rancho para luego venderlo en la misma localidad , en donde lleva practicando  un año y tres meses  en la que está bien do un buen resultado de ingresos.

    Su  motivo ha esta actividad fue su familia  ya que también quiere a poyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  aun que él tiene un  buen trabajo  y sostenerlo ella desea aportar con algo y se sienta apoyado por su esposa.

     Lo que más desean es que con esta actividad y el préstamo  su ingreso se mejore  y logre con para  laminas para construir una casita en donde sus pollos puedan crecer en buen estado, así  con los ahorros que valla obteniendo siga adelante.
texts.en: Lesvia lives in a community that celebrates the Festival of San Felipe during February. She is married to Eliseo, with whom she has had seven children, two of which are already married, and the other five are her responsibility. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of chickens to later sell. She has been doing this work for a year and three months, and it is going well and she has raised good profits. Her motivation has been her family, since she wants to to support her husband with the household income. Even though he has a good job and provides for the family, Lesvia wants to help out with something so he can feel supported by his wife. What she wants most is that with her work and the loan her income will improve and she will be able to acquire some metal sheeting to build a coop so her chickens can be raised in good conditions. With the earnings, she plans to keep making headway.

loans.use: to buy chickens to later sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 8 años.
Teofila se dedica a la venta y compra D. cochinilla y tara, y venta D. cueros mojados en la feria, recuerda que sus hermanas le invitaron a integrarse al Banco Comunal, el negocio que tiene siempre fue familiar, sus padres le enseñaron ese negocio ahora ella tiene su propio capital, Finca tuvo mucho que ver en este crecimiento que ella tuvo por las capacitaciones, por los préstamos que le dieron y la confianza que depositaron en ella. Su meta es poder terminar D. construir su casa, ahora con préstamo comprará abarrotes para llevar a la feria.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the “Amaqella” Communal Bank. She is 51 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 8 years now.

Teofila buys and sells dyes, including cochineal, and she also sells uncured hides in the local fair. She recalls that her sisters invited her to join the communal bank. Her business was always a family affair; her parents taught her this business. Now, she possesses her own capital. Finca had a lot to do with the growth she has experienced through its training sessions, the loans it provided, and the confidence it placed in her.

Teofila's goal is to be able to finish constructing her house. Now, with this loan, she will buy grocery items to sell at the fair.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell at the local fair.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has three children. Her husband is a civil servant. She operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat) at Takoradi, which she has done for 15 years. Some of the foods she cooks are banku with okra stew or soup, fufu with light soup or fishermen’s soup and others. Esi assists her partner to educate her children.  Esi will use the loan to purchase food items to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to build a better structure.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Group

texts.en:
Veronica is married with 10 children. Veronica is 52 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Veronica is a farmer and produces corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 32 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers for the maintenance of her corn production.
 
She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Veronica hopes to be successful in her business.

Veronica is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 48-year-old married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Veronica has operated a fruit selling business for the past four years, and her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more fruits and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and maize for resale.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван – из Ужгорода, Западная Украина. Он торгует бытовой химией на одном из местных рынков, называемом «Краснодонцив». У Ивана есть свое торговое место. Товар неизменно пользуется спросом, есть своя клиентская база. В этом бизнесе Иван не так давно – всего один год. На данный момент его чистый доход составляет около 4 500 гривен в месяц. 

Иван планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен в приобретение дополнительного количества товара для последующей его реализации. Он начал развиваться как частный предприниматель совсем недавно и поэтому строит далеко идущие бизнес планы, планируя расширение и постепенное увеличение товарооборота с течением времени. За счет увеличения дохода от бизнеса, Иван планирует улучшать бытовые условия своей семьи.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Ivan is from Uzhgorod in Western Ukraine. He sells household cleaners at the local market named "Krasnodoncev". Ivan has his own market stall where his goods are always in demand, as he has many regular clients. Ivan has been running his business only for a short time - a year. His current monthly profits are about 4500 griven a month.

Ivan is planning to use the 15,000 griven loan from KIVA to purchase additional goods for his store for resale. Since he has only recently started his business, there is a lot of room for expansion and Ivan is planning to develop his store and increase the assortment of goods he can offer to his clients. Using the profits form this loan, Ivan is hoping to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: Colonne De Feu Plus Group

texts.en:
Furaha is the leader of the Community Bank named “Colonne de Feu Plus". It is composed of 20 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Furaha is 55 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children, whose ages range between 22 and 33 years old. Two of them attend school. She sells miscellaneous goods. She has been active in her business since 1974. She began her business running a general store. Furaha joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in order to achieve her dream of someday opening a beverage facility in her environment and has already received two loans and repaid them properly. 

Thanks to Hope’s loans, Furaha’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $50 per week. With the next loan, Furaha intends to buy more goods to resell at profit in order to increase her capital. She works hard in order to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing one more soya bean sack for reselling at a profit.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than is 58 years old with 4 children who are grown. She has a shop that sells Vietnamese traditional cigarettes. Her business started 10 years ago and    brings in good revenue for her. Joining our credit program in 2007, she has used loans effectively in maintaining this business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more of this kind of cigarettes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more of this kind of cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, es ama de casa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad, él es agricultor y ella le apoya en estas actividades agrícolas, ya que se ven beneficiados los dos con la producción de maíz, su esposo aprendió de sus padres todo el proceso de la siembra y hasta el momento ha ganado mucha experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para el pago de alquiler de dos manzanas de terreno, el cual utilizaran para sembrar, este préstamo les ayudara para disponer del dinero necesario para tener seguridad del terreno donde iniciaran pronto los cultivos.
El objetivo de Irma y su esposo, es trabajar juntos por el desarrollo de su hogar y sus hijos, manteniéndose unidos y trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Irma is a homemaker and lives with her husband and two children, ages 6 and 10. Her husband is a farmer and she helps with the farming activities. Their family benefits from their production of corn. Irma’s husband learned this trade from his parents, including the entire process of planting corn. To this moment, he has gained plenty of experience.

Irma is requesting a loan so that she can pay the rent on two plots of land that will be used for planting. This loan will help provide the necessary funds to secure land so that her family can begin planting their crops soon. The goal of Irma and her husband is to work together to develop their home and their children, as well as stay together and work hard.

loans.use: to pay the rent on two plots of farm land.

loans.name: Obra Misionera Group

texts.es:
Obra misionera es el grupo formado por 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, ellas son mujeres con muchos deseos de progreso y crecimiento, tienen la esperanza de un futuro mejor para ellas y sus hijos, es por ello que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder cumplir ese sueño.
Maximina es una de las miembros del grupo, y también es la presidenta, comenta que ella al igual que sus demás compañeras tiene el deseo de poder darles un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y también poder seguir ayudando con los gastos de la casa. Ella comenta que su medio de vida es la venta de frutas y en su tiempo libre recicla.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecerse con frutas de estación, pues de esta forma tendrá surtido su stock para hacer frente al pedido de los clientes.
texts.en:
“Obra Misionera” is the group formed by 17 women from the city of Villa Elisa.  They are women who very much want to grow and make progress; they hope for a better future for themselves and for their children and this is why they strive to the maximum effort to reach this dream.

Maximina is one of the members of the group and she’s also its President.  She comments that she and her fellow members want to provide a better standard of living for their families and also continue to help with household expenses.  She comments that her way of earning her livelihood is selling fruit and in her free time she recycles.

She requested the loan to stock up on seasonal fruit because this way she’ll be well-stocked and be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi would like to buy insecticides, pestcides,veterinary drugs and animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane intends to purchase a pig

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salome wants to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereal supply business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy an arcade machine and washing machine

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi S. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business activities. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Binod S., works in a Mobil shop. Her older son is studying in grade 7 and her younger son is in primary school.
Mrs. S. sells different types of shoes and sandals in a footpath market. The rent for the shops in that area is very high, so she can't afford to pay rent.  She needs to purchase different varieties of shoes and sandals for her shop. So she is asking for a Rs15,000 (US$250) loan to purchase different types of shoes and sandals, especially for children and ladies.

loans.use: To buy different types of shoes and sandals

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.en: Abdurauf A. lives in Khujand; he is married and has 4 children.  He has been an active and strongly motivated client of MicroInvest since 2004.  His credit history makes him eligible to receive new and larger loans. Mr A. is experienced in the business of making pickled and salted foods (pickled cucumbers and tomatoes, assorted pickled vegetables), jams, and juices. Because he buys wholesale and in bulk, his prices are lower than regular bazaar prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to expand his assortment of goods and to purchase new equipment for preparing different recipes. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To purchase new food-preparation equipment

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mrs. Beatrice O. is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City. Beatrice sells Garri (a popular West African food made from cassava tubers) to people living in her community. Beatrice has been in this business since 1996. She is requesting a loan of $450 to expand her supply of Garri. She is a hard-working LAPO member.

loans.use: To expand her supply of Garri

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda K. has been a MicroInvest client since 2004. She is 48 years old, she is married, and she has 4 children. She is engaged in the business of selling beauty supplies and perfumes (hair dyes/tints, creams, shampoo, soaps, scents, etc.) as well as everyday goods (toothpaste, detergents, etc). Mrs. K. purchases her goods from bulk suppliers, which is why she can sell those goods at prices that are lower than in the bazaar. Now Mrs. K. seeks a loan of 1500 TJS ($450) for business development and to purchase new goods.

loans.use: To expand her business to purchase additional goods

loans.name: Isok

texts.en:
Isok Abdulloev is 41 years old. He is married with three children.

Isok is an entrepreneur. In 1988, Isok graduated from the Polytechnic Institute in Ukraine, with a specialty in engineering. Unfortunately, he was not able to find a job in his specialty. At that time, being the head of his family, he decided to work the land and grow agricultural crops.

Two years ago, Isok started a business selling small cattle. This business became the main source of income for Isok and his family, generating stable profits and allowing the family to improve their living conditions.

Now Isok is planning to construct a covered enclosure for sheep. For this purpose, he requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Isok and he promises to repay it promptly.

loans.use: Constructing a covered enclosure for sheep

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun C. (pictured with her daughter) is a widow with six children; two sons and four daughters. Both of her sons are married and live outside the family home. Three of her daughters work in a garment factory and other one weaves silk at home. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a weaver since 1965. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to a middle man in the village who then sells it in Phnom Penh. 
Mrs. Saroeun is requesting a loan of $300 to repair some parts of her house.

loans.use: to repair some parts of her house

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones M. is a fisherman who is married, with two children. His business is doing well, but his fishing net is very old and he wishes to buy a new one.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more fishing materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy more fishing materials

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga sell herbs, spices and home-made "guisantes en pasta" (a local pasta dish made with peas). She used to work as a street vendor selling sandwiches. A friend showed her how to make guisantes en pasta and, for the last year, she's been making and selling it in a market near her house. She works from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.

The loans that she's applied for have helped her set up her business. Dominga would like to expand the business and offer new products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Dominga vende hierbas, especias y guisantes en pasta hechos de forma casera. Antes, ella vendía sándwiches de forma ambulatoria. Pero una amiga le enseñó a hacer los guisantes en pasta, por lo que desde hace 1 año vende estos productos en el mercado que está cerca de su casa. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para implementar su puesto. A Dominga le gustaría aumentar el stock de ventas y ofrecer nuevos productos.

loans.use: Develop food business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Ms. Martha G. makes cakes and sells them at an educational center in Managua. She has been in the baking business for 7 years, despite the fact that not all seasons are favorable for her, which is why she had to look for an alternative; she now sells clothing for a living as well.

A neighbor showed her how to prepare cakes that the students enjoy. She would like to keep learning more about how to improve the quality of her products. With this loan, she will purchase the ingredients needed for baking cakes, thus boosting sales and consequently her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Martha G. se dedica a la pastelería y vende sus productos en un centro escolar de Managua. Desde hace 7 años se dedica al oficio de la pastelería aunque no todas las temporadas son buenas, es por eso que buscó una nueva alternativa y ahora se dedica también a la venta de ropa.

Una vecina amiga de ella fue quien le enseñó a preparar la repostería tan gustada por los alumnos. Desea seguir aprendiendo mucho más para poder mejorar la calidad del producto que ofrece. Con el préstamo comprará materia prima para elaborar más repostería y así aumentar su nivel de ventas y por ende sus ganacias.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cakes to sell in her snack bar

loans.name: Sipora

texts.en: Sipora A. is a 55-year-old widow and mother of 6 children. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, with her children. She is the proprietor of a grocery stall, which she has run for the last 25 years. She sells various products, including fruits, vegetables, and eggs, commonly used in the community. She requires a US$500 loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank Kusikuy, which means “Be Happy” in Quechua. Nancy is a single mother, 48 years old, and has two children who are now adults, whom she educated by herself. She makes traditional breads from the region such as chapla, a round bread with a hollow center, and wawa (which means “baby” in Quechua), an infant-shaped bread. She makes her breads in a rented oven and she sells them at a stall in the central market in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Nancy travels to the market in Vinchos on Sundays where she sells assorted groceries as well as bread.

Nancy needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($425), which she will use to purchase sugar, rice and flour. Nancy’s dream is to grow her business, have her own capital, and that her children become financially stable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua. Nancy es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos ya mayores a quienes educo sola, ella elabora panes típicos de la región como la chapla, Wawa, que elabora en horno alquilado, sus ventas lo realiza en un puesto del mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Nancy los días domingos viaja a la feria del distrito de Vinchos en donde vende abarrotes surtidos y también panes.

Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz y harina. Los sueños de Nancy es que su negocio crezca, tener capital propio y que sus hijos tengan estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Наимова Мухаё женщина в возросте 30 лет имеет 2 детей , работает учительницей начальных классов. Из-за того что заработная плата учителей очень низкая,Мухаё имеет свой маленький магазинчик, где она продаёт хозяйственные товары.И имеет дополнительный доход.Узнав от подруг что они кредитуются в Микроинвесте , она решила взять кредит на увеличение ассортимента товаров.
texts.en:
Muhayo N. is a woman of 30, who has two children. She works as a primary school teacher. To augment the low salary she earns as a teacher, Muhayo has a small shop where she sells household products. Having learned that some of her friends had loans from MicroInvest, she decided to take out a loan to expand the variety of products she carries.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer
