She assures that her clothing sales have always been lucrative, attracting regular customers. "On good days my investment of 1,000 soles triples," she says excitedly. As far as problems she has had to overcome, Diana mentions the lack of her own capital as principal, but with time and thanks to her tireless work, this enterprising woman plans to open up a convenience store so she won't have to travel as much. With your support, Diana will obtain her fourth loan through Kiva partner MFP, an organization she is grateful to, and promises to work hard to make her payments. At the same time she feels content working with her community bank because some of the members also make a living in the same trade. Once she obtains the credit, she will travel to the city of Lima to invest 2,000 soles in the purchase of clothing, since she already has confirmed clients for December and January.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in the city of Lima.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with seven children. Susan is 49 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City.

Susan sells cartons to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase cartons for her business.

Susan has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Susan hopes to expand her business buying and selling cartons.

loans.use: To purchase cartons for her business

loans.name: Bibituydigul

texts.ru: Бибитуйдигул 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Бибитуйдигул занимается торговлей мужской одежды на рынке. В этой области он 13 лет. Бибитуйдигул хочет заняться скотоводством. Она берет кредит для закупа телят и коровы. Хочет закупить телят для откорма и последующей продажи по более выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Bibituydigul is forty-five years old, married and has four children. She has a high-school level of education and sells men's clothing on the market. She's worked in this field for the past thirteen years but wants to start a business breeding cattle. 
Bibituydigul is asking for a loan to purchase some calves and a cow. She plans to fatten the calves and then sell them for profit.

loans.use: to purchase some calves and a cow.

loans.name: Rocky

texts.en:
Rocky is 27 years old and has a farming business as a source of income. He is married and blessed with one child. He is making his own way to provide for the needs of his family. However, there are certain problems that he cannot avoid such as high cost of purchasing foods and farm inputs that he needs to continue his business. He suffers financial constraint.

For this reason, Rocky is asking for a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides used in his business. Through his loan, patience, hard work, and love to his family, he will be able to continue his business and improve more to earn high income. He wants to save for the growth of his family as well as for their education.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides used in his business.

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en:
Jameeleh is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three daughters and sons, and they live in Al Rusaifeh where her husband works as a driver.
Jameeleh has a hobby knitting and embroidering fabric. Four years ago, with the prices of everything rising, Jameeleh started to use her hobby and talent to add another source of income to the family. She started embroidering dresses and making traditional dresses (as shown in the picture) for sale. At first, she made the dresses to order to avoid losing money, but now she makes larger quantities to sell to clothes shops.
Now Jameelah has applied for a loan to buy more fabric and materials in order to increase productivity. She hopes to open her own workshop in the future where she can employ more people to help her.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and material to increase productivity.

loans.name: Yvette Fay

texts.en:
Yvette is 24 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Yvette is married and has two children. 

Yvette has a general store that sells a variety of goods. Yvette has had this business for three years. Yvette requested a loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Yvette has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Yvette hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned  goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, fruit, bananas and apples

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette is aged 45. She has 8 children, 5 of whom attend school. Her husband works as farmer. For seven years she has been selling foodstuffs. She has requested this loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to pay school fees and make savings. In the future, she would like to have a big inventory.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 52 year old who is married with children and who operates a retail business that he has run for a period of 10 years now. Peter was a fishmonger on Lake Albert first, then accumulated capital and started a retail business. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting the growth of his business.

Peter wishes to expand his business to new markets and to diversify his business. He wants a loan to buy sodas, salt, and sugar for resale. He has a dream of educating his children and buying a car.

loans.use: to buy sodas, salt, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Nuni

texts.en: Nuni Is a Student which come From Cibeber. she has bad story in her life, because she becoming from Poorest family, and her parents was oldest, and she has 1 young brother, and for handle the school costs she usually selling snack in the school, but right now was 3 weeks ago she isn't selling it. and by dint of that's situation komida comes and try for help her about this, and she Wish komida and KIVA can for cooperate help her.

loans.use: To Pay For Monthly costs School.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. Koffi H. dropped out of school at secondary school having lost his means of support. Very early on, he demonstrated a passion for business, since he had to take care of himself. For several years, he has been working as a waiter in bars. Because of his extensive work experience in this area, he decided to open his own bar in order to improve his standard of living. He succeeded in getting a $450 loan and set up his bar in the heart of Aného. He is popular there due to his energy and pride in his work, which are the deciding factors in his line of work. He now has a steady yet ever-growing customer base. So to meet this demand, he feels he should improve his business by enlarging his bar, thus making it more inviting.

To do this, Mr. H. is requesting a loan of $1,200 that will be used to acquire tables and chairs. It will also be enough financial capital to stock beverages direct and in bulk, like pubs do. This will allow him to clear a large enough profit to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Monsieur H. Koffi a abandonné ses études au cours secondaire quand il n’avait plus de soutien. Il éprouve très tôt une passion pour le commerce car obligé de se prendre en charge. Il travaille plusieurs années comme serveur dans des bars et acquis une grande expérience dans le domaine. Fort de cela, il décide d’ouvrir lui-même un bar en vue d’améliorer ses conditions d’existence. Il réussit à obtenir un crédit de $450 et installa son bar au cœur de la ville d’Aného. Son dynamisme et son sens de travail bien fait l’ont rendu populaire dans la localité, ce qui constitue un atout majeur pour son activité. Il a aujourd’hui une clientèle abondante et régulière et il se trouve dans l’obligation d’augmenter sa prestation d’où le projet d’élargir le bar pour le rendre plus attrayant.

Pour ce faire, Monsieur H. demande un crédit de $1200 qui va servir à l’achat de tables et chaises pour et disposer de fonds de commerce pour commander les boissons en gros directement à la brasserie. Ce qui lui permettra de dégager une marge bénéficiaire importante au besoin de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquision of tables and chairs and constitution of a capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria O. is a 48-year-old woman. She is happily married and blessed with six children. She testifies that the LAPO has lifted her up from the grip of poverty. She will use the loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of kerosene

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch M., 48 years old, has 5 children and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She is a farmer cultivating and growing crops in a field behind her house. With crop growing, Uch M. makes very little money for  the household, but to increase the family savings Chay Heng, her husband, who is a head of family, helps by working as a construction foreman. Four of her children attend school, and the other one works in a garment factory and contributes that salary to financing the household. Uch M. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase a piece of land to grow more crops for additional income. In the future, if the family savings increase, she hopes to have enough money to open a grocery store at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow some crops

loans.name: Higinio Luis

texts.es:
Higinio C. is 48 years old and married. He lives in Carapeguá and has four children. His wife tends a shop in their home while he sells clothing at the municipal market. Together, they manage to support the family and pay for the children’s education. Twenty one years ago Higinio opened his first shop selling clothing in front of the bus station. A few months ago he opened a stall at the municipal market selling clothing and undergarments. Demand is strong and thanks to the good location sales have started to take off. At this point he would like to expand his product line to include a greater variety of t-shirts, shirts and trousers, hoping to boost sales and better provide for his family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Higinio C. tiene 48 años, es casado, vive en Carapeguá y tiene 4 hijos. Su señora atiende una despensa que tienen en su casa y don Higinio atiende un puesto de ventas de ropas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad; con los ingresos generados pueden cubrir los gastos de la familia y el estudio de sus hijos. Higinio empezó abriendo un kiosco hace 21 años frente a la terminal de ómnibus de la ciudad; hace unos meses se decidió a montar un puesto de venta de artículos de mercería y ropas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, ya que la demanda de este rubro ha aumentado bastante en esta zona, y gracias a la buena ubicación ya ha empezado a ver sus frutos. Su meta actualmente es ampliar este negocio con la compra de mayor variedad de mercaderías como remeras, camisas, pantalones para aumentar sus ventas y consecuentemente tener mayores ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, trousers, shorts and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette (standing at right in the picture) is a 40-year-old woman living in Lebaa in the South of Lebanon. She is married with no kids and is the sole financial provider of the household, as her husband is sick and unemployed.

Antoinette has specialized in handicraft and creates flowers arrangement using fabric as the main material. She also paints on fabrics and sells her work in the village community or through local exhibitions.

Antoinette is part of a group with other women. The group consists of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Buy fabrics to produce handicraft flowers.

loans.name: Roxana Maricela

texts.es:
Roxana Maricela and her husband have a beautiful daughter who is doing really well in school, since she is getting very good grades. However, Roxana's husband's luck is not so good, since he was fired from his previous job due to his company downsizing. Because of this, Roxana had to figure out how to help her family get through this. And so it was that she got a job with a woman who owned a beauty salon close to her house, and she learned how to apply artificial fingernails, which she was really good at. After a few months, she decided to start her own business applying artificial fingernail, which has allowed her to support her family.

Right now, her husband does have a job, but Roxana is determined to grow this business so that it can be left as patrimony to her daughter. Roxana is convinced that this winter season is the best for the application of artificial fingernails, since many women have parties and want to look their best. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $ 635 to be paid within 6 months. With this money Roxana will be able to buy more materials to apply more fingernails, and so be able to buy a small gift to her daughter as a reward for studying hard and getting ahead. In your hands you have the power to help Roxana.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana Maricela y su esposo tienen una hermosa hija que está estudiando y aprobecha muy bien la escuela, puesto que tiene buenas calificaciones, sin embargo la suerte de el esposo de Roxana no es la misma, puesto que de su anterior trabajo, lo despidieron, por un recorte que hicieron en la empresa dónde trabajaba, y fue así como Roxana tuvo que idearselas para que su familia saliera adelante. Y Fue así como consiguió trabajo con una señora que tenía una estética cerca de su casa y aprendió a poner uñas, lo cual se le dio con facilidad, y a los meses decide separarse de la señora para comenzar su propio camino como aplicadora de uñas. Lo cual es lo que a podido solventar a su familia.

Actualmente su esposo tiene trabajo pero Roxana está decidida a crecer este negocio, para que se quede como un patrimonio para su hija. Roxana está convencida que la temporada de invierno es la mejor para las aplicaciones de uñas, puesto que muchas mujeres tiene fiestas y desean estar presentables, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $625 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Roxana podrá comprar mercancía para aplicar más uñas y así poder comprarle un pequeño obsequi a su hija como recompensa a su esfuerzo por estudiar y salir adelante. En tus manos está el poder ayudar a Roxana.

loans.use: Buying materials to apply artificial fingernails.

loans.name: Muyasar

texts.en: Muyasar O. lives in the Gafurov region.  She works in the joint-stock company “Navbakhor” making ladies' suits.  She has been an active, serious client of MicroInvest since 2005.  A stable business and increased income have helped her pay back previous loans.  She is a skilled seamstress and works from her own patterns. Ms. O. would like to buy different fabrics to make suits according to the season.  She is asking for a loan of $400 to buy materials for winter suits so that she can offer a wider selection.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for winter suits

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 52 year old mother of 3 living with her family in Beirut. She owns a dry cleaning business and is requesting her fourth A. Majmous loan to cover the maintenance costs of her business in order to sustain and continue developing it.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance costs for her laundry business

loans.name: Station C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Scovia N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to add to her clothes business. Scovia is 30 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children aged 11 and 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Scovia makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Scovia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Scovia is joined in her small group by Justine N., Lydia N., Jameo K., and Juliet K.. Justine N. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy another sewing machine. Lydia N. currently sells clothes and wants a loan to expand the business. Jameo K. operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Juliet K. is currently in the beauty salon business and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To boost and uplift the clothes business

loans.name: Vasila

texts.en: Vasila is 34 years old. She is a mother of 3 children. The H. family lives in Khachmaz town of Azerbaijan. Vasila has 2 years of experience in this business. Now, this woman needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Fatimo

texts.en: Fatimo A. is 29 years of age, married with 3 children,  and comes from Lagos State Nigeria. She sells drinks, juice, recharges cards and also makes phone calls. She acquired the skill for 2 years and has been operating her business since 2001. Fatimo has being borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and she is soliciting for a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more lines, recharge cards and drinks so that she can meet the high demand of her numerous customers and increase her profitability.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and recharge cards

loans.name: Juana Maruja

texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the Alondras community bank for the past 8 years. She is 41 years old and a single mother of two daughters.

Juana sells clothing, sheets and blankets in the Nery García market. She buys her products in Nery García daily, and her sales are made on credit. Juana has another stand in Nery García where she sells various types of bread that she buys from different stores in the city of Huamanga.

Juana needs a loan of 3,000 soles ($1075 USD) to buy sweaters, blouses, bed spreads and blankets.

She hopes to build a house, dreams that her children are well educated, and hopes to own her own business selling potatoes.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, blouses, bed spreads and blankets.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat S., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Bou, were married in 2004. They have one daughter. The couple lives with their parents along National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Socheat has been a motor remorque driver for two years. A remorque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. Before he started this business, he was a security guard. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh, while his wife Sokha has been a garment worker for four years.

Socheat is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one for his motor remorque taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer to replace his old one for his Motor Remorque taxi

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P., 31, is married with 5 children and lives in the Vaitele area of Upolu Island, Samoa. She has many years of experience operating a general store, from which she sells to the general public and villagers 7 days a week.

Anita has a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (US$208). SPBD loans are Anita’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to purchase sacks of sugar, rice, salt, and flour, as well as tinned goods and soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Ouch K. H., 55, lives in Sa Ang with her husband, Ouch Sengly, and their two working children. She sells porridge out of her home every day and makes about US$ 2.50 per day, while her husband teaches in the local school. Their children work growing vegetables and selling them in the local food market to support the family.

Ouch K. H. has asked for a loan of US$ 1000 to diversify her family's income and improve her standard of living. She would like to purchase some piglets to raise and sell for additional income. She sees this, not only as a profitable venture in the short term, but also a business that might be able to provide for her family in the future. With any leftover money, she would like to repair her family's home. To provide for the comfort and safety of her family, she sees this, too, as a valuable investment. .

loans.use: Purchase pigs; repair home

loans.name: Hach

texts.en:
Mr. Hach R., 23 years old, makes charcoal to sell in his area. He has been running his business since 2005 and earns around US$4.66 per day. Hach sells the charcoal from his home area to his customers, including retailers and wholesalers. He is married to Mrs. Hon Sona, 20 years old. They have one child, who is too young to be in school yet. They live in Khnasanday Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income Hach wants to sell his charcoal by transporting it to customers' homes. He needs oxen to use as transportation, but he faces the obstacle of lacking the money to purchase two oxen. Hence, Hach would like to request a loan to carry out his plan. Hach's wife is pictured because Hach was unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to transport products to customers

loans.name: Iravan

texts.en: Iravan is 38 years old, is married, and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, and is settled in the Kayidish village. He has been in the dairy business for five years. Now he needs a loan of $875 in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Geovana Estela

texts.es: La señora Geovanna se dedica a la venta de artesanias en la calle Sagarnaga, una calle turística y colonial de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia a su vez un lugar muy visitado por personas extranjeras, donde se puede comprar objetos autóctonos propios de la región y el país, asi como tejidos y manualidades hechas por manos bolivianas. Se dedica a este rubro desde muy pequeña, puesto que su mamá tenía este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene una hijita pequeña, de la que se ocupa, con el apoyo de su familia. Es muy reponsable, invertirá el crédito en la compra de aretes y collares hechos de semillas, y otros materiales artesanales.
texts.en:
Geovana has dedicated herself to the sale of crafts in La Paz, Bolivia on a street called Sagarnaga which is in a colonial district popular with tourists. It is a place where many foreigners come to buy objects native to the region and the country as well as fabrics and crafts made by Bolivian hands. She has been doing this work since she was small when her mother owned the business. She has a young daughter she cares for with the help of her family. Geovana is very responsible and with the loan she will invest in earrings and necklaces made from seeds and other craft materials.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of earrings and necklaces

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C., a 50-year-old farmer and mother five from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, is a graduate of BS Agriculture. Her husband inherited a 2-hectare rice field from his parents, which they farm as for their daily sustenance.

“Rice is a very important crop”, Teresita says/  They have farmed rice to ensure food on their table. The entire family helps with the crop so they don't have to hire laborers.

Teresita is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizers and chemicals increase the productivity of her farm

She hopes the higher yield will help her buy another hectare of land, and slowly produce enough rice to raise her family's living conditions. In her own words: "With this loan, surely I could hit my target yield in my farm and slowly, I will be able to realize all my dreams."

CEV has provided all its clients insurance benefits plus credit assistance and training for their well being.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Akole

texts.en:
Akole T. is 38 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. She makes a living selling food, including cassava dough, corn dough and maize, in the local market of Koforidua, the town where she lives. Cassava and corn dough are produced by milling fresh cassava and maize to obtain the main ingredients for banku, one of the most popular dishes in Ghana. She has been in this business for the past eight years, and has lots of experience in serving and winning over customers. 

Akole is a hard worker, and aims to save enough money to provide her children with a quality education. She plans to use this loan to buy increased supplies of cassava and maize so that she can make enough dough to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is a member of the Good Shepherd Trust Group, whose members agree to help each other secure and repay loans. 

Akole does not sell on the days her group meets, and this photo was taken during a meeting. She would be grateful for any assistance Kiva lenders are able to provide.

loans.use: To buy additional cassava and maize.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira A. is a 50-year-old mother of five children. She is a rice grower. She uses her rice for the family consumption, and then she sells the excess to rice traders to earn something for the family. While they are waiting for the next harvest, Elvira grows corn and vegetables in their yard. In this way, they have an alternative source of income to enjoy. She a hardworking mother who handles their family budget efficiently. She wants a good life for her children, and she doesn’t mind working all day to fulfill that dream.

Elvira needs a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm. Considering that she also has a corn and vegetable garden in their yards, she really needs fertilizer to ensure good yields. Through this loan, she believes she could double their harvest and could sell more rice, corn, and vegetables to traders in their hometown.

She is happy about being part of the CEVI microfinancing program. Through CEVI, she has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (04) femmes du groupe Soutra (sont toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et 04 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles au quartier I, un des quartiers de la ville de Loulouni sous préfecture, la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente d’habits, de céréales, d’atiéke et d’ustensiles de cuisine.
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle ; elles sont à leur neuvième prêt (prêt de groupe) et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 1tonne de  maïs, 2sacs de 100kg d’atiéke, 2douzaines de tasses – louches en aluminium et en plastique et des habits (une douzaine de complets pour enfants). Elles s’approvisionnement à Sikasso ville, Loulouni et ses localités environnantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché surtout aux forains et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et la plupat au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 29.500fcfa par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Soutra ambitionnent d’être, un jour, chacune une commerçante grossiste et ouvrir un magasin ou une boutique.
texts.en:
The four (04) women of the Soutra group are all married and on average are 41 years old and have 4 children. They live in traditional families in District I, one of the areas in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administration region of Mali. They run various businesses which include, among others, the buying and re-selling of clothing, cereals, atiéke, and cooking utensils. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the needs of their customers; they are on their ninth group loan, and all their previous loans were repaid properly. With this loan, they intend to buy 1 tonne of maize, two 100-kilo bags of atiéke, 2 dozen cups, aluminium and plastic ladles, and clothing (one dozen children's outfits). They supply themselves in the town of Sikasso, in Loulouni, and the neighbouring villages. The merchandise is sold in the market, especially during market days, and in various districts to a clientele composed generally of women, most of whom pay in cash. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 29,500 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used for their family needs, and the other portion will be invested in their businesses. The women of the Soutra group each have the ambition one day to be a wholesale merchant and to open a shop or a store.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell various items

loans.name: Luisa Julia

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Luisa es casada tiene 63 años, tres hijos todos  mayores que están casados.
Luisa siempre se dedico a su casa, pero hace ocho años se animo a poner una bodega en su casa, empezó vendiendo gelatina, marcianos, galletas poco a poco fue comprando mas y mas cosas, hoy en día su esposo la ayuda.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, para comprar gaseosa, arroz, azúcar, una vitrina exhibidora.
Con Finca pudo invertir más,  ahora su tienda D. abarrotes esta surtida, aprenD. mucho D. las experiencias D. las demás socias.
El sueño D. Luisa es seguir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos a que progresen.
texts.en:
Luisa is a Member of the Communal Bank Los Claveles. Luisa is married, is 63 years old, and has 3 older children who are married. Luisa always dedicated herself to her home, but 8 years ago she felt inspired to open a small grocery store in her home. She began by selling gelatin, popsicles, and cookies, and little by little she continued buying more and more things; nowadays her husband helps her. Luisa needs a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase soda, rice, sugar, and a display case. With Finca Luisa was able to invest more, and today her grocery store is well stocked; she learns a lot from the experiences of the other bank members. Luisa’s dream is to continue moving forward and to help her kids make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luisa needs a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase soda, rice, sugar, and a display case.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort D. has a senior high education and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a trader, and she assists him with the housekeeping expenses.

Since 2003 Comfort has run a restaurant in Adisadel village in Cape Coast, where she serves a variety of local dishes such as fufu (made from pounding together cassava and plantain). Her loan will be used to buy more spices, ingredients and food items for her restaurant. Comfort hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the completion of the family home.

loans.use: To buy more spices, ingredients and food items for her restaurant

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Mrs. Bou T., 46, owns a few looms in her home for braiding silk. She usually braids traditional skirts and scarves for sale. Her clients order her products a few days or a week before she begins braiding them. To make more products, her six children assist with her business activities when they are not studying.

She is married to Mr. Hoeun, 47, who invests as a rice cultivator. T. thinks her husband's business is profitable for the family. She would like a $1000 loan in order to buy a cultivating machine. They will use it to plow a field and to make other income by renting it to the farmers. The family lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Najah has been working as a hairdresser for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of her salon. This is the first time that Najah has requested a loan. Najah is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. She decided on starting her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans on expanding her salon.

loans.use: Najah will use the loan to change the décor of her salon.

loans.name: Puriza

texts.en:
Puriza is already 50 years old and married to Crispin L.. They are blessed with four children. The eldest is Crispin L., Jr., second is Celito, the third is Maria, and the youngest is May-Anne, who is still studying in college and hopefully will finish her studies to have a good employment in the future. The couple lives together with their children in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.

Puriza is engaged in making and selling “labong” in their village. “Labong” is a kind of vegetable that is used in vegetarian dishes. It comes from young bamboo shoots. Puriza is gaining an income of one thousand pesos weekly in selling “labong” in their village. She wants to acquire many customers to be able to earn more profit.

For this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a large quantity of “labong” to sell in their village and in the market. Puriza would also like to revive her old bankrupt store to further generate additional income. Her store has been closed due to lack of funds.

She is hoping to have some savings with the help of ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) and, through her sacrifices, she believes that God will guide her to be able to attain all her goals. She also dreams to send her youngest child to school and have her finish a college course someday. She will be in second year college next school year and it will require more income for her to pursue her studies. Lastly, Puriza shared an inspiring quotation that says; “If others can, why can’t I?”

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of “labong” to sell

loans.name: Wumi

texts.en: Wumi is thirty years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and medicines.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario C. is from the village of Anonang, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 53 years old. Mario is widowed and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns & operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crabs and other delicacies in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mario is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo Y., 41, is a native of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a farmer. He was happy with farming yet he also felt the need to have a daily income to provide for his wife and four children. That’s why in 2006, he acquired a motorcycle and started transporting people in their locality and in neighboring towns as well.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for his farm. It’s been three years since his acquisition of the motorcycle and he needs Php 8,000 now for its maintenance. He is asking for this amount from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) as a loan. He is satisfied with his membership in CEVI because aside from loans, part of his income is set aside as savings and kept safe by the institution for Abelardo.

loans.use: Fertilizers and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.es:
Fortunita es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Fortunita es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita tiene un puesto en el mercado las Américas en donde vende papa, los productos los adquiere de los productores.
Fortunita necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños e Fortunita son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Fortunita is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. Fortunita has a vending stall in the Las Américas Market where she sells potatoes that she acquires from producers.

Fortunita needs a loan 600 soles in order to buy more potatoes. She dreams that her children will become professionals and of running a grocery store from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Мавлюда

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мавлюда женщина , которая торгует на рынке "Паншанбе" города Худжанда. Она продаёт печенья разных видов и наименований, местного производства и российского производства.Получив займ Мавлюда хочет пополнить свой товарооборот несколько видами конфет и сахаром рафинад.

loans.use: на увеличение продктовых товаров

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Quiindy en el Compañía Comandante P. distante a 18km. de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas se dedica al trabajo de ventas y otras actividades ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar através del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida . 
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual. 
Las actividades individuales que realizan estas señoras, y en las que invertirán sus créditos son:
Ramona V.	Venta de comestibles 
Ma-Sixta R. D.	Venta de chipa
Etelvina R. D.	Venta de verduras y carne
Ermelinda R. D.	Despensa
Olga C.	Venta de Bebidas
Petrona P.	Venta de verduras
Ma-Elia C.	Venta de frutas
Mirian López	vendedora
Norma B.	Venta de remedios yuyos
Delicia G.	cantinera
Ma-Lourdes C.	Venta de verduras
Ester P.	Venta de Frutas y verduras
Vidalia C.	vendedora
Luciana F.	Despensa
Vidalia R. D.	Venta de chipas y dulces
Nancy B.	Venta de bebidas
Verónica A.	Venta de chipas
Natividad O.	Venta de chipas
Carmen G.	Venta de leche

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias como carnes, panificados, verduras, frutas, almidón harina de maíz, queso, leche, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Mirismayil

texts.en:
Mirismayil M. is a young clothing merchant from Agsu, Azerbaijan. He started his small business when he was nineteen and gradually, through much hard work, he has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise.

Mirismayil has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural businessman.

Mirismayil has requested 1607 AZN to add to his available working capital. The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for merchants such as Mirismayil. He would like to buy a supply of men's clothes for the autumn-winter season.

Mirismayil appreciates the availability of funding through AqroInvest Credit Union. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal men's clothes

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom is 12 and the other of whom is 16.  All of her children go to school. She resides and owns a four room house where she is staying with six people. Mayi takes care of additional family members as well. The family has access to electricity, but no running water.

Mayi has a stall selling charcoal. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for 8 years and with MCDT for 1 year. She doesn’t pay rent for her business but pays weekly market dues of 2000. The Owino market is one of the busiest markets in Kampala City, so she is willing to incur transport costs to get there and back. Her challenges include transportation, the increasing price of charcoal and the rainy season. Mayi wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She wants to develop her business and start selling only wholesale.

loans.use: purchasing more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say L. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three young children in Takeo province. She is a professional weaver who is able to make a living of US$ 3 every day, while her husband is a recycler and also makes US$ 3 per day. Say L. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which she needs to purchase more silk to expand her business.

loans.use: materials for weaving

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
Methew A., age 35, is married with two children, ages 11 and 9. He also cares for his younger brother's son, who is 12. He has had a general store since 2001. He works daily from 6:30 am until 11 pm, making a monthly profit of about $267.

This will be Methew's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase the stock of his general store, buying more items like sugar, wheat, flour, cooking oil, mosquito sprays, and fabrics.

Methew will share this loan with subgroup D of the White group. The subgroup has seven members, who run groceries, general stores like Methew's, and work as food vendors. These members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Methew is the first on the left.

loans.use: To buy stock for Methew's general store

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mr. Van C., 66, has been driving a motor taxi for 10 years. His wife has been selling food in front of her house for one year. They are living along national road number one, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Unfortunately, Van’s motorbike is old and does not work well. Van is asking for his first loan of $300 to repair his motorbike and continue working. He will also use a part of the loan to help his wife build a storefront for her business.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike & build a storefront for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda, de 35 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Yeny de 14 y David de 9 años, a quienes desea dar una buena educación superior.
Desde muy joven incursionó en el negocio de los tejidos artesanales y trabajando para otras personas logró mantener a su familia. Ahora Leonarda ha comprado sus propias máquinas de tejer y trabaja a pedido para empresas textiles. Su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual cada vez tiene mas pedidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar junto a sus hijos mientras cumple con sus pedidos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin descanso para alcanzar su meta. 
Con tiempo, espera comprar más máquinas para poder incrementar su producción.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo; en su banco comunal es una socias muy alegre, por lo cual es muy querida dentro del grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que elabora.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 35 years of age, is a loving and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 2 children: Yeny, 14 years old, and David, who is 9. She would like to provide them with excellent, complete educations. She started in the business of making knit handicrafts at a young age and, working for others, managed to support her family. Now, Leonarda has purchased her own knitting machines and works filling orders for a textile enterprise. Her work is very high quality, which has led to an increase in orders. What she enjoys most about her trade is being able to be with her children while she works to fulfill orders. She has been carrying out this activity for 4 years, and finds the most difficult part of her job is having to work every day to meet her goals. In time, she hopes to buy more machines to increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP, and she feels capable of making her payments on time. She is one of the most cheerful members of her cooperative bank, which is why she is very well liked within the group. She will use the 1,500.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more yarn so she can increase the amount of knitwear she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia S. is from the village of P-3 Kinangay Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Sofia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Sofia owns & operates a specialized retail store selling personal accessories like rings, necklaces and bracelets in the local community. Sofia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sofia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Sofia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Sofia is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Sofia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn H. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Mohon Brgy 1, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running an eatery.

Rovelyn’s husband, Richard, is helping his wife run the eatery business. They have two children who are three and five years old. They strive hard to prepare for the future of their children, hoping to provide them with a good education and a comfortable life.

Rovelyn H. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in an eatery business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000 from her business activities.

Rovelyn H. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 was used to fund operations of her eatery business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 10,000 for her fourth loan. She intends to use the loan on her eatery business. Rovelyn H. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine N. Wakhis, a businesswoman who sells cereals in Miyanga market and lives in Kwirare Busia District, is 40 years old, married and a mother of six children. In her business, Catherine buys her stock twice a week within the same market she sells her goods. With a loan worth Ksh.15000, she wishes to expand her business by increasing her stock.

Her future plan is to venture into selling fish wholesale, an enterprise that will enable her to generate enough income to be able to educate her children and sustain her entire family.

loans.use: To increase her business stock

loans.name: El Laural Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Laural está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Marlene del Socorro quien desde el 2000 empezó a vender ropa este en un comienzo era poca pero según comento M. gracias a los prestamos ha podido invertir y mejorar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Jilma del Carmen la cual se dedica a realizar comidas y fritangas desde hace diez, Yalila Damaris comercializa ropa usada y zapatos, Darling María tiene una pequeña librería y fotocopiadora la cual es muy buena porque es la única en el barrio.
texts.en:
Laural's group is formed by four women workers, strong and enterprising. The coordinator of the group is Señora Marlene del Socorro who since 2000 started selling clothing. To start of with it was small, but subsquently M., thanks to the loans, has been able to invest and better her business. The other members of the group are Jilma del Carmen, who has worked making food and fried snacks since she was ten, Yalila Damaris, who sells used clothes and shoes, Darling María, who has a small bookstore and photocopier which is very good because it's the only one in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Williams

texts.en:
Williams is a businessman who runs a road transport business in Benin City. He lives with his family in Benin City as well. He has been in the transportation business for over thirty-five years and with it he makes his living.

With the business, Williams is able to provide for his family’s financial needs and also to repay his LAPO loan. His wife also provides support in taking good care of the home.

However, Williams’ bus is not in good shape and he wants to put it back into shape to enable him to continue with his transportation business. He is requesting the loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase spare parts to fix up his bus. He expresses great thanks to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO micro-finance.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to fix his bus

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
La Sra Alcira nacio el 8 D. septiembre D. 1944 en Obra GranD. en VallegranD.(La provincia VallegranD. se ubica en la región Sur Occidental a 241 kilómetros del departamento D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Tiene una población D. 26.027 habitantes y una superficie D. 6.414 kilometros cuadrados. Está ubicada a una altura media D. 1.970 metros sobre el nivel del Mar.

VallegranD. se caracteriza por su topografía accidentada con valles, montañas y varias serranías.

Su clima es templado, poco variable y su principal producción es la Agricultura y sus campos son apropiados para el cultivo D. especies D. flora ornamental). 

La Sra. Alcira tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar esta casada con el Sr. francisco, los dos se dedican a la agricultura.
 
Hace 20 años que adquirio una pequeña parsela en villa florida a 10km D. San Luis camino a la Pampa D. Coscal, hace 20 años tambien que se dedica a la agricultura en esa zona y nunca habia sacado credito D. otra institucion es la primera ves que saca financiamiento y vino a Emprender por referencias D. un vecino que tambien se dedica a la misma actividad que la Sra Alcira, ella es muy trabajadora ya que tiene 4 hijos que mantener se levanta a tempranas horas D. la mañana, el dinero del credito es para la compra D. semillas para la siembra D. Papa ya que es temporada D. siembra, y despues D. cosecharlas lo comercializa en el mercado D. la zona la Sra Alcira tambien siembra otros productos como Maiz, Poroto, etc.

La Sra Alcira esta agradecida con Emprender por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Alcira was born on the 8th of September, 1944 in Obra GranD., VallegranD.. The province of VallegranD. in located in the south west region, 241 kilometres from the department of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. It has a population of 26,027 inhabitants and a landmass of 6,414 square kilometres. It is located at a mean height of 1,970 metres above sea level. VallegranD. is characterised by its hilly topography of valleys, mountains and various mountain ranges. It has a mild, stable climate and its primary production is agriculture. Its fields are used for the cultivation of ornamental flowers. Alcira has four school-aged children and is married to Francisco. Both of them work in agriculture. 20 years ago, Alcira aquired a small parcel of land in Villa Florida,10km from San Luis, on the way to Pampa D. Coscal. At the same time, she started working in this area in agriculture. Alcira has never taken out a loan at another institution and this is the first time that she is asking for a loan with Kiva. She went to Emprender (Kiva's field partner) after it was recommended to her by a neighbour who works in the same field as her. Alcira is very hardworking and as she has four children to raise she gets up in the early hours of the morning to start work. The money from this loan will be used to purchase seeds to sow potatoes as it is now sowing season, and after harvesting them she will sell them in the local market. Alcira also sows other vegetables, including corn and beans. Alcira is grateful to Emprender for the trust they have placed in her in approving this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to sow potato

loans.name: Karina Janett

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Karina es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Karina se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, Karina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra los cereales, en algunas oportunidades vende útiles escolares.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, haba.
Los sueños de Karina son salir adelante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the community bank Santa Elena. Karina is 28 years old. She has a live-in partner and two children. Karina buys and sells cereals. She travels to the different fairs in her region, where she buys cereals. Sometimes she sells school supplies. Karina needs a loan of 1050 soles, money she will use to invest for the purchase of wheat and beans. Karina dreams to get ahead in life and have her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheat and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Depuis le 10 février 2005 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA d'où elle a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique à domicile où elle vend divers produits tels du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre, du lait concentré etc. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer davantage sa boutique en marchandises et faire des bénéfices plus importants pour participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Awa S. is 50 years old, married and the mother of four children, all under her care. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 10 February 2005. She has already been granted 10 loans, always well managed and reimbursed on time. She runs a home business where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, condensed milk, etc. Her loan will enable her to boost her supply of merchandise, generate more revenue and participate in managing family expenditures.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Las Perlas De Mamachapampa Group

texts.es:
Las socias D. Las perlas D. Mamachapampa son D. la comunidad D. Mamachapampa, Distrito D. Anco, Provincia D. Churcampa, Departamento D. Huancavelica, la actividad D. la comunidad son la agricultura y la ganadería.

Justina es secretaria del Banco Comunal que inicia su primer ciclo, Justina es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Justina compra y venD. cereales y ropa en las comunidades cercanas y las lleva a la feria D. su Distrito, inicio su negocio canjeando ropa con cereales, actualmente compra y venD.. Justina invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. ropa.

Los sueños D. Justina es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda granD. D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
The members of The Pearls of Mamachapampa are from the community of Mamachapampa, in the Arco District in the Province of Churcampa, in the Huancavelica department. The activities of the community are agriculture and livestock. Justina is the secretary of the community bank, which is beginning its first loan cycle. Justina is married and has four children. She buys cereals (grains) and clothing in the nearby communities and takes them to the market in her district. She began her business exchanging clothing for grains and now she only buys and sells. She will invest her loan in the purchase of clothing. Justina's dreams are for her children to have careers and to have a large grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
Martha de 46 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene una papelería(en Ecuador se llama “bazar”) hace 5 años, como no tuvo oportunidad de tener su propio local tuvo que construir en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño local para la papelería. 

Después de haber comprado cuadernos, papelería comenzó a venderlos en el local que había adecuado, poco a poco la surtió con mas artículos. Su hija de 15 años le ayuda hasta que se va en la tarde a la escuela. Trabaja desde muy temprano hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende todo tipo de papelería también cosas para uso personal. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas papelería y shampoo para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio y que sus hija termine los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Martha, 46, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She has had a stationery store (in Ecuador it's called a "bazar") for 5 years. Since she has not had the opportunity to have her own location she had to build a small store in the front part of her house. After purchasing notebooks, she started to sell them in her location and bit by bit she stocked it with more items. Her 15-year-old daughter helps her until she goes to school in the afternoon. Martha works from very early in the morning to 10 pm every day. She sells all types of stationery and also personal use items. With the requested loan she wants to buy more stationery and shampoo for her business. In the future she wants to stock her business more and for her daughter to finish her studies with success.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stationery, shampoo

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Ramiro; él socio tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero él socio es abogado de profesión, él también tiene una pequeña empresa de fabricación y arreglo de calzados, él socio los fines de semana se dedica a administrar su empresa, Él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la empresa, el socio desea aumentar y mejorar su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ARCANGEL GABRIEL community bank. He lives in Huanchac in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. The member's name is Sr. Ramiro. He is 39 years old and single. He is a lawyer and operates a small business making and repairing shoes. He spends weekends managing the business. He is now applying for a loan to buy materials for the business because he wants to expand and improve it. The member is very grateful for the loan because it will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. He is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for shoe business.

loans.name: Blanca Mariana

texts.es: Blanca Mariana M. D. Z. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo D. 46 años D. edad, quien trabaja como mecánico y junto a sus dos hijos menores D. edad quienes estudian educación básica. La señora Blanca posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación y en donD. también posee una pupusería, las cuales se encarga D. hacer cada noche durante toda la semana. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Blanca no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar gran parte D. sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas, las cuales le permiten contar con algunas ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Blanca Mariana M. D. Z. is 34 years old. She lives in the town of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her husband, who is 46 and who works as a mechanic, and with her two minor children who are in school. Blanca has a store which is located in her house, and she also sells pupusas, which she makes every weeknight. She is asking for a loan to be financially able to diversify her business. Blanca does not have the money to do this and it is neceesary for her and her husband because the store allows them to pay for a big part of the family expenses. She wants to diversify the store with products such as detergent, canned foods, bread, candies, beverages, and other products. These are basic home necessities and are what people ask for the most in the store. The loan will also be to buy a greater quantity of ingredients to make the pupusas, which allow her to make a little more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessity merchandise

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy T. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 49 years old, married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2000, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Daisy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Kigarama Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
S. Mariat is a hard working and an ever optimistic 37-year-old married mother of five children between the ages of 20 and 10. 

She operates a thriving produce business in Kigarama Trading Centre, Ibanda, dealing in the buying and selling of cereals like millet, rice, sorghum, beans, peas and more. 

With a business longevity span of seven years, Mariat has managed to significantly sustain and improve on her family’s welfare status through paying the school fees for her children and providing for her family's general welfare. To all appearances, her future business prospects look rosy with close to $124 coming in monthly out of her business.  

She envisions an even greater profit margin as she gets this loan, anticipating being in a position to buy more stock for the business. This will enable her to expand her business, educate her children, develop her plot of land and also be able to earn more revenue and live a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Señor Pablo C. O. tiene 25 años es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; él desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar en los chacos con las que su familia cuenta, actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 4 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

El Sr. Pablo C., es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, pero ha sufrido mucho por la enfermedad que padece su hijo de 8 años, sufre de alergias a las picaduras de los insectos que abundan en el lugar donde vive, y ellos no cuentan con muchos recursos para poder someterlo a tratamientos, solo toma algunos antialérgicos que son paliativos. 

El Sr. Pablo C. solicita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, para poder realizar su trabajo con mayor eficiencia, y generar mas ingresos que le permitirán adquirir los medicamentos que requiere su hijo.
Cabe señalar que el señor Pablo C. O. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo C. O. is 25 years old, single, and has one son. From an early age he began working in the farmlands where his family lives. He currently works as a motorcycle taxi driver in the “2 de Agosto” union, where he has been an active member for four years. The taxi service is profitable because many people use it for its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has stops and shifts for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama, where people use the taxi service. Pablo is a very responsible and enterprising person, but he has suffered greatly from allergic reactions from insect bites. His 8-year-old son also suffers from these allergic reactions. Insects abound in the place where he lives and they do not have many resources to treat the allergies. They can only take some antihistamine medications that only provide temporary relief. Pablo is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to be able to work more efficiently and generate more income to buy the medications necessary for his child. Mr. Pablo C. O. came in person to CIDRE's offices to ask for a loan after his coworkers told him of the institution's good credit conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Yoss Chanthy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoss C. is applying for a village bank loan for nine people who live in Sramaoch Hae village in Takeo province. Mrs. C. was selected as the village bank loan president by the other bank members, each of whom will use his or her portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. C. was born in 1974 and has three children, all of whom are attending school. She and her husband, Mr. Nunh Chamroeun, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell and support their family. Mrs. C. also weaves silk at home and her husband is a construction worker. Since her silk-weaving business is going well, Mrs. C. wants to expand and will use her loan to buy more silk.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard S. has been working in sales since the 1990s. Since 2002 she has been renting a booth at a very busy “Petak” (“Bee”) market. Alvard sells clothing for large-sized adults, and she is the single and unique seller of this kind of goods at the market, so she has developed a permanent clientele. Alvard requires to purchase new stock, and that is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: purchasing new clothing stock

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is a 42-year-old mother who lives with her family in Hatillo 7, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She has a business selling cleaning products to car mechanics in her community. In order to meet her clients' demands, Adelia must maintain a certain level of merchandise in her inventory. One of her cousins allows her to use a storage space which is located near her clients, in order to store her cleaning products. Adelia hopes to use this loan to purchase various cleaning products which she plans to sell to mechanics. She says that the products she sells are top quality products in high demand.

The loan consultant who has been working with Adelia describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit who is dedicated to her business. Adelia has lupus, but she doesn´t let her illness prevent her from living a normal life. In general, Adelia carries out domestic tasks in the mornings: preparing breakfast and lunch, cleaning the house, etc. The afternoons are dedicated to her business: seeking new clients, collecting payments from existing clients and making sales. Adelia's goal is to one day work in a centralized location, a small store, where she could offer her clients various cleaning products. At the moment, the only factor standing in the way of progress is a lack of working capital. This loan will help to address this challenge.

loans.use: For the purchase of cleaning products

loans.name: Bathishig

texts.en:
Bathishig C. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Bathishig and his wife operate a clothing retail business and have two shops in their town. His wife sells a variety of clothes in a rented stall the local trade center while Bathishig sells from a rented container in the local market. Bathishig first started his clothing business in 2008 by traveling to the Chinese border city of Erlian to purchase clothing items and transporting them back to his shop. Bathishig quickly became successful and has achieved a stable business. 

Bathishig and his wife are very hardworking people and have used their business income to greatly improve their quality of life. In the future, Bathishig plans to have his own workplace. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more items for his clothing business to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more items of clothing

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Gibrilla. He is married and has five children, ages 10, 8, 5, 3 and 1. In 1990, Gibrilla established his drinks and building materials businesses in order to generate income. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about $225 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more drinks and building materials to sell. In the future, Gibrilla plans to generate more income and to build a house for his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy for soft drinks for his stand

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob S. is 55 years old. He lives in the village of Varser in the Sevan area with his wife and two children. Hakob’s wife is a teacher in a village school; his son and his daughter are students. Hakob is a radio technician, and for about 17 years he worked in this field.
 
Since 2007, Hakob has rented a stall and managed his own food-trading business. With his business’s income, Hakob supports his family and pays for his children's education.

In his stall he sells candy, beverages, food, canned food, tea, coffee, etc. In advance of the New Year holidays, Hakob intends to increase his business. Therefore, he is asking for a 500,000-Armenian-dram loan to begin trading household goods in his stall.

loans.use: To begin trading household goods in his stall

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas B. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Felicitas is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Felicitas owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & junk foods. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Felicitas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages & junk foods

loans.name: Roquita

texts.en:
Roquita V. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has six children. Roquita plants and harvests corn crops that she sells to the market. She also has coconut trees, as well mangoes and bananas, planted on part of her land. She also sells her fruit harvest. Aside from farming, Roquita also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store where she sells detergent, soap and other various products.

Roquita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roquita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Roquita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock to her  business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children who are attending school. He has been working in the agriculture field for 10 years and in 2006 he bought his own land and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in his town and its surroundings.  He is the only income provider of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on the water canal so that he can guarantee that the vegetables receive the water well and grow well as a result.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on the water canal

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
