This is Teodora R., 56, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a welder, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teodora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Teodora hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she fervently hopes that her business will stabilize and be successful one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isabel Emilia

texts.es:
Isabel, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, madre soltera, es comerciante se dedica a vender  elotes,  tortillas ,tamales , güirilas y montucas, debido a su condiciones de pobreza sus padres no pudieron seguir pagándoles sus estudios solo logro cursar el sexto grado de primaria. De ahí en adelante se dedico a trabajar. A los 35 años de edad comenzó con su propio negocio de venta de tamales y productos derivados del maíz, esto lo hizo por medio de un préstamo  que le otorgaron y lo invirtió en compra de 300 tamales que ella misma vendía en las calles de Estelí, antes de vender tamales también vendía cosméticos y ropa a los trabajadores de fabricas tabacaleras. Actualmente compra 1,500 elotes cada tres días y tiene 5 vendedores, tres bicicletas que se utilizan para vender el producto en las calles. Le gustaría que sus productos se dieran a conocer en las ferias, supermercados para aumentar sus ventas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar 4000 elotes, pues esto le ayudara a comprar materia y aumentar sus ventas. Sus planes futuros son la preparación universitaria de sus hijos, pues desea que ellos tengan un futuro mejor que ella y puedan salir adelante en la vida. Tiene como meta próxima remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel is originally from the department of Estelí.  She is 46-years-old, a mother of three children, a single mother, and a businesswoman who works selling corn on the cob, tortillas, tamales, güirilas (sweet corn pancake), and montucas (similar to tamales but slightly sweeter).  Because of their poverty, her parents could not continue paying her studies and she only managed to complete the sixth year of primary school.  From then on she worked.  When she was 35-years-old, she began her own business selling tamales and corn-based products.  She did this with a loan that was offered to her and invested it in buying 300 tamales that she then sold in the streets of Estelí.  Before she sold tamales she also sold cosmetics and clothing to the tobacco factory workers.  Now she buys 1,500 ears of corn every three days and has five sellers and three bicycles that they use to sell the products in the streets.  She would like for her products to be sold in the fairs and supermarkets in order to increase her sales.  
She is requesting the loan to buy 4000 ears of corn as this will help her to buy ingredients and increase her sales.  Her future plans are to prepare her children for the university as she would like them to have a better future than her so that they can get ahead in life.  A goal of hers is to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy 4000 ears of corn.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Don Ramiro, tiene 57 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de calzado, vive con su esposa doña María y su hija Noemy, ellos residen en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán; don Ramiro es comerciante de zapatos para caballeros y damas, su negocio está ubicado en la zona de comercio en Gotera, tiene aproximadamente 11 años de vender.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tacos, zapatos de vestir para dama, esta compra le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de mercadería a los clientes. Su objetivo es ayudar a su familia a mejorar la vivienda y mantenerse en el negocio por largo plazo.
texts.en:
Ramiro is 57 years old and sells footwear.  He lives with his wife María and his daughter Noemy in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  Ramiro sells men's and women's shoes.  His business is located in the commercial district of Gotera.  He has been selling for approximately 11 years.

Ramiro is requesting a loan to buy high-heeled shoes, ladies' dress shoes.  This purchase will allow him to offer his customers a wider variety of merchandise.  His goal is to help his family, to improve his home and to remain in his business long term.

loans.use: to buy high-heeled shoes, ladies' dress shoes

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 48 años; vive hace 30 años en concubinato con Mario. Ambos tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo vive con una de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Huanchan. Desde hace 28 años, está trabajadora mujer comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja, maíz y habas, los cuales siembra en sus 18 hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar su producción en el mercado mayorista de su localidad, ya que ve el resultado de su trabajo. Asimismo se dedica al cuidado de animales menores como vacas, cerdos y carneros, los cuales después de ensebarlos los vende a un mayor precio, ganando un promedio de S/. 150 soles por cada animal, “los animales machos son más caros”, afirma. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital, pues no genera ganancias diarias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión huanchan”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo constante de su banco comunal. Luisa, comenzará su próximo sembrío por ello invertirá el crédito en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, como también de semillas de papa de la variedad “andina”.
texts.en:
Luisa is 48 years old and has lived with her significant other, Mario, for 30 years. They have five children, only one of which lives with them in the farmhouse they own in Huanchan. Luisa has been farming for 28 years. Her main crops are potatoes, peas, maize, and beans, which she plants on her 18-hectare farm.

What Luisa most enjoys about her work is selling her harvest in the local markets so that she can see the results of her hard work. She also raises small livestock such as cows, pigs and rams. After raising the animals she sells them at a higher price, averaging about 150 PEN per animal and higher for male animals. 

Her greatest challenge is lack of working capital, since she can't rely on daily income. Luisa belongs to the “Unión Huanchan” community bank, and this is her third loan with MFP. She is grateful for the continuous support from her bank. It is the beginning of a new planting season and Luisa will invest this loan in two bags of seed to grow peas and an Andean variety of potato.

loans.use: To buy two bags of seed to grow peas and potatoes.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush S. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gtashen.  She is married with three children. Her two daughters are 20 and 24 years old and her son is 23 years old.  Haykush didn’t have enough savings to purchase seed for the current growing season.  She turned to a microfinance loan for the necessary investment.  With a loan,she will purchase wheat and barley seeds and some animal feed.  This investment should provide her family with an additional 20% income.  Haykush has been farming her land for over 15 years.  She hopes to continue expanding her business and someday pass it on to her children.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, barley seeds and animal feed

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 59 años, es natural del distrito de Kimbiri, esta casado con Manuela de 58 años y juntos viven en su propia casa  al lado de su único hijo Rubén de 19 años a quien desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. La labor que realiza Juan es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao y café, contando con  02 hectáreas de terreno. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra desde muy niño, y cuando tenía 22 años pudo comprar su propia parcela, desde entonces trabaja en sus propias tierras. Juan en tiempos de cosecha y limpieza de sus campos necesita el apoyo de jornaleros que contrata para que le faciliten el trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su actividad; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta el ver que sus plantas son muy productivas, logrando tener a cambio buenas ganancias. Sin embargo durante el invierno, en cuando abundan mayor cantidad de insectos y las precipitaciones de lluvia son continuas, por lo que perjudica sus plantaciones, así que debe procurar darle el cuidado que necesita. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, porque posteriormente desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de cacao para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar mayor cantidad de frutos en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Juan, 59, is from Kimbiri District.  He’s married to Manuela, 58, and they live in their own house with their only son, Rubén, 19, for whom they want to provide a better quality of life.

Juan works as a farmer.  He has a 2 hectare field where he plants cocoa beans and coffee.  His parents taught him how to till the soil when he was a little boy and when he turned 22 he was able to buy his own field; since then he’s been working his own land.  During planting and harvesting Juan hires day laborers that make the work a little easier.  He feels quite committed to his work because thanks to his daily efforts today he enjoys seeing that his plants are more productive which leads to better profits.  However, during the winter is when insects abound and rain is continuous which damages the crops so he has to strive to provide them with all necessary care.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is obliged to repay each installment punctually and is willing to do so because he wants to access a future loan later on.  He is grateful to the institution for granting him the loan.  He will use it to buy cocoa bean seeds to graft them subsequently and garner the largest amount of fruit in the shortest amount of time.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean seeds.

loans.name: Normalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Normalyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling seaweed (goso) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income providing manicures & pedicures.  

Normalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more seaweed to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed (goso) to sell.

loans.name: Wolale Bamana 6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE BAMANA 6 est constitué de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA, préfecture de SAN, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42  ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du sésame. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après correctement remboursé  les  prêts, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
BAH, qui est debout au milieu,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences de fonio d’arachide  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 19.500à 22.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: The group WOLALE BAMANA 6 is composed of married women from the village of CINZARA, in the prefecture of SAN, Region of SÉGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. And they average 42 years of age and have at least four children. The group members grow peanuts, fonio (a kind of millet), and sesame. Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After properly repaying the previous loans, they are now on their third farm loan. BAH, who is standing in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanut and fonio seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and some inputs for farming. These items are purchased at the main market of SAN City. Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain value. And then they are sold retail (and often in bulk) and for cash at the main markets of SAN and DAH and at surrounding markets. The customers generally come from large cities. After selling the produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 19,500 to 22,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan interest and for covering typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and tools

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Qalqilia. A year ago, he started a grocery store with an old store his father had. 

So that Muhammad can maintain a good reputation and have a number of customers he took out a loan from FATEN to paint the store's walls and install shelves.  He can now pay back the loan from the store's income. 

Muhammad is photographed in FATEN's branch in Qalqilia.

loans.use: to paint his grocery store's walls and install shelving

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, 54, earns a living through farming. She and her husband own land that they till together, and rice is the primary crop that they grow and sell. Esmeralda, who does her best to support her family, is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers such as urea. She hopes that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest.

In the future, Esmeralda aspires to see their children succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as urea.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells provisions, ceramic and plastic bowls, ladies slippers and other items at Abura. Nana has a junior high educational background. She is married to a teacher and together they live with their two children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy ladies slippers and ceramic and plastic bowls to sell. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy ladies slippers, and ceramic and plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es natural D. Huancayo, disfruta D. la compañía D. sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 4 años tiene su tienda D. abarrotes, instalada en su misma casa y su experiencia D. años anteriores le ha servido para captar clientela. Es así que cada día atienD. su establecimiento con la ayuda D. sus hijos, mientras que ella también realiza otras actividades paralelas como es el tejido y bordados, siendo muy necesaria para los ingresos diarios. DesD. hace 20 años que enviudo ha logrado sola salir adelante, debido a su creatividad y habilidad para las ventas, hoy se siente orgullosa D. lo que ha logrado, tener una casa construida y sus hijos son personas D. bien. Ahora Yolanda sigue trabajando con esos mismo ánimos por lo que ha decidido abastecer su tienda con más mercadería. Es su novena vez que esta trabajando con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, un ejemplo para los demás integrantes del grupo solidarios a la que pertenece. Y en esta ocasión el dinero que solicita, estará destinado a la compra D. más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda is originally from Huancayo and enjoys living in her own home in the company of her five children. She opened a grocery store in her home four years ago and her previous years of experience have helped her attract customers. Yolanda manages her business each day with the help of her children. She also pursues other business activities at the same time, such as knitting and embroidery, because she feels that it is necessary for earning daily income. Since becoming a widow 20 years ago, Yolanda has been able to push forward by utilizing her creativity and sales abilities. Today she is proud of what she has accomplished, which includes building a house and raising her children to become good people. Yolanda continues to work with the same level of enthusiasm and now wants to restock her store with more merchandise.

This is the ninth time she has worked with MFP. Throughout this entire time, Yolanda has demonstrated that she is prompt with her payments and has become an example for the other members of her solidarity group to follow. On this occasion, the money she requested will be used to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Zulhumor's Group

texts.en:
Zulhumor is the leader of this group. She is 30 and divorced and has a seven-year-old daughter who is studying at school. Zulhumor works as a cook in the local school and makes a monthly salary of 3,000 KGS. She also grows agricultural products to make additional money to meet her family’s needs. This year, she is cultivating 0.45 hectares of cotton. Zulhumor will sell some of her harvest at the market to earn an additional 2,000 KGS per month. 

Zulhumor is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing cotton. In the future, she hopes to get a good harvest and she plans to use her profits to purchase household appliances to improve her living conditions.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jeksanbai

texts.en: Jeksanbai is 42 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed. Two of his children are college students and the other four are in high school. He started his business in 2000 by transporting goods with his truck. He runs this business alone and his business income is the sole financial resource for the family. Most of the time, he transports goods per orders from companies and individuals but he also purchases flour and rice and sells them in his hometown. During the winter months, he sells coal. He goes on transportation trips from one to two times a month. During the summer season, he transports between the Bayan-Olgii province and the Hovd province. He is a diligent and hard working man who says "This year, the road to the city of Ulaanbaatar is very good. I want to buy some goods from the city and sell them here." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to fix his truck, store some gasoline, and use for the trade.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 06 Group

texts.fr: GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 06 est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Pascaline Baï. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pascaline Baï est âgée de 55 ans et est une veuve. Pascaline Baï a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à sa charge. Pascaline Baï vit seule avec son enfant à charge et assure seule ses différents besoins. Pascaline Baï a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant encore à sa charge, Pascaline Baï mène comme activité la vente de bananes plantains dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Pascaline Baï vend des volailles. Pascaline Baï exerce cette activité depuis près de trente ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Pascaline Baï s’approvisionne au Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Pascaline Baï et aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 06, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 06 Group is made up of 15 persons. Its representative, named Pascaline Baï, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. The members of the group live together in the same neighborhood in Benin.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Pascaline Baï, age 55, is a widow. She has two children, who both have had schooling. She has to support one and lives alone with him and provides for his various needs on her own.

She didn't attend school much. In order to provide for herself and for the child she has to support, she sells plantains in one of Benin's town. As a secondary business, she also sells poultry.

Pascaline Baï has been running this business for more than 30 years, which enables her to provide for the various expenses of her family. She gets her supplies in Benin.

This first loan will certainly enable Pascaline Baï and the other members of the group to bolster their businesses, and increase their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy bunches of plantains

loans.name: Vanesa Guisela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vanesa Guisela; ella tiene 16 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, casacas y faldas, la socia vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar faldas, blusas, casacas y polos. 
                                                                                       
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "BANCO DEL DESARROLLO" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Vanesa Guisela is 16 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her clothes selling business.  She sells trousers, blouses, jackets and skirts on an independent basis.  She wants to expand and improve her clothing business and is requesting a loan to buy skirts, blouses, jackets and polo shirts.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses, jackets and polo shirts.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia lives in the village of Tsikhesulori.   She is 42 years old and is married. Her family members are her husband Shukri and her parents-in-law. 

Lia and her husband trade in green grocery products. They have a truck which is used for the business. Lia and Shukri purchase products from wholesalers in the nearby districts and sell them in the village.  Along with this trade, they run a family agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and sell on average 40 kg cheese per month in the village. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 2 greenhouses with a total area of 950 sq meters, where tomatoes and greens are grown.  The total average income for the family is 1100 Laris (approximately 650 USD) per month, including the pensions of Lia’s parents-in-law. 

Lia requested credit to purchase green grocery products from wholesalers. She will resale them in the village and earn profit. Lia plans to reinvest the earned profit into the family's farming business.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena fries varieties of fish to sell at a market near Takoradi. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a driver. Abena uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home. Abena will use the loan to purchase varieties of fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 25 years old. He is a business gentleman who sells various items in his boutique such as cooking oil, salt, rice, sugar and lotions. He has spent six years in this business. He is single, and has requested the loan to buy more items for resale in his boutique. He hopes to make a renovation of his house from the profits he will get in his business.

loans.use: To buy more home products for sale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 2. Two of them are in the school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Christine requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income from this loan will helps her to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, married and has four school-aged children.

To make a living, Ramil owns and operates a tricycle. passenger transport service.  Ramil has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Ramil is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, to pay for the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle tricycle.

In 2010, Ramil joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve his business and living situation.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 33-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children between the ages of 6 and 3. Both of them go to school. 

Ibrahim runs a phone store business, and he has been in this business for 11 years. He has 1 employee. Ibrahim heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion done by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase items like new phones, phone chargers, and many others. Apart from this business, Ibrahim has no other source of income. 

In 5 years' time, Ibrahim would like to own a house and not be renting. His major challenges include the competitors and home expenses.

Ibrahim says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance Sudan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase items like new phones, phone chargers, and many others

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 28 years old and has been in the farming business for 10 years. His farm now produces tea, milk, and maize for the local market. He is married, with two children ages 5 and 10 years, both of whom are in school.

Leonard has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says he wants to diversify his farming business and wants to seize the opportunity in poultry due to its high turnover compared to dairy farming. He adds that he will use the income to expand his dairy farming so as to take advantage of the economies of scale.

He says access to animal feeds is a challenge, but that it is surmountable if one runs a farm with more dairy animals. He is also happy with Juhudi Kilimo for providing the farming loans.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven de 23 años, ha vivido toda su vida en "San Miguel de los Bancos" que es uno de las 9 cantones de la Provincia de Pichincha (donde también se encuentra la capital del Ecuador). Posee 52 centros poblados entre comunidades, recintos y cooperativas distribuidas en toda la geografía cantonal. El territorio cantonal se encuentra un importante recurso natural como es el Bosque Protector Mindo Nambillo. Una gran superficie del área cantonal se encuentra ocupada de pastizales ya que la principal actividad del cantón es la ganadería este cultivo, también se realizan cultivos de palmito, caña de azúcar, plátano, naranjilla en pequeñas superficies. Hace un año vive de manera independiente y a pesar de tener un hijo, no vive junto a él.

Sus padres tienen una tienda de productos naturistas y de ellos, Pedro aprendió este oficio. Desde hace 5 años él tiene su propio local que ha tenido una buena acogida. Desea realizar una inversión en mas mercadería, quiere incrementar el surtido y para ello debe realizar un crédito ya que de otra manera no podría hacerlo. De esta manera piensa mejorar la oferta hacia sus clientes y por ende tener mejores ingresos. Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que le ayudará con esta necesidad económica, ha evaluado su negocio y ha determinado que es un emprendedor sólido y confía en que podrá cumplir sus pagos puntualmente.

Este joven está muy optimista y sueña con tener un local bien abastecido y surtido, de esta manera con mejores ingresos tener una mejor calidad de vida y algún día poder tener sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Pedro, 23, has lived all his life in San Miguel de los Bancos, one of 9 cantons in Pichincha, an Ecuadorea province that includes the country's capital city.  There are 52 "comunidades", "recintos" and "cooperativas distribuidas" [local geographical entities] in the canton, along with important resources such as the Mindo Nambillo National Forest.  Much of the canton is pasture land and ranching is an important business.  Local farmers grow palmito, sugar cane, platanos and fruit on small plots here.  Pedro has lived on his own for a year.  He has a son, but the son doesn't live with him.

Pedro's parents have a natural medicines business and he learned the business from them.  He opened his own shop 5 years ago and has made good progress.  He wants to expand the business now and he needs a loan because he can't add the inventory he wants without one.  He wants to increase the range of merchandise that he sells so that he can increase his income.  Fundacion Alternativa, the bank that is helping him with the loan, has assessed the business and determined that Pedro is a solid, trustworthy businessman who can repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.

This optimistic young man wants to build a successful business that will provide him with a good income.  His goals are a better quality of life and to one day go to university.

loans.use: to stock his natural medicines business.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 16º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Priscila, quien  tiene 5 hijos , está acompañada con el Sr. Wilfrido. Ella se dedica hace varios años a las ventas, pues tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, donde surte a la mayor parte de su barrio. Cuenta la Sra. Priscila que desea poder mejorando su negocio, para que de esa forma siga creciendo como microempresaria.
Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser arroz, fideos, azúcar, granos, lácteos y demás. Está contenta con la oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group in the city of Encarnación started up thanks to one of its members contact with the Foundation. The group is in its 16th cycle and has been working with the Foundation since 2007.

One of the group members is Priscila, who has 5 children and is in a relationship with Wilfrido. 

She has worked in sales for several years and has a small, well-stocked store, where she supplies most of her area. 

Priscila wants to be able to improve her business so that she can keep growing as a small business woman.

She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients for her store, like rice, noodles, sugar, grains, milk products and other things. 

She is pleased with the opportunity to progress that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, grains, dairy products and others things.

loans.name: Jesugnon Agbomey Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON AGBOMEY est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Marie-Claire, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Hilaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie-Claire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Marie-Claire et son mari. Marie-Claire a très peu fréquenté l’école mais a appris la restauration. Depuis sept ans, Marie-Claire vend du riz mélangé à de l’haricot accompagné de sauce depuis sept ans. Marie-Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Marie-Claire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON AGBOMEY un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du haricot, du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Ayaba Lydie L.'s Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHOUTON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Lydie L.(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Ayaba Lydie L. est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Victorin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Ayaba Lydie L. et son mari. Pour cette raison, Ayaba Lydie L. vend des noix d'acajou, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Ayaba Lydie L. s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ayaba Lydie L. sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe DJROMAHOUTON, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des noix d'acajou.

loans.name: Philomène's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, nommée Philomène (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 54 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Philomène est veuve et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et un à sa charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage  sont supportées par la bénéficiaire. C’est pour cette raison, que Philomène vend des beignets et de l'igname frits depuis une dizaine d’année. devant sa maison. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Philomène ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, de l'huile végétale et de l'igname.

loans.name: Géminis Group

texts.es:
Si se busca una comunidad alegre, rica en tradiciones, amigable, rodeada de naturaleza y en donde se puede transitar con mucha tranquilidad entonces se debe viajar al Estado de México pues sin duda allí se cumplen estas características. De igual modo, las personas de dichas comunidades son muy alegres, trabajadoras y gracias a su esfuerzo han adquirido los servicios necesarios para vivir tranquilamente. 
   Doña María del Carmen, integrante del grupo Géminis, es una persona emprendedora y sumamente alegre y, ante todo, una mujer responsable con sus obligaciones. Actualmente es viuda y ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella, no obstante, desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de comida típica: "inicié con mi actividad porque me encanta cocinar comida de todo tipo desde española hasta china pero como aquí nos gusta más la mexicana por eso es la que cocino mucho” comenta con una gran sonrisa.  
   A través de todos sus años de experiencia ha tenido vivencias buenas y malas pero afortunadamente  han sido más los episodios favorables y hoy en día puede disfrutar de un lugar establecido en donde ofrece sus deliciosos platillos. Desde las tres de la tarde y hasta las 12 de la noche los clientes acuden a su negocio ubicado en el centro de su municipio para disfrutar de sus alimentos; su hija le ayuda a brindar el servicio característico que ha logrado que su clientela siempre regrese. 
   Dos de sus hijos terminaron sus carreras profesionales por lo que está muy contenta con su actividad y ahora sólo espera continuar solventando los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su negocio para aumentar sus clientes. 
   Por otro lado, los demás integrantes muestran el mismo agradecimiento pues las ayudas de los préstamos mejorar con creces sus negocios. Ellos son José quien invertirá en sábanas, colchas y toallas; Saturnina, en artículos para el hogar; Lidia, en cerdos; María Felisa; en reses; Erika, en ropa y Ofelia y Jessica, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el lugar donde se reúne el grupo, doña Carmen es quien viste el mandil blanco.

loans.use: comprara maíz, verdura, carne, jugos y refrescos

loans.name: Djagblé Catherine

texts.en:
Ms Djagblé Catherine A., a widow, is the mother of three (3) children who are all in school. Besides her own children, she takes care of two (2) of her nieces who are in a training school. Ms A. sells fabrics, a business she inherited upon the death of her mother. As head of the household after the death of her husband, she concentrated on her business in order to meet the needs of her family. However, she still finds herself limited by a lack of funds. This has a very negative effect on her will to work. With the welfare of her children in mind, she is looking for ways to improve her fabric business. Besides, the year-end festivities are approaching, so business will be booming. Ms A. would like to take advantage of this opportunity to expand her business and increase her income.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a range of the new waist-cloth materials that are now becoming available on the market, as stock for the holiday season. Financing this activity will enable Ms A. to have a steady income and to meet the needs of her orphaned children.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY.

Madame A. Djagblé Catherine est une veuve et mère de trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) nièces qui sont en apprentissage. Mme A. est commerçante de tissu, activité qu’elle a hérité de sa mère à son décès. Devenue chef de famille après la mort de son mari, elle intensifia son commerce afin de pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Mais elle se trouve toujours limitée par les moyens financiers. Ce qui dissipe en elle tout son ardeur au travail. Soucieuse du bien-être de ses enfants, elle recherche des moyens pouvant l’aider à améliorer son commerce de tissus. De plus, avec l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, l’activité promet d’être florissante et Madame A. Djagblé Catherine voudrait profiter de cette occasion pour agrandir son activité et augmenter son revenu.

C’est à cet effet qu’elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $1000 qui servira à l’achat des nouvelles gammes de tissus pagne qui arrivent sur le marché en vue de constituer un stock pour cette période de fêtes. Le financement de cette activité permettra à Madame A. Djagblé de disposer d’un revenu consistant et de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins.

loans.use: To purchase and sell new ranges of fabrics

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation has Cecilia as one of its clients. She has been taken through the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $750 to inject into her business. She knows how to keep records of her businesses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks for her wholesale tomatoes selling business

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a woman who has decided to go into the beauty salon business and would like a loan to start the business. She wants to use the loan to buy hair products for her to offer to her clients and offer a better service. As of now she does not own an establishment but she uses her house to offer her services to clients which are usually her neighbors. She buys the products in the city which is around 1 hour or more away since she has to take public transportation and sometimes walk. 
She is single and has 3 children

loans.use: To start a new salon and to buy hair products

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
After moving to Pucallpa with his family, Cupertino began selling convenience items in a small store set up in his home. The excellent customer service that he offers has caused notable growth in his client base. Because of this growth he would now like to increase the size of his store, and improve the products that he stocks in order to meet the demands of his clients and to increase his family’s quality of life. Cupertino is asking for a $325 loan to begin expanding his story with the help of his family. He has committed to repay the loan within 6 months. Through your generous support, Cupertino’s family will be able to reach their goal.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Cupertino, desde que se estableció junto a su familia en la localidad de Pucallpa, ha iniciado la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña bodega que ha acondicionado en las instalaciones de su hogar. Actualmente y debido a la demanda que tienen en el barrio por la excelente calidad de servicio que brindan, su cartera de clientes se ha ido incrementando notoriamente. A raíz de este hecho es que desea ampliar el lugar en el que ofrece sus productos y mejorar el stock de los mismos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia .Por esta razón Cupertino solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares para iniciar la implementación de su bodega con ayuda de toda su familia y se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Con tu aporte generoso la familia de Cupertino podrá llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: Purchase of addtional, and more varied products can make the Cupertino's Store one of the most popular.

loans.name: Delete Dhahabu Group

texts.en:
KHADIJA, 31-years-old and an elementary teacher by profession, is an experienced businesswoman in raising chickens. From a previous loan, she raised and sold two different groups of 250 chickens. Having repaid this loan successfully, she aspires to get another loan in order to continue with and expand her business. With a new loan, she plans to purchase 750 chicks (250 broilers and 500 layers), which cost about 1 dollar each. She plans to also build another chicken coup. 

Even while dealing with health concerns resulting from diabetes and a stroke that occurred less than two years ago, Khadija continues to strive to improve her business. Living with her husband, 1 year old son, and 10 year old stepson, she has many dreams of improving her family’s quality of life. From the profits of her business, they are currently building an addition onto the back of their home.

Khadija belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”) along with Selina W. and Averina V., who also sell chickens. Together, with the money from this loan of $1125, they will improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy chicks for chicken businesses

loans.name: Sam Bath

texts.en:
Mr. H. Sam Bath (age 49) and his family live in a small village off of National Road 2, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. H. and his wife (age 47) have been married since 1979 and have eight children, one of whom studies in school. The others work in nearby garment factories. His wife has a small stand selling groceries and other household goods in front of their house (see photo). H. has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for ten years. His wife has had her shop for the same amount of time.

He is requesting this, his family’s eighth loan from Maxima, to buy a secondhand motorbike and to buy supplies for his wife’s shop. Phnom Penh may well be one of the world’s largest cities void of even one municipal bus. Motorbike taxis and tuk-tuks are the preferred and, with the rare exception of an automobile taxi, only way to get around. On a good day, H. can make about 15,000 Riel (US $3.75).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and supplies for a shop.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate O. is 39 years old and married with 1 child. She sells wood in her community, a trade she studied for two years before beginning her own business in 2005. Kate is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase more wood, so she can increase her sales. She is a LAPO member, and a dedicated worker.

loans.use: To increase her stock of wood

loans.name: Nabidongha B South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamila N.. She is currently in the business of shoe selling and is requesting a loan to expand business. Jamila is 26 years old and is married with a husband who works as a driver. She has 1 child, age 3, who goes to school. Each week, Jamila makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in the shoe business. Jamila has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Jamila is joined in her small group by Farida N., Halima N., Safina N., and Phina B.. Farida N. has a business in used clothing and wants to boost the clothes business. Halima N. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to start poultry farming. Safina N. operates a business of clothing sales and wants to buy a sewing machine. Phina B. is currently in the business of water selling and distribution and is requesting a loan to buy a water tank.

loans.use: To expand shoe business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 37 years old and is married woman with 1 child, age 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 18,16 and 15 years old. Khadija owns a small cafe, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past,Khadija has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Rahma's Kujishughulisha Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 25 years old, and married. Rahma owns a small café, which she began in 2006. She begins work at 7 AM in the morning and ends at 6 PM. She earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to purchase more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members M. and H., who both run their own cloth businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Maria Dalila

texts.es:
Maria is a member of the Victoria Community Bank.

Maria is married and she is 41 years old with two children. Maria sells CDs and DVDs from her home and she also sells in the markets in the city of Ayachuco. She also travels to different provinces in the country but her products she gets from the city of Lima.

Maria requests a loan in the amount of 2500 soles to invest in the purchase of CDs and DVDs.

Maria's dream is to expand her business to incluD. the sales of artifcats and to have a store and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Victoria.

Maria es casada, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Maria venD. Cds, Dvds, al por mayor y menor, sus ventas lo realiza en su casa y también reparte a los diferentes mercados, tiendas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, también viaja a provincias del departamento, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad D. Lima.

Maria necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. Cds, Dvd.

Los sueños D. Maria son ampliar su negocio, vender artefactos, tener una tienda y construir su casa.

loans.use: Maria requests a loan in the amount of 2500 soles to invest in the purchase of CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es:
Felipe V. lives in the 3-80 neighborhood in the city of Managua. He is 45 years old and is married with three daughters, all of whom are young. His wife is in charge of taking care of the home and of his daughters. Felipe is a taxi driver. Previously, he was a taxi driver, however, he worked for another person. Gradually, he saved money until he could obtain his own vehicle which he now uses for his job. Felipe's dream is one day to estalish a "mom-and-pop" store in his house, which would be managed by his wife. But first, he needs to establish the necessary conditions for this to happen. He needs a loan so that he can raise the roof of his house to a higher height.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Felipe V. habita en el barrio 3-80 de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 45 años, es casado, con 3 hijas, todas menores de edad. Su esposa es quien se encarga el cuido de su casa y de sus tres hijas. Don Felipe es taxista, anteriormente era chofer de taxi, es decir que laboraba para otra perosna, pero poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta que pudo obtener su propio vehículo el cual utiliza para su trabajo. El sueño de Don Felipe es poder algún dia poner una pulpería en su casa de habiatción para que esta pueda ser administrada por su esposa, pero primero dará las condiciones necesarias para qeu esto suceda. Requiere el préstamo para poderseguir levantando a una mayor altura el techo de su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Increase the height of his house's roof.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
María is 26 years old, married, and has a child. She belongs to the Tulipanes Village Bank and earns income running her own grocery store which is located in a rented house. María has only recently started to mill cereals to produce various types of flour. She sells these products in her store or delivers them to her neighbours and friends. María is currently renting the mill that she uses for flour production, and this activity helps her earn additional income.

Presently, María needs a loan to buy wheat, corn, rice and barley.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to buy her own house.

loans.use: Purchase of wheat, corn, rice and barley

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P., 46, and her husband, Mr. San Thorn, 51, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty one years and have three sons. Two of their sons have full time employment and the other one is in the local school.
 
Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver for seven years - a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.  Mr. San has been a hair dresser for thirty years.

Sopheap is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema M. is a married Tanzanian business woman. She runs a shop at which a large variety of items are sold. Much of her inventory consists of cereal crop products such as rice and regimes crop  as shown in the photo. She has four children, three of whom are currently in school. The income she receives from the shop is used to pay school fees for her children and meet her family's daily expenses. She requests a loan of 550 USD to purchase inventory for the shop and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for the store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. has been in business for a very long time and sells fruits and foodstuffs like plantains, yams, etc. She hopes to own a grocery store in future. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $525 to buy more fruits to sell, and thus meet the demands of her customers. 

Grace is 40 years old, married and has 4 children and she says that God will continuously bless KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es una persona muy trabajadora y simpática. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para sacar adelante a sus hijos y tratar de darles estudio, pero desgraciadamente ellos al ver la situación decidieron no estudiar y ponerse a trabajar para ayudarla. Comenzó en Mayo de 1988 vendiendo productos cosméticos en sus tiempos libres, ya que también trabajaba como empleada en un negocio. Mas adelante, una amiga la convenció para que vendiera ropa ya que en su empleo no le pagaban bien, y así lo hizo. Después sus hijos entraron a trabajar y ya me empezaron a ayudar y apoyar con los gastos familiares.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para poder viajar de nuevo a la ciudad de Moroleón, Guanajuato a comprar ropa y calzado ya que ahí es donde se surte para tener siempre artículos de temporada y poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a very hard-working and kind person. She began her business in order to earn an income to help her children to get ahead, and to try to give them access to education. Unfortunately, after seeing the economic situation they decided not to study and instead to find work in order to help her. She began selling cosmetics in her spare time in May of 1988, as she worked full-time in another job. Later, a friend persuaded her to sell clothes as her job did not pay well. Then her children started work and began to help with the family expenses. Juana needs a loan for US$750, to be paid over 6 months, in order to travel to the city of Moroleón, Guanajuato to buy clothes and footwear, in order to have seasonal items and to be able to meet the needs of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Huk Sunqulla Group

texts.en:
The Huk SunqulL. ("One Heart" in Quechua) Village Bank is maD. up of fifteen women from the Paucará community of Acobamba Province in central Peru. Paucará is located about 3200 meters above sea level and is mostly flat, with a chilly climate suited to to grow grains and tubers. Most members of the community are dedicated to raising livestock or farming, while others sell merchandise in local markets. 

Norma and Martina are two members of Huk SunqulL..

Norma is married with three children who are 12, 8 and 5 years old and are all currently in school. Norma is a schoolteacher, but she is not paid enough to live on, so she also sells dry goods (rice, sugar, flour) at the local Sunday market. When she first started it was tough, since people gossiped about her having to have two jobs, but she says she has gotten past that. In the beginning, her husband didn't want to let her go out to the market to work as a vendor, but once he realized she was earning money he started to help her. Today, Norma says that her business has grown a lot since she started working with FINCA, and her husband is now very understanding. She has developed a better relationship with her family, too. Norma is requesting a loan of 600 soles (US$200) to buy a wider variety of merchandise to sell at her market stall. Norma's dream is to buy a car and for her children to graduate with professional degrees. 

Martina is married with two children who are 18 and 12 years old. Martina sells lamb soup and chicken soup in local markets, and also sells at meetings of the "Juntos" program. She has increased her sales since she started selling soup at these meetings, since she used to just work at markets. Martina is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy more lamb to make soup to bring to other local markets. She says that FINCA has taught her good values and how to be responsible with herself and her family. Her dream in life is to build her own house and to open her own store.

loans.use: Buy lamb, dry goods

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia A. sells food items like rice and sugar at Atonkwa near Elmina. Cynthia has received no formal education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Cynthia has been selling food items since 1996. She spends all of her income on the business since her husband takes care of all the family's financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs and groceries for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build for the family and to save for their children's a higher education.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs and groceries for her shop to resell.

loans.name: Khamayil

texts.en:
Khamayil F. is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of three adorable children. 

Khamayil has a grocery store that she manages herself, in addition to caring for her family and her home. She opened her small business five years ago with financial support from her husband. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income. 

Since its inception, the business has been gradually growing. In order to grow her business, she is requesting a loan of $1200 USD. Khamayil is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods, thus increasing the range of her goods. She promises to repay her loan within 15 months and thanks everyone who has decided to support her.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and to improve shop conditions

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a photographer.  She attended school until junior high. Grace sells plastic products and saucepans at the Nyankumasi market near Cape Coast, which she has done for 4 years.  

Grace uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Grace will use the loan to expand her business.  She is going to buy plastic products and saucepans in larger quantities for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to continue reinvesting in her business to further expand.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to buy more plastic products and saucepans in larger quantities for sale.

loans.name: Frida Gloria,

texts.es:
Frida ha estado trabajando en el rubro de cosmetología toda su vida. De joven estudió para ser cosmetóloga, y tras finalizar sus estudios trabajó de empleada y ayudante en un salón de belleza, a modo de prácticas. Sin embargo, ella siempre había querido ser independiente, así que pronto empezó su propio negocio de servicios y artículos de belleza.
Hace cuatro años abrió su peluquería unisex en Huaycan, donde también vende varios artículos de belleza. Los préstamos que empezó a recibir de EDAPROSPO hace dos años y medio siempre los ha utilizado para invertir en su negocio, como también lo que le sobra de sus ganancias después de haber cubierto sus gastos personales, del hogar, y de la crianza de su hija menor. Sus otros tres hijos ya son mayores de edad y económicamente independientes.
Por lo tanto, a sus cincuenta años Frida, que es separada, está completamente dedicada a la mejora y ampliación de su negocio, y de esto quiere ocuparse en los próximos años.
texts.en:
Frida has been working in the area of cosmetology her whole life, having studied for this career when she was young. When she finished her studies, she worked as an assistant and employee at a beauty salon. Despite this, she always wanted to be independent and she soon started her own business providing beauty products and services. Four years ago, she opened her own unisex beauty salon in Huaycan, where she also sells beauty products. She has invested the loans she started to get from EDAPROSPO two years ago into the business. What is left over from her earnings, she uses to pay for personal and household expenses, and also for her young daughter. Her other three children are grown and financially independent. At fifty years of age and separated from her husband, Frida is completely dedicated to improving and expanding her business. She intends to occupy herself with this activity for upcoming years.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new supplies and expand her business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla, age 37, is happily married to Claudio, a tricycle operator of their own motorcycle. The couple was blessed with two children: Clariza - 13 years old, high school sophomore and Claudio P. Jr. – 7 years old, an elementary student. Their family is living in a peaceful community in San Juan, Alicia, Isabela.

With their tricycle transport business, her husband is able to earn money for their family and able to support the education of their children. However, their income is not enough to sustain their daily needs. Perla wanted to borrow PHP 6,000 in order to help her husband financially.

She plans to invest her loan to sell assorted goods, which includes second hand clothes, kitchen utensils and other selling products for retail to earn an income. Perla wants to achieve all her dreams in life and give her children a quality education. She also hopes that she becomes successful in the business and has a good and spiritually transformed family.

loans.use: Sell assorted goods.

loans.name: Mirzokul

texts.en:
A. Mirzokul is a hard-working man who has dedicated himself to cattle raising so that he can support his three children. Mirzokul is currently seeking to buy cows that are pregnant so that he can expand his herd and have more cows to sell. He has applied for a loan from IMON International to make this possible. Please help him support his family by participating in the funding of this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which began soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cows so that he can expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. currently sells water and soda and is requesting a loan to set up a shop. A thirty-two-year-old widow whose husband died in the two-decade war of southern Sudan, Nancy has two children attending Nyokuron primary school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a house for rental purposes.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To set up a shop.

loans.name: Kokougan

texts.fr: Kokougan A. est âgé de 22 ans, célibataire sans enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto. Kokougan est un vaillant garçon et prend au sérieux son activité. Cet emprunt lui servira à payer sa propre moto. Kokougan est optimiste sur le changement des conditions de sa vie grâce à ce crédit.
texts.en:
Kokougan A., 22, is single and has no children. He is a moto-taxi driver. Kokougan is a fine young man and takes his business seriously. This loan will allow him to buy his own motorbike. Kokougan is optimistic that this loan will be able to help him change his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús M. A.  vive el municipio de Cojutepeque ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. A sus 54 años de edad Manuel sigue siendo un hombre muy trabajador él se dedica a la manufacturación de diversos artículos en lamina, Manuel tiene 45 años de experiencia comenzó cuando era tan solo un pequeño niño, ahora el continua ampliando su negocio y con toda su experiencia obtenida le permite que muchas personas confíen en su trabajo es por ello que Manuel tiene una clientela muy estable, ahora el está solicitando un crédito para compra de materia prima, para la elaboración de canales.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús M. A. lives in the Cojutepeque area of Cuscatlán. At 54 years of age Manuel continues to be a very hardworking man who makes things out of laminate. Manuel has 45 years of experience since he began when he was a young boy. He continues to grow his business and has a stable base of clients who trust his work since he has gained so much experience over the years. He is asking for loan to buy raw materials to build canals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila R. is from the city of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. Thirty-three years old and married with four school-aged children, Cerila owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Cerila is just starting this business.

In 2009, Cerila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more items for her store and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y es madre de 04 hijos.  Isabel no cuenta con estudios y vive en la av. Panamericana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para comprar insumos ya que se dedica a la venta de comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual utilizará para la compra de insumos para la preparación de comidas.
Su deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las charlas, y  las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the “Medalla Milagrosa” Community Bank in the district of Pomata, Chucuito province, Peru. She is a 45-year-old married mother of four children, has no formal education and lives on the Panamerican Avenue. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past year, and her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase ingredients since she makes a living selling food. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles, which she plans to use to purchase more ingredients to prepare her meals. Her wish is to keep working so she can cover family expenses. Isabel enjoys the chats and meetings with her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Angélica María A. tiene ya mas de 21 años con su negocio de ferretería, es el ingreso de su familia ya que tiene paco tiempo se quedo viuda, con tres hijos adolescentes los que son su responsabilidad.
A ella se le presentó una oportunidad de comprar varilla para la construcción por mayoreo en la ciudad de Monterrey, Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacer la comprar de inmediato. 
Está solicitando un préstamo y así poder obtener esa oferta que se le está presentando en este momento.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica María A. has over 21 years experience in the hardware business. This is the main source of income for her family since she became a widow. She has three teenage children who are her responsibility.

She was presented with an opportunity to buy lumber at wholesale in Monterrey, but she did not have the money to make the purchase immediately. She is requesting a loan so that she can take advantage of the offer that was presented to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lumber

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 40 years old. Merlyn is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and other varieties of products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina R. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y elaboración de uniformes escolares, este negocio es la fuente de ella y su esposo el señor Pablo Ramírez , quien también le ayuda en el negocio.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía ya que se les termino y quiere surtir más y comprar tela para elaborar uniformes que le están pidiendo por el regreso a la escuela.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y así tener más inversión en el negocio y para ellos.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina R. has more than 6 years experience selling used clothing and making school uniforms. Her work has been the source of income for her and her husband, Sr. Pablo Ramírez, who also helps with the business.

At the moment, her business is lacking a variety of finished merchandise. She wants to increase her inventory and buy more fabric for making uniforms being requested for students returning to school. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale & fabric for making uniforms

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama M. est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires comme du miel et de l’huile de palme. Elle s’active aussi dans d’autres activités comme la restauration et la transformation de fruits en jus concentré. Son objectif est d’augmenter les revenus familiaux.
texts.en:
Mariama M. is 36 years old, she is married and she is the mother of 8 children. She sells food products such as honey and palm oil. She is also active in other business types, such as the sales of fruit juices from concentrate. Her goal is to increase the family income.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La Sra, Betty se dedica a la elaboracion de comida, hace ya aproximadamente 26 años, ella juntamente con su hija cocinan desde las 3 de la madruga, para que todo pueda estar listo ya para las 8 de la mañana, posteriormente procede a comenzar la preparacion de  los almuerzos para que este quede listo para las 11 de la mañana y se  proseda a la atencion de medio dia, que ademas le bastan tan solo 2 hrs. para terminar los 90 platos completos, tiene bastante clientela..

loans.use: Compra de sillas, mesas y manteles nuevos.

loans.name: Marie Gay Rose

texts.en:
“Time is Gold”: this is the guiding principle of Marie Gay. She wants to use her time as much as possible to be productive in her business. She needs to be patient to be able to provide for the needs of her children, especially when it comes to their educational needs. Marie, as she is known, is married to Merlito. The couple has two school-age children. 

Marie runs a general store in her village. She buys commodities in Cauayan, Isabela, once a month. According to her, she has been in business for seven years and she tries to maintain it for the sake of her children. Marie is requesting to obtain a loan of 16,000 PHP for the maintenance and continuous development of her business. Since being in this organization for almost five years, her retail business has become more competent and she is always thankful for it. She hopes that it will be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For maintenance and development of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large stock of artificial flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es: María Victoria L. D. A. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo D. 67 años D. edad y tres nietos menores D. 9 años. María compra y venD. ropa para niños y adultos D. todas las edades, trabajo el cual tiene 15 años D. realizarlo. Ella comercializa la ropa D. manera ambulante, lo cual ella lo logra ver como una ventaja, ya que pueD. abarcar varias zonas D. San Martín y D. esta manera pueD. vender un poco más. María solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa y D. esta manera contar con mayor variedad D. prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Victoria is 53 years old, and lives in San Martín in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband who is 67 years old, and three grandchildren who are less than 9 years old. Maria buys and sells clothing for children and adults of all ages, work that she has been doing for 15 years. She markets the clothing as a street vendor, which she sees as an advantage, since she is able to cover several areas of San Martin, and this way she can sell a little more.
