Maria is requesting a loan through which she will be able to buy more clothes and this way count on a greater variety of clothing to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina A. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Melina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Melina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Melina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Melina plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy seeds and repair his land

loans.name: Nora Elena

texts.es:
Nora Elena García B. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el tradicional barrio Olaya Herrera de Cartagena, es oriunda de San Juan de Nepomuceno, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, que en algún momento golpeado por la inseguridad, la violencia y desplazamiento forzado, obligaron a Nora a huir de esta zona de conflictos desde hace 5 años hacia la ciudad de Cartagena, en compañía de sus 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 2 años y de su esposo, quien dedicado a las labores del campo no encontró trabajo digno en la ciudad; así fuè como ella asumió la responsabilidad del sustento de su hogar, practicando los conocimientos de costura que aprendió desde muy niña y que con la ayuda de una generosa pareja que le donó una máquina de coser, pudo iniciar muy entusiasmada el negocio de confecciones que hoy tiene y con el que sueña verlo crecer y ayudarla a su prosperidad familiar, para lo cual dirige todos sus esfuerzos.   
 
Nora se siente satisfecha de la vida, da gracias a Dios diariamente por estar viva y reafirma el proverbio que dice no hay mal que por bien no venga, porque con el desplazamiento ella encontró la oportunidad de tener un mejor futuro en otra tierra, que  quizás no hubiera logrado en el lugar que la vio nacer. 

En su negocio llamado “Confecciones Angie”, compra telas e insumos de bajo costo y elabora vestidos económicos, ella dice que con ello contribuye a aliviar la problemática de capacidad de compra que tienen las personas que viven en su barrio y sus alrededores, pues “sus clientes se sientan muy satisfechos al poder estrenar un vestido nuevo”. 
Su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, fue por valor de $1.500.000 que reembolsó estrictamente de acuerdo a su plan de amortización, pues lo invirtió en mercancías y variedades que le ayudaron a obtener una buena utilidad para poder adquirir nuevos electrodomésticos y utensilios  para su hogar que aun no poseía; en la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000, que invertirá en la compra de materia prima e insumos para la confección de ropa, en comprar calzado y vestidos infantiles para surtir su vitrina y en adquirir una maquina de cocer nueva,  pues además de confeccionar  también vende mercancía en su barrio.

Su máximo sueño es obtener una vivienda y un local para organizar y expandir su negocio logrando adquirir tecnología de punta  y  posicionarse en el mercado ofreciendo muchos puestos de trabajo y logrando dividendos que le ayuden al crecimiento humano, espiritual, profesional, de sus hijos y de sus futuros empleados. 

Su desafió actual es la falta de maquinaria adecuada para hacer un trabajo de mejor calidad  y recibir capacitación y  en unión de su esposo y de su familia emprender el montaje  y desarrollo de una gran empresa de confecciones.
texts.en:
Nora Elena García B. is 33 years old and lives in the traditional neighborhood Olaya Herrera in Cartagena. She is a native of the town of San Juan de Nepomuceno in the department of Bolívar, which at the this moment has been hit with insecurity, violence and forced displacement, requiring Nora to flee this conflict area 5 years ago to the city of Cartagena. She fled along with her 3 children of 9,7,and 2 years and her husband, who works in the countryside since he could not find decent work in the city. It was thus that she assumed the responsibility of supporting the household, practicing her trade as a seamstress that she learned when she was very young. With the help of a generous couple who gave her a sewing machine she was able to start, with great enthusiasm, the business that she has today. She hopes to see this business grow and help her family become more prosperous, and she directs all of her efforts toward these goals. She feels satisfied with her life, and gives thanks to God daily for being alive. She reaffirms the saying that every cloud has a silver lining, because with the displacement she found the opportunity to have a better future in a different place, which perhaps she might not have had in the place where she was born. In her business, called "Confecciones Angie" (Creations by Angie), she buys fabrics and supplies at low cost and makes economical dresses. She says that with this business she helps alleviate the problem that people have in her neighborhood of not having enough money to buy new clothing, and says that "her customers feel very satisfied being able to wear a new dress for the first time." Her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation was for $1,500, which she paid back strictly according to the established schedule. She invested it in a variety of merchandise that helped her to obtain greater profits, which enabled her to acquire new household appliances and utensils that she did not yet have. She is now applying for a loan of $2,000 that she will use to buy raw materials and supplies to make clothing, to buy shoes and baby clothes to put on sale in her glass display case, and to acquire a new sewing machine, because in addition to making clothes she also sells merchandise in her neighborhood. Her greatest dream is to have a home and a place to organize and expand her business, managing to acquire state-of-the-art technology and positioning herself in the market offering many jobs and generating profits to help the human, spiritual and professional growth of her children and future employees. Her current challenge is that she lacks the adequate training and machinery to do work of the best quality and to start, along with her husband and his family, to set up and develop a large apparel company.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies to make clothing, to buy shoes and baby clothes to sell, and to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda  se dedica a  ser Artesana; confecciona ropa deportiva para colegios y cuenta con su propio taller de costura, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia; no tiene esposo, tiene 1  hijo con la edad de 15 años. Tiene su domicilio en Alto la Portada de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (tela).
 
Es su tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is an artisan; she manufactures sports clothing for school and has her own sewing workshop; this is her main source of income with which she supports her family. She doesn't have a husband but does have a 15-year-old son. She lives in the Alto la Portada section of the city of El Alto. She will use the funds to buy raw materials (fabric). This is her third loan with Impro; her good repayment history allows her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes L. V. lives in San Francisco de Heredia, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She has worked for the past two years selling various products such as kitchen appliances, including microwaves, refrigerators and ovens, as well as perfumes.

Mercedes profits from price differences for her products purchased in Panama as compared to Costa Rica. This loan will be used to finance the purchase of kitchen appliances and perfumes from Panama, to be sold in the community of San Francisco de Heredia.

Mercedes visits her clients in the provinces of Alajuela, San Jose and Heredia on a weekly basis to both deliver orders and to collect payments. She is happy with her business. Her work has offered her an opportunity to provide a better life for herself and family. Her goal is to expand her business, seek out new clients and keep on working.

Mercedes does not have a fixed work schedule. Her workday and workweek are subject to change based on the needs of her clients. She says her business is going well and she has no major obstacles. Refering to her business, she says: ¨I haven’t had a bad month yet.¨

loans.use: To purchase kitchen appliances and perfumes

loans.name: Jibril

texts.en:
Jibril is 35 years old, married and lives with his wife and their four children in Gaza city, Palestine. Two of his four children are now in school, which means a large amount of responsibilities. Jibril was working a construction worker, but now he has decided to be independent and open his own auto-repair garage.

He is hoping that with the loan he is seeking, he will be able to improve the status of the garage. Jibril says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: Improving the status of the garage

loans.name: God Gift Group

texts.en:
Thelma G. is the leader of a group five borrowers called God Gift. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are between 2 and 18 years old.  She was not able to continue her education through 8th grade.  For 5 years, Thelma has been running her dry fish business at the Old Road Market in Monrovia, Liberia.

She sells fish at a reasonable price and talks to customers in a friendly manner which keeps them returning. Thelma plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase additional fish. Her goal is to grow her business and send her children to school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Thelma is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana E. sells cooking oil in gallons and bigger containers at Jukwa. She is a widow and has four children. She is responsible for the welfare of her children. She has not received any form of education.

Nana has been selling cooking oil for some time now. Her loan will enable her buy her goods with cash instead of buying on credit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy her goods with cash instead of buying on credit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Srean

texts.en: Mrs. Srean C. is living in Kbal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province and she is 40 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Teng Ngorn Ngang, prepare and sell food in the local market to support their family. Since their business is going well, they want to expand. So, to improve their business, Mrs. Srean C. is seeking a loan to buy an oven and a refrigerator. She is the mother of four children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an oven, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Meu's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Meu N. is a group leader who has been selected by four other members of her group. This group loan is located in Prasat village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Meu N. is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support her family and to sell. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, Mrs. Meu N. is asking for a loan to buy more rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth Maame Ama

texts.en:
Elizabeth Maame Ama is single and has been through junior high school. She sells cosmetics at Abura, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to pay for her accommodation and utility bills.

Elizabeth Maame Ama will use the loan to purchase a variety of cosmetics to sell. The new revenue she expects to get as a result of the loan will be used to rent or buy a shop to sell in.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: José Joaquín

texts.es: José Joaquín C. D., tiene la edad de 66 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y  4 hijos de 32,26,21 y 17 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José Joaquín también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Joaquín C. D. is 66 years old, married, and has four children aged 32, 26, 21 and 17. His family is his top priority. He needs this loan to help with his farm, or more specifically with growing coffee, for which he needs to buy fertilizer. He wants to look after his coffee crop well in order to improve the quality and generate as much revenue as possible at harvest time. This is his first loan with Kiva Field Partner, FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with this credit facility. Don José Joaquín has worked as a farmer for several years. He looks forward to a future where he can provide his family with a better standard of living and greater economic stability, in addition to being able to continue his development as a person as well as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help with his coffee crop

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 49-year-old married lady with four children.  

For the past twenty years, she has been practicing dairy farming.  She joined the Amazing Grace group in Faulu Kenya.  In this group, the members save money on weekly basis, share business ideas, and guarantee each other's loans.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.  She hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette S. est une jeune commerçante âgée de 30 ans et mére de famille qui exerce un commerce de vente de tissu de teinture, de chaussures et autres .En principe ses articles elle les achéte au Mali, en Gambie pour être revendu à des prix détaillés dans la ville de Mbour . Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités ce qui lui permet de générer des revenus et faire face à ses besoins personnels en soutenant ainsi son mari dans la gestion de la famille et de l'éducation des enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette S. is a young, 30 year-old retailer and a mother. She operates a business selling dyed fabric, shoes and other items. As a rule, she buys her goods in Mali and Gambia to be sold at retail prices in the city of Mbour. She is requesting this loan to expand her business. This will enable her to generate income and provide for her personal needs while helping her husband with the family's support and the children's education.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Bayram

texts.ru:
Bayram S. 20 let. On ne jenat i jivet v Fuzuli regione vmesto so svoyey semyoy. Baymar imeyet 2 sestri kotoriye mladshe neqo.

Bayram uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet v kafe. Ranshe  Bayram  imel malenkuyu butku qde on qotovil " Tantuni" i prodoval tam je a teper on  rasshiril svoyo pomesheniye i reshil sdelat iz neqo kafe i poeotmu on Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svoyeqo novoqo kafe.On xochet razvit svoy bizness.
texts.en:
Bayram S. is twenty-years-old. He is unmarried and lives in the Fuzuli region along with his family. He has two younger sisters. For two years Bayram has worked in a cafe. Previously he had a small kiosk where he made and sold "Tantuni" [sauteed beef wraps]. Now he's expanded his space and decided to make it into a cafe, so he needs a 2000 AZN to buy tables and chairs for his new place. He would like to grow his business.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 37 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Primitivo de 38 años, que trabaja en instalación de cables y también con sus 2 hijos menores. Desde hace 1 año se asoció con una amiga en el negocio de crianza y venta de pollos. Dice que el trabajo es tranquilo, ya que solo deben brindar lo necesario para que los polluelos crezcan sin dificultad y así después de un mes los venden a buenos precios a sus amigos y conocidos, que los requieren para consumo o para comercializarlos. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces los pollos enferman debido a que son bastante delicados; pero lo que le agrada es que crecen con rapidez, de esta manera puede obtener ganancias con regular frecuencia. Dice que es un negocio bastante rentable, ya que las rentas  le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Como es una mujer bastante emprendedora, en adelante tiene planeado ampliar este negocio, y para esto quiere, junto con su amiga, comprar un terreno para aumentar la cantidad de polluelos y criarlos con mayor espacio. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas para no defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Graciela tiene planeado invertir  el crédito solicitado en la compra de alimento y engorde para los pollos, y de esta manera espera que crezcan con mayor rapidez, para después comercializarlos y generarse buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
37 year old Graciela lives with her husband, 38 year old Primitivo, who installs cables, and their 2 small children. For the past year she has worked with a friend raising and selling chickens. She says that the work is straightforward as they only have to provide what is necessary for the chickens to grow without difficulty and then, after one month, they sell them at a good price to their friends and acquaintances, who need them for food or to sell. She doesn't like that the chickens often become sick because they are quite delicate, but she is pleased that they grow quickly and so they can get regular income. She says that this business is quite profitable and the income enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to grow the business and for this she and her friend need to buy some land to increase the number of chickens they can keep and raise them in more space. This is the second loan that she has had from MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually so as to not disappoint all the people who have made the loan possible and are helping her to continue working. Graciela plans to use the loan to buy food and fatten-up the chickens, and so have them grow more quickly so they can sell them and generate good profits.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Rakel

texts.en:
Rakel B. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Rakel is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Rakel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rakel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rakel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rakel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rakel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman A. is married and has two children. The family lives in Sarnakunk village, Syunik region, Armenia. It is the third time that Arman is receiving a loan from SEF International. Arman is a farmer, keeping cattle and cultivating the land. While his wife looks after the children and the house, Arman the breadwinner is planning for the winter. He has applied for this loan to buy seeds for autumn sowing and purchase cattle feed.

loans.use: buying seeds and cattle feed

loans.name: Manuela De Jesús

texts.es: La señora L. posee una panadería en la que hace diferentes tipos de pan de esta actividad se mantiene ella y una hija ya que el esposo trabaja por aparte y sus otros hijos ya se le fueron de su casa, ella solicita un crédito con CEPRODEL ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada ya que le están ofreciendo vender un poco mas barato la harina.
texts.en: Mrs. L. has a bakery and makes various types of bread. Through her work she supports herself and one daughter as her husband works elsewhere and her other children have already left home. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she can make the most of the season since flour prices are currently a little cheaper than usual.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (flour)

loans.name: John Macharia

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Olkalou town since 1990.  He is 43 years old, married to Alice Wanjiri, and they have two children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to plant carrots and snow peas.

In future, John hopes to buy his own piece of land and save on the amount he uses to rent a farm every  planting season.

loans.use: To plant carrots and snow peas in his farm

loans.name: Omolitan

texts.fr: Omolitan a 20 ans. Il fait la couture et la broderie et compte dans cette activité près de 2ans. IL est né à Assahoun mais vit à adidogomé à Lomé. Il  a employé 5 personnes qui l’aide dans ses activités. Il s’approvisionne habituellement  au grand marché de Lomé. Avec le crédit demandé, il pense acheter une machine à broder
texts.en: Omolitan is 20 years old. He has had a sewing and embroidery business for almost two years. He was born in Assahoun, but now he lives in Adidogomé in Lomé. He employs five people who help him with his business. He usually purchases his business' supplies in the large market in Lomé. With the loan requested, he intends to purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: San Cayetano/ Belén Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano se conformó en fecha 24  octubre del 2.010, se encuentran en el 1°ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Feliciana  Martínez quien se dedica a la compra y venta, de carne de animales, queso huevo etc.  nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
  Según la Sra. Feliciana    mencionó que la actividad que realiza  la Fundación  es muy importante ya que ella nunca encontró este espacio en otro lado por  ser muy pobre.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Women's Committee was founded on October 24th 2010.  They are in their first loan cycle and working together in solidarity within the program.

As well as each woman having her own individual work, the group carry out activities together in order to make funds so that they have some capital within the group.  They also help each other to achieve their goals.  Their main goal is to work in order to financially support their families.

The story of Feliciana M. is a very moving one.  Feliciana buys and sells meat, cheese and eggs, etc.  She tells us that with her loan she has been able to improve her business quite a lot, as well as her standard of living and her income.

Feliciana comments that the work which Fundación Paraguaya does is very important because she never found this kind of opportunity elsewhere, since she is very poor.

loans.use: To buy meat, cheese and eggs

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina G. is a 32-year-old married woman from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She and her husband have two school-age children. To earn a living, Felina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Her primary source of income is derived from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes and bath towels in her local community. Felina has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Felina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. By doing so, she is better able to engage n business activities and hopes to improve her family's standard of living going forward. Felina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase additional products such as short pants and jeans. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Felina from HSPFI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Paiy

texts.en: Paiy S., 30, is a professional silk weaver, making $2 USD each day in Takeo province. She is married and supports two children living at home. Her husband, Phen Phon, makes approximately $3 USD every day, selling cows. Paiy S. would like a loan of $900 USD to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Mabinty K.. She is married and has three children ages 2, 4, and 8. In 2003, Mabinty established her assorted food items business where she sells mayonnaise, eggs, milk, etc. She began her business because she wanted to make a profit. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy more stock for her shop. Mabinty hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mabinty plans to educate her children to university level and build a house. She would also like to open another shop and hire employees. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock to her stall.

loans.name: Terimbere Munyarwandakazi B Group

texts.fr: Patricie Murekatete est agricultrice, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle a 41 ans, elle est mariée, et née a Rwanda.  Elle a 4 enfants entre 7 ans et 18 ans, tous vont à l’école, et elle a fini 4 ans d’école secondaire.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une pompe pour l’insecticide, 500 grammes de pépinière, 20 kgs d’oignons, 20 kgs de fertilisantes, et main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter la capacité de son affaire.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans son secteur, assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Patricie Murekatete is a farmer and a client of ACB since 2010. She is 41 years old and married. She was born in Rwanda. She has four children ranging from 7 to 18 years of age, all of whom attend school. She has finished four grades of secondary school. She will use her loan to buy an insecticide pump, 500g of seeds, 20 kg of onions, 20 kg of fertilizers, and pay for manual labor. Her business strategy is to increase her production volume. She would like to become an important farmer in her area, provide for the well-being of her family and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchasing an insecticide pump, fertilizers, etc

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova is a 27-year-old single woman who graduated from a vocational school. She lives with her parents in a remote village of Naikliu. It is situated about 85 km from Kupang. Nova has 6 siblings. She is very interested in running a beauty salon and according to her, there are no other people running this type of business in the village. 

Using her own capital, Nova opened a beauty salon business in the village of Naibonat. Her business place is located nearby the main road. She believes that her business place is a strategic place that provides her the best opportunity to run the business. According to Nova, her business is still small and very simple. Currently, she only has limited equipment to run the business. With this limitation, the profit generated is still small. Besides that, she still has to pay for the rental fee of IDR 2,500,000 per year. Nova expects to soon have more and better equipment so that she can improve her business. To do so, Nova needs additional capital. 

She is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She plans to use the loan to buy new equipment and other beauty products to support her salon. She hopes that the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and other beauty products

loans.name: Utamaduni Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa R. is 43 years old. She is a widowed with three children, a son and two daughters, all grown up and married. She has been selling clothes since 1992. She always works from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm. She buys her clothes from Kariakoo market and sells them in the neighbourhood.

This will be Mtumwa's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She repaid her three previous loans successfully and she used them to increase stock in order for her business to grow. She wishes to use the current loan to buy more stock so she can increase her profit which will enable her to finish the family house she is building.

Mtumwa will share this loan with other members of "Utamaduni" group, seventeen in total. The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan. In the photo, Mtumwa can be seen in the back row, first on the left.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta D. productos plásticos, gorras, carteras, este negocio ha ido mejorando desD. que inicio hace 7 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en variedad D. productos plásticos, ya que la demanda por parte D. los clientes cada día le exige nuevos artículos, con este préstamo espera abastecer el negocio, aumentando el inventario, así mismo mejorar las ventas.
El objetivo D. Maritza en contar con una amplia gama D. artículos, que sus clientes estén satisfechos y que encuentren en su negocio lo que necesitan, también desea mejorar su condición familiar y con el préstamo pues cancelarlo oportunamente.
texts.en:
Maritza is 38 years old, and lives in Jiqulisco in the department of Usulután.  She lives with her husband and two children, and makes a living selling plastic products, caps, and purses.  Her business has improved since she started it 7 years ago.

Maritza is now requesting a loan to invest in a variety of plastic products, since she needs new items due to her customers’ daily demand.  She hopes to use the loan to restock her business and increase her inventory, and thus improve her sales.

Maritza’s goal is to have a wiD. range of items, and to keep her customers satisfied and able to find what they need at her business.  She also hopes to improve her family’s standard of living, and this loan will give Maritza an opportunity to do just that.

loans.use: Purchasing a variety of plastic products

loans.name: Maria Emelina

texts.es:
La señora Emelina, resiD. en  San Simón departamento D. Morazán, tiene 52 años D. edad, se dedica a atender un comedor, está casada y vive actualmente con su esposo y 4 hijas y un nieto, D. sus hijas dos le ayudan en el comedor y las otras estudian.
Este comedor nació hace 9 años, lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, D. San Simón, venD. sus productos con los empleados D. la zona y personas que transitan el lugar, el horario es D. 6:00am a 8:00pm. Por el momento solicita un préstamo, el cual necesita para comprar maíz, frijol, carne y pollo, este le ayudara para aumentar su inventario y a disponer D. mayores productos para la preparación D. los menús, en estos días ella quiere aprovechar que hay mayor demanda porque existe un buen número D. trabajadores que ejecutan proyectos del gobierno, quienes le solicitan más comida. 
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio, generar los suficiente para ayudar a sus hijas y nietos, dándoles una mejor condición D. vida y en un futuro mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Emelina is 52 years old, married, and lives in San Simón, located in the Department of Morazán, with her husband, four children, and grandson. Two of her daughters help her with her restaurant and the others are students. She started her restaurant nine years ago and it is located in the San Simón municipal market. She sells her products to people who work in the area and passersby, working from 6am to 8pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, beef and chicken. This will help her to increase her inventory and have more products to prepare the meals. She wants to take advantage of the fact that there is higher demand due to the number of workers completing government projects requesting more food.

Her goals are to strengthen the business, generating enough income to help her daughters and grandson and proviD. them with better living conditions, and to making housing improvements in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, age 51, runs a sari-sari (general store) business. She has operated this business for seven years and also earns an income from water refilling. She and her husband have four children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business so that she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 38-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil. He is the father of 3 children. 

Imad is the owner of  a clothing store, where he sells clothes for men and women.  He opened his own business in March 2010.  He has a good reputation for his special customer service and good quality of the products. Most of  his clients live in Bint Jbeil.  Imad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy more items for the Spring/Summer collection. He hopes to expand his shop in the future, to provide his kids the best education and his small family a healthy and secure living.

loans.use: To buy new spring/summer items

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two grown sons. She sells used clothing in her home town of Ivano-Frankivsk and small regional marketplaces. Mariya sells sweaters, dresses, t-shirts, jackets, etc. She doesn’t have her own vending facility which is why she is forced to rent small stalls and kiosks to display her inventory. Mariya has been in this business for 11 years. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Mariya’s business is the only source of income for her family. This time she is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase 600 kg of second hand clothing merchandise wholesale for further retail sale. Mariya is very balanced and disciplined. She used to work at a factory but she was downsized and decided to launch a market vending business which turned out to be a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase 600 kg of second hand clothing merchandise

loans.name: Marjoren

texts.en:
Marjoren is from the village of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Marjoren is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marjoren owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marjoren has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marjoren joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjoren has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. Marjoren is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marjoren from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is a loving mother and hardworking housekeeper with a great desire to get ahead in life. Her great spirit, strong will and hard work have allowed her to improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

For the past seven years, this persevering woman has been working very hard raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her daughter, who is her greatest joy. 

She usually sells her cattle in the livestock bazaar once every three months. Her husband actively helps her in this hard business. Arzu asks for a loan of 1300 AZN in order to buy more young cattle to raise and sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase three young cattle and fodder

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 21 years. He is 54 years old, married to Mirriam, and they have five school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. 

He will sell his produce in the local market. In future, James hopes to practice large scale farming in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 28 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. Theogene sells goats. His business is well known and well organized. He employs one person as a helper and has fifteen years' experience in this business.

Theogene has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more goats to sell. With his profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell.

loans.name: Nelly Lucia

texts.es:
Desde hace muchos años Nelly ha trabajado las confecciones  en línea propia, su negocio actualmente tiene muy buen reconocimiento y las prendas que vende son de muy buena calidad.

Ella quiere siempre tener muy buen surtido para sus clientes, para así poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Nelly se sueña con un taller mas grande donde tenga varias máquinas y pueda generar empleo a madres cabeza de familia, mientras llega su sueño por lo menos necesita que sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en:
Nelly has been working at sewing her own line of clothing and her business is now very well known.  The clothing she makes is of very good quality.

She always wants to have a good selection for her customers and in this way be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Nelly dreams of having a bigger workshop where she will have several machines and be able to create jobs for single mothers.  While she is working on reaching her goal, she at least needs to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.es: Rosemary: de 35 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas,tiene ya 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y le da gracias a Dios porque le ha Hido Vien En su negocio,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y verduras,ya que nececita mas mercaderia para surtir su puesto de ventas y tener mas bariedad,para satisfacer la nececidad de sus clentes.el sueño de ellas es tener un local mas grande y darles le nececario a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosemary is 35 years old, she has 2 children and she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been working in this area for 7 years already, and she "gives thanks to God" because her business has been going well for her. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, as she needs more products to stock her stall and to offer a wider variety of products to satisfy her customers’ needs. Her dream is to own a bigger shop and to provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Mr. Ganzorig is 31 and runs a taxi business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with only his wife and they own a small house in the rookery. His wife is pregnant and will deliver her baby soon. Ganzorig has been managing his taxi service business since 2007. His daily earning is not quite enough for their life. 

Currently, he wants to do renovations to his house before his baby’s birth. If he can repair his house, it will be in a better condition to raise their babies and more comfortable to live in. 

Ganzorig is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to  repair his old house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to repair his old house.

loans.name: Hugo De Jesús

texts.es:
El invierno es una de las dificultades que debe enfrentar Hugo, quien desde hace algunos años tienen un punto de venta de comida en el centro de Medellín, allí vende a los transeúntes algunos comestibles propios de la región y es así como trabaja día a día para ofrecerle a su familia y a su hija una mejor calidad de vida. 

Hugo espera en el futuro seguir adelante con el negocio y mantenerlo en el tiempo. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar un carrito en acero inoxidable.
texts.en:
Winter is a difficult time for Hugo. For the past few years, he has been selling food from a location in central Medellín. He sells to pedestrians traditional foods of the region. Hugo works day after day so that he can offer a better quality of life to his family and to his daughter.

In the future, Hugo hopes to move forward with his business and maintain it. He currently needs a loan to buy a stainless steel food cart.

loans.use: to buy a stainless steel food cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia's husband has a bamboo supply business. He supplies bamboo to different cities and earns income for the family. Safia herself is a housewife and performs her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active person and does her household work with great responsibility. She is the mother of 3 children: 2 of them are studying in a local school. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy bamboo in larger quantities to be able to fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and Safia is confident that his business will grow further after the loan investment. 

Note: "One of the members has a clothes selling business, that's why they are holding cloth."

loans.use: to buy bamboo to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 47 años, es una mujer alegre y sacrificada, tiene un hijo, pero vive sola en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huaracayo. Los años de dedicación y servicio hacía su hijo, le enseñaron que no hay mejor recompensa en la vida que verlos salir adelante. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de maíz y arveja; los que después de cuidarlos y abonarlos, los lleva al mercado central de la capital, donde los vende al por mayor. Según cuenta viaja 2 veces a la semana para comercializar sus cosechas, además aprovecha su tiempo para visitar a su hijo que estudia en la universidad. Ahora ella quiere abrir una pequeña ferretería, en la zona central de la ciudad de Tarma, porqué sabe muy bien que sus fuerzas ya no son las mismas, se siente sola y desea estar junto a su hijo, para poder encaminarlo y poyarlo en lo que necesita. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Vamos al futuro huracaino” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su asociación que es muy respetada en su localidad. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y pago de peones para que la ayuden en su próximo sembrío de maíz.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 47, is a happy and self-sacrificing woman.  She has a son, but she lives alone in her own house, located in the town of Huaracayo.  Her years of dedication and service to her son taught her that there is no better reward in life than seeing others succeed.  

She has ten years of experience in farming.  Her main crops are corn and peas.  After caring for them and fertilizing them, she brings them to the central market in the capital, where she sells them wholesale.  She makes this trip twice a week to sell her crops, and she also takes advantage of this time by visiting her son who studies at the university.  Now, she wants to open a small hardware store in the central area of the city of Tarma because she knows that she is not as strong as she used to be.  She feels alone and wants to be close to her son to advise him and support him when he needs it.

She is a member of the community bank "Vamos al futuro huracaino" and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to be a member of this group because it is very respected in her community.  She promises to be on time with her payments.  Yolanda will use this loan to purchase natural fertilizers and pay laborers who will help her with her next corn harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase craft materials such as key rings, chains, wire, acrylic paints, and paint brushes.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet de 25 años de edad, convive hace 5 años con Daniel, ambos vieron nacer a 2 hijos que ahora tienen 6 y 2 años. Esta familia vive en una casa alquilada en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini. A Janet le gusta lo que hace, todos los días de feria viaja a la ciudad de Pichanaki y vende ropa la que compra en cantidades mayores de la ciudad de Lima. De igual forma cuenta con un negocio en la ciudad de Lima, ahí vive su hermana y juntas realizan los movimientos de compra y venta; “el oficio es rentable, por que se obtiene ganancias semanalmente”, explica Janet. Muchas veces la falta de capital impidió que ésta joven madre sea constante con el negocio. Otro tiempo de inconvenientes aún no han vivido, pero es consciente de que tarde o temprano vendrán periodos difíciles.
Por su parte, Daniel se dedica integralmente al campo, sembrando plátanos y maíz, constituyendo otros ingresos que giran alrededor de la agricultura, ya sea para seguir sembrando o para gastos de abonos. Con su ayuda, Janet podrá obtener su préstamo número 4 de MFP, entidad de la que se siente agradecida y respaldada por la ayuda que brinda a los sectores más humildes pero progresistas. Ella y su banco comunal guardan sentimientos de confianza y gratitud. Con el dinero, Janet podrá invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor en todas sus variedades, polos, chompas, pantalones, etc., y expenderlas en la ciudad de Pichanaki.
texts.en:
Janet is twenty five years old and lives with her partner, Daniel, and their two children, who are six and two years old. Their family lives in a rented house in the native community of Pucharini. Janet enjoys what she does, every festival day she travels to the city of Pichanaki and sells clothes that she purchases in large quantities in Lima. She also has a business with her sister who lives in Lima, and together they take care of all the purchasing and selling. Janet says, “the work is profitable because it brings in weekly earnings.” Many times, the lack of capital kept this young mother from being consistent with her business. They have not faced another time of hardship, but she is conscious that sooner or later difficult times will come.
Daniel only works in the field, planting bananas and corn, which makes other agricultural-related income, be it to continue planting or to cover fertilizer costs. With your help, Janet will be able to obtain her fourth loan from MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She feels very grateful for and supported by the help MFP offers the most humble but progressive sectors. She and her communal bank feel confidence and gratitude. The money will allow Janet to purchase a wide variety of clothes wholesale – shirts, sweaters, pants, etc., and sell them in Pichanaki.
.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 40 years old and owns a butcher shop where she sells meat.  She has been in this business for more than seven years. Jeanne has requested this loan to buy cows for slaughtering. With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for the children, and provide food for the family. She dreams of seeing her business grow, so she can have her own butcher house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cows to provide meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy serving plates, tea cups, tea spoons, as well as food such as potatoes, onions, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Evangeline has been in this business for 20 years. Evangeline earns more income from rice retailing.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Nyantiop

texts.en:
Nyantiop is a 30-year-old a married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Nyantiop requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 25-year-old a married woman with two children; both of them are in school. She's had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Awoumessi

texts.fr:
Awoumessi est une femme âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariés å un plombier. Elle a 3 enfants.
Awoumessi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des poissons fumés et séchés pour tous clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits au Ghana. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Awoumessi a requis son 2nd  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons fumés et séchés. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Awoumessi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awoumessi is a 54-year-old woman. She is married to a plumber and has three children.
Awoumessi has worked as a retailer since 2000. She sells smoked and dried fish to all types of customers at the market in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Ghana. She works by herself. Currently, she has no difficulties in her business.
Awoumessi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy smoked and dried fish. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Awoumessi would like to expand the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: César, de 34 años es un hombre trabajador. Junto a Julia, su esposa desde hace 10 años; cuidan de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Acostambo. “Me falta muchos objetivos por cumplir”, afirma. Aún no posee el dinero necesario para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pero eso no lo desanima al contrario. Trabaja cada día con más esfuerzo, ahorrando lo que pueda para comprar uno. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa, olluco, oca, mashua, cebada, habas y alverja. Cuenta que alquila terrenos de su comunidad, porque cuestan menos y de esa manera apoya en el crecimiento de sus pobladores. En cada cosecha aprovecha sus viajes a la capital para vender sus alimentos. Viaja 2 veces a la semana, llevando maca, alverja y papa; los cuales vende al menudeo en el mercado “la parada”, que es la más grande del país. Como es un hombre de campo, cuenta que posee 3 caballos y 3 burros los cuales utiliza como animales de carga para trasportar los fertilizantes hacia sus sembríos. “de esa manera me canso menos”, comenta. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y está contento de saber, que tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. César de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa de la variedades “yungay, canchan, andina y huairo macho”.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 34, is a hardworking man. Together with Julia, his wife of ten years, he cares for their children in their own home, which is located in the district of Acostambo. "I have many goals to fulfill," he declares. 

Although he doesn't have the money necessary to buy his own agricultural land, he doesn't let this discourage him. Every day he puts more effort into his work, and saves what he can towards buying land. Already Cesar has seven years of experience growing potatoes, other tuber vegetables such as ulluco, oca, and mashua, barley, broad beans, and peas. He says that he rents plots of land from his community because it costs less and this way he also supports growth for its inhabitants. 

For every harvest he takes advantage of his trips to the capital to sell his crops. He travels twice a week, bringing maca, peas and potatoes, which he sells at "La parada", the largest market in the country. 

As he's a country man, he takes advantage of owning three horses and three donkeys and uses them as cargo animals to transport fertilizer to the fields. "This way I get less tired," he explains. 

This is Cesar's fifth loan with MFP, and is happy to know that he will have financial support and feels secure continuing with his work. Apart from anything else he promises to comply with his payments. Furthermore he appreciates being a part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. 

Upon receiving the funds, Cesar will invest the money requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread on his crops, which include several varieties of potato such as yungay, canchán, Andean and huario macho.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is conservative person she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man inthe photo is her brother.
Suhad is  a 30-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan.

Suhad is looking to improve her family's living conditions by requesting a loan of 800 JD for doing maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Marianela Lourdes

texts.en:
Marianela was accepted into the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés and now with the chance to achieve her dream of a professional degree is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

She plans on graduating in July 2013, but without a loan she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. Marianela plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. 

With a career in business, she expects to earn $13 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling attending college already, Marianela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a loan.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Ayitcheme 6 Group

texts.fr: AYITCHEME 6 est un groupement composé de vingt deux personnes qui sont résident dans un même quartier.  La  représentante du groupe, Augustine O. (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 a très peu fréquenté l’école. Augustine O. mère de deux enfants, ne vit plus avec son mari. Tous ces enfants sont scolarisés et à sa charge. Augustine O. vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par dame Augustine O. Pour cette raison, Augustine O. vend des des sacs de charbon à son domicile depuis dix ans. Augustine O. s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Augustine O. sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYITCHEME 6 un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbon.

loans.name: Sasho

texts.en: Sasho I. has been a military officer for 22 years. He is 50 years old now. After he retires from the army he starts his farming business and runs it for 8 years so far. Now he breeds 23 cows and 120 sheep in his farm. In business help him his wife and his two son who is 24 and his daughter who is 22 years old. Sasho I. and his family need a milking machine for their farm and apply for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: For a milking machine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. O. L. is married to a civil servant and has two children. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a loan of $900 to expand her business. She keeps very good accounts of her business and knows about the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dried corn stocks, for her business expansion

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia lives in the city of Santa Catarina, in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is married and has two children ages 9 and 16. She would like her children to have a quality education and improve their quality of life, which would be impossible on her husband's salary alone. For the past 10 years, Cynthia has been involved in the sale of footwear via catalog. Little by little, her business has grown and her clientele has increased.

She is now filling large orders and needs a loan of $925 which she will use to acquire merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and continue to grow. She is committed to repaying the loan in 8 months. You can become a part of this business by deciding to help this family today. They sincerely appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Cynthia vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina en el estado de Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 16 años de edad. Ella desea que sus hijos puedan tener una educación de calidad y mejorar su calidad de vida lo que sería imposible sólo con el salario que recibe su esposo, por lo que desde hace 10 años Cynthia se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio incrementando su número de clientes.

Ahora surte grandes pedidos y necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 8 meses. Tú puedes formar parte de este negocio, decídete a ayudar a esta familia hoy, ellos te agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Sindra

texts.en: Sindra is 26 years old, and has 3 kids, one in school and two young ones. She started her plantation business 2 years ago and now she has joined SPBD for a loan to help her and her family expand their business.  She sells her taro and bananas twice a week on Friday and Saturday, and they earn a profit of $140 a week. She uses it for family needs and other expenses but never forgets her loan repayment to SPBD every week.  Her husband earns $72 a week from his work.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sahila

texts.en: Sahila is 57 years old, widowed, and lives in the Khaladj  village in the Salyan region  with her  five  children. She has run her own farm for the past 20 years and has used the income it generates to care for her family. Sahila has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer which she will use to improve the size and quality of her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Pov, 44, and her husband, Bey Pich, live in a modest wood stilt home. They have five children who still live at home, in addition to two young orphaned relatives. Pov has been a weaver since she was 14 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Now, she is teaching her own daughter, 19, to weave as well. They own two looms. Pich is a moto-taxi driver and operates between their Mekong island of Koh Dach and Phnom Penh.

Pov is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $300. They will use this loan to purchase materials for home repairs. The existing corrugated roof is in bad shape and much of it needs replacement. Pov says the new roof will cost $500, but that they have saved $200 already. As Pov has successfully repaid previous loans, we feel sure she will repay this new loan as well.

loans.use: Buy materials for home repair.

loans.name: Sada's Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Sada, 27, is married and has 3 children (ages 12, 9, and 7). She also takes care of her parents. Sada runs a food business and sells various types of dishes and snacks between 7am and 3 pm daily. She began this business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $140. She hopes to expand her business with a loan.

Sada will be sharing this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in donuts, eggs, and other food sales. They belong to a loan group called Tujikomboe, which totals 30 members who ensure that others in the group meet their obligations.

loans.use: To increase food inventory

loans.name: Atukuzwe

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Atukuzwe S. is 26 years old. She is widowed with two children, ages 8 and 11. In 2004, Atukuzwe established a clothing business. Atukuzwe now requests a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle to transport her goods.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Mrs. Rim K. and her husband have been married for forty years. They have six children; two sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other three have full-time employment, and the youngest one is studying.

Mrs. Rim and her husband have been doing farming for twenty years. They grow bananas, corns, and tomatoes in the farm near their home. Besides doing farming, her husband is a Khmer traditional musician. They are in early 60’s but still strong enough to work. The family lives in Mekong River’s Island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Rim is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $1000 for growing bananas, corns, and tomatoes.

loans.use: For growing corns, bananas, and tomatoes

loans.name: Marie Joseph

texts.fr:
Marie Joseph B., age 46, has one child and has been a member of the village bank of Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara for four years. Her business consists of selling ice and ice cream that she makes with monkey bread (baobab fruit) and sugar. Her income enables her to improve family living conditions by contributing her children's healthcare and schooling. Marie is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Marie Joseph B., 46 ans, 01 enfant est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis quatre ans. Ses activités consistent à vendre de la glace et des crèmes glaces qu'elle prépare avec le pain de de singe (fruit du baobab) et du sucre.Ses revenus lui permettent d' amélioration les conditions de vie de la famille en contribuant aux soins de santé et à la scolarité des enfants. Marie sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy sugar and monkey bread

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 2 children, ages 22 and 18 years old. Elizabeth owns a small general store that she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 6.30am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Elizabeth has already taken out and repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business making and selling tablecloths, cushions, and window curtains.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa T., 40, is married with 2 children and lives in Safaaoa Uta, Samoa. She has been growing giant taro (taro taamu) and bananas for two years. She sells her crop to the villagers and the general public 2 days per week.

Temukisa has a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (US$62). SPBD loans are Temukisa’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to purchase agricultural chemicals and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy agricultural chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Groupement De Keur Madiagne

texts.fr:
These women have a good history with the IMCEC credit organization, dating from two years ago. They buy vegetables, fish, oil and second-hand clothes, which they resell in their neighborhoods around the village of Mbour. They are going to use this loan to augment their working capital, thereby increasing their stock and diversifying the products they carry. They are part of the large Lingueres de Mbour association. They are mothers of families, very lively and hardworking.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Elles ont une bonne expérience avec l’IMCEC (deux ans). Elles achètent des légumes, du poisson, de l’huile et de la piperie qu’elles revendent dans leurs quartiers situés à la périphérie de la commune de Mbour. Elles vont investir le crédit dans le renforcement de leur fonds de roulement et ainsi, améliorer le niveau de les stocks et la diversité de leurs produits. Elles font parti du grand groupement des Lingueres de Mbour .Elles sont des mères de familles très dynamiques et travailleuses.

loans.use: Fortification of working capital

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Пулатова Мавлюда 1959 года рождения, замужем и у них 6 детей. У нее довольно большой опыт в сфере предпринимательской деятельности.  Начала свой бизнес в 1990 году с продажи материй. Мавлюда торгует разными видами поплин, на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У нее много постоянных  клиентов. Часто покупают швеи и просто любители пошива женской одежды. Ведь ее товар является ходовым в летнее время. Свой товар Мавлюда закупает в оптовых рынках «Корвона». 
Для увеличения товарооборота и закупа сезонных тканей хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Mavluda P. was born in 1959, is married and has six children. She has quiet an extensive experience in running own business. She started her business in 1990 selling fabrics. Mavluda sells different kinds of poplins at the Kovron market in the city of Dushanbe. She has many regular customers who are often seamstresses or who just love making women's clothing. Her merchandise is very popular during summer time. Mavluda buys the merchandise on the wholesale markets of Kovron. She wants to get a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni ($1,200USD) to increase commodity circulation and for buying seasonal fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily K. is 40 years old, married and has 5 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Emily has a grinding machine which she uses to grind tomatoes, peppers, beans etc.  She needs a loan in the amount of $450 to buy another grinding machine.  This, she says, will enable her to meet the demands of her customers.

Emily thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy one grinding machine

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia R. R. is a member of community bank, Llapanchik, a Quechuan word meaning “everyone together”. Sonia lives in Ayacucho with her husband and three children who are all in school. In her house, Sonia has a workshop for making dresses. 

She will use her loan of 2000 soles to purchase more sewing machines, currently her machines are rented. She will also be able to buy some fabric for her workshop. She dreams of having a larger place outside of her home for a workshop. She and her husband are also saving to start their own hardware store.
texts.en:
Sonia R. R. is a member of a Community Bank called Llapanchik, a Quechuan word meaning “everyone together”. Sonia lives in Ayacucho with her husband and three children who are all in school. In her house, Sonia has a workshop for making dresses.

She will use her loan of 2000 soles to purchase more sewing machines, currently her machines are rented. She will also be able to buy some fabric for her workshop. She dreams of having a larger place outside of her home for a workshop. She and her husband are also saving to start their own hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan of 2000 soles to purchase more sewing machines, currently her machines are rented.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Arco Iris, fue conformado este año, gracias a la inquietúd D. algunos D. sus integrantes, quienes son familiares, y tienen negocios en común.

ELECTO S..- Es el presidente del banco comunal, el es nacido en la provincia D. VallegranD. del Departamento D. Santa Cruz. Actualmente vive en la zona D. El Torno, el vive con su hijo y su esposa en una pequeña casa propia, la cual ha sido adquirida con el fruto D. su trabajo, ellos tienen una panadería, desD. hace 20 años.

Sabina Farrel.- es la tesorera del Banco comunal, vive en la zona D. El Torno, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, negocio que realiza D. manera ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
Su esposo trabaja como ayudante D. chofer, el sueño D. ambos es llegar a contar con vehiculo propio.
texts.en:
The Rainbow Venture Bank was established this year thanks to the concern of the founders, who are family and have the business in common. Electo S.- President of the community bank. He was born in the province of VallegranD. in the Santa Cruz region. Currently, he lives in El Torno zone with his son and wife in his small home that he bought with the fruits of his labor. They have operated a bread shop for the past 20 years. Sabina Farrel- Treasurer of the community bank. She lives in the El Torno zone, has four children, and has her own house. She makes a living by selling cosmetics, a business that she realizes by traveling to people's homes in the same way as her colleagues. Her husband works as a driver. He dream is for both of them to have their own cars.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise capital

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Juan M. me dedico a la Sastreria, tengo un taller desde hace 11 años, poco a poco hemos contruido mi casa con nuestra madre, ahora necesitamos remodelar un cuarto y un baño para tener mejor acondicionada a nuestra mama, ella es una señora mayor de 60 años, en mi negocio me va bien y mis clientes me prefieren por la atencion que les brindo y por supuesto la ropa que les hago que les gusta mucho porque les queda muy bien tallada. el credito que solicito lo ocupo para reacondicionar nustra casa. gracias
texts.en:
Hello. My name is JuanM. and I am a tailor. I have had a shop for 11 years. Little by little we have built our home with our mother. Now we need to remodel a room and bathroom in order to better accommodate our mother, as she is a 60 year old older woman. My business is going very well and my customers prefer my services for the attention I provide and of course they like the clothing that I make them a lot because it fits them very well. The loan I am seeking will be used to remodel our home. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to remodel a room and bathroom

loans.name: Karam

texts.en: Karam K. is a very optimistic man in spite of the circumstances he has endured. He is 51 years old and married with four children. Karam raises livestock, and he uses his income to support his family’s expenses. He has a great appreciation for animals and Karam wishes to increase his sheep count, and therefore increase his earnings. He hopes that you can help him by funding his loan. You could become an important part of his family's life. Karam deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 40 years old. She is widowed with six children. The eldest is a commercial driver, one child is a  hairdresser and the rest are still in junior high school. Rose is a local manufacturer of palm oil and has sold fruits like bananas and oranges for the past eight years to take care of her family. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruit. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil.  Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to lack of capital to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to the palm oil business, she also sells fruits like banana and oranges etc. in the community where she lives. She says this has also slowed down due to current food prices in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She wants the loan to purchase bananas and oranges etc. so that she can produce daily and supply to her customers on regular bases.
